loans.name: Emma Del Carmen

texts.es: Emma Del Carmen tiene 57 años. Es una Señora muy responsable y trabajadora ella tiene un gran espíritu emprendedor. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, todos los días llega a vender en el mercado, a pesar de las dificultades que atravesó como es el problema de transporte de las cosechas y el trasladarlas hasta el mercado.  Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de naranjas, melones, mangos, mamones, naranjas y mandarinas.
texts.en:
Emma Del Carmen is 57 years of age. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman who possesses great entrepreneurial spirit. Emma has been in the business of selling fruits and vegetables for more than ten years. She sells at the market every day despite the difficulties she has faced, such as the problem of transporting produce and getting the goods to market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy oranges, melons, mangoes, mamoncillos, and tangerines.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy various fruits

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar es un hombre muy trabajador y ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente. Tiene 50 años por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos, y su esposa trabaja como cocinera. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio, Julio inicio este negocio por cuenta propia pues siempre puso mucho empeño y sacrificio ya que este trabajo no es fácil y los diferentes procesos que realiza todos los días, pero este medio de trabajo es el que lo ayuda a salir adelante. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y comprar bolsas, hielo, azúcar, frutas, pajillas entre otros productos. El desea mejorar sus ingresos y además agrandar su inventario.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is a hardworking gentleman who has proven that he is an excellent client. He is 50 years old and has been selling soft drinks for more than two years. His wife works as a cook. Julio started this business on his own and always invests much effort and sacrifice into his work. Running his business is not easy and requires different tasks that he must perform each day. However, this method of working enables him to move forward.

This loan will be used as operating capital for purchasing sacks, ice, sugar, fruits, straws, and other items. He wants to improve his income and expand his inventory.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy sacks, ice, sugar, fruits, straws, and other items

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que se siente muy contenta por mejorar su negocio. Su mayor desafío es poder seguir manteniendo su medio de vida, ya que tiene que brindarles a sus 3 hijos lo necesario. Ella se levanta temprano todos los días pues siempre ha sido una persona muy luchadora.  La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su vivienda a comprar una gran variedad de productos como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes entre otros productos.
texts.en: Juana has a business that is a small grocery store.  This is not the first time that she has taken out loans and she feels very happy that she has improved her business.  Her main challenge is being able to continue maintaining her standard of life as she has to provide necessary support for her three children.  She gets up early every day and has always been a person who fights to succeed.  The majority of her customers come to her home to purchase a large variety of products like basic grains, sweets, sodas, bread, and soap among other products.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es: Jesús Maria tiene 46 años, es un hombre soltero. La actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio  como conductor de un amigo Jesús conducía el vehículo, pero al no ganar los suficiente para sufragar los gastos suficientes decide pediré ayuda por medio de los financiamientos, que le ayudo a conseguir el dinero suficiente para trabajar como taxista. Este financiamiento es para brindarle mantenimiento a su carro y comprar ciertos repuestos. Su deseo es mejorar los ingresos para brindar lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en: Jesús Maria is 46-years-old and a single man.  His work is in offering taxi services.  He has worked in this business for more than 20 years.  He began this business as a driver for his friend Jesús but because he did not earn enough to cover the expenses he decided to request assistance through loans that helped him to obtain the money he needed to work as a taxi driver.  This loan is for maintenance on his car and to purchase spare parts.  His wish is to improve his income so that he can give his family what they need.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es: Noel Antonio tiene su actividad de venta de productos varios. El es una persona luchadora que disfruta de su medio de vida.  Hace más de 4 años que tiene este medio de vida, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos ya que él ha comprobado que esta ayuda es fundamental para continuar activo su negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes productos, por lo que él siempre está pendiente de invertir en lo que ellos le solicitan. El crédito es para la compra de golosinas, leña, refrescos, pan, gas entre otros.
texts.en: Noel Antonio sells assorted products.  He is a tenacious person who enjoys his way of life.  He’s been in this way of life for over four years so this isn’t his first loan request because he’s convinced that the help is fundamental to stay active in business.  Most of his customers request different things so he is always careful to buy what they ask for.  This loan is to buy sweets, firewood, beverages, bread and gas, among others.

loans.use: To buy sweets, firewood, beverages, bread, gas and others.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Señora Maria Auxiliadora tiene 36 años. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería en general. Por lo que siempre ha buscado como ganarse el alimento diario. Es una Señora con espíritu emprendedor y cada uno de sus clientes disfruta del buen humor de Maria. En la comercialización de ropa, es ayudada por sus 2 hijos, ya que entrega a domicilio la mercadería, tanto en la ciudad como en algunas comarcas.  Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas y calzado. El mayor sueño que ella tiene es satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora, 36, has been selling general merchandise for over four years.  She has always sought ways to earn her daily bread.  She is a woman with an enterprising spirit and every one of her customers enjoys Maria’s good humor.  She works selling clothes, helped by her two children, door to door both in the city and in some of the outlying areas.

She is asking for the loan for working capital to buy shirts, pants, skirts and shoes.  Her greatest dream is to meet every customer’s need.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Benito Martin

texts.es: Benito Martín se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, pues se desempeña en lo que más le gusta y todos los días se levanta temprano para comenzar su labor. El siempre se ha caracterizado por tener un buen carisma con sus clientes. Tiene más de 4 años en este negocio, él le enseña a su hijo a ganarse la vida y mantener el negocio activo que es el que les proporciona el alimento diario. El financiamiento es para la compra de naranjas, cebollas, tomates, naranjas, melones mangos entre otros.
texts.en:
Benito Martín is a fruit and vegetable vendor.  This isn’t his first loan request.  He works at what he most enjoys and every day he rises early to start his work.  He has always been characterized by having a good charisma with his customers.  He’s been in this business for over 4 years.  He teaches his son how to earn a living and keep the business, which provides for their daily bread, going.  

The loan will be used to buy oranges, onion, tomatoes, melons and mangoes, among others.

loans.use: To buy oranges, onions, tomatoes, melons and mangoes, among others.

loans.name: Johana Mercedes

texts.es: Johana tiene 31 años, tiene 1 hijo y vive con ella y le ayuda en lo que puede con su negocio. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, es una mujer emprendedora pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio, ha sido muy satisfactorio para él. Siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, bolsos y ropa en general. Tiene una gran variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y disfruta de invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Johana, 31 years old, has one son who lives with her and helps her as much as possible with her business. She works selling general merchandise. She is a hard working woman so this is not the first time she has sought financing for her business which has been very satisfactory. She has always worked to increase her income and that of her family. 

The purpose for this loan is to purchase shoes, cosmetics, bags, and a variety of clothing. She has a wide range of products to offer her clients, and she enjoys investing in the business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Irma Ernestina

texts.es: Irma Ernestina tiene 61 años, por lo que su actividad es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 9 años, que se dedica a este negocio,  por lo que no tenía trabajo estable y al tener que hacerse cargo de sus 3 hijos tuvo que buscar esta actividad. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con los financiamientos pues siempre se mantiene su negocio, por lo que ha sabido administrar muy bien su dinero. Irma necesita este financiamiento pues con el comprara productos como camiseras, pantalones, shorts, cosméticos, tratamientos entre otros ya que se acerca la temporada de verano y es lo que más le solicitan. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda para no recorrer muchos lugares.
texts.en:
Irma Ernestina, 61, is a sells general merchandise.  She’s been in this business for over 9 years.  She used to not have steady employment and needed to support her three children so she had to find this activity.  She’s been working with loans for a long time because she stays in business always; she has known how to administer her money well.

Irma needs the loan to buy products like: pants, t-shirts, cosmetics, hair treatments, among others because the summer season is approaching and this is what’s most requested.  She dreams with setting up a store so as not to have to go from place to place anymore.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Imelda Pastora

texts.es: Imelda Pastora tiene una librería. Esta no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con créditos. Ella inicio este medio de vida con la intención de buscar un medio de ingreso para mantener a su familia. Imelda se levanta temprano todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana para realizar todas las tareas del hogar y atender a sus clientes.  La variedad de clientes que obtiene es muy variante todos los días, pues ella todos los días ofrece el mejor servicio. Este crédito es para la compra de hojas, cuadernos, lapiceros, folders, grapas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Imelda Pastora has a stationery store and this is not her first loan experience.  She started in this business with the intention of looking for a way to earn money to support her family.  Imelda gets up early every morning at 5am to do the household chores and tend to her customers.  The variety of customers that she gets changes every day because she offers the best service.  This loan is for the purchase of paper, notebooks, pens, folders, staples, and other items.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe was born in 1970 and lives in Porto Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She attended secondary school and now has three children, also educated, although she lives alone.

Marthe runs a business primarily selling cakes from her home. She has 15 years experience and has repaid past loans successfully. With this loan she hopes to buy raw ingredients (wheat and flour) for making cakes. Her dream is to be able to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: Purchasing flour and wheat for cake production

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.en:
Isabelle is 25 years old with 2 children and a husband who works in customs. For four years the family has lived in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital.
Having been educated through secondary school, Isabelle has been in retail for a year. This is her second loan with ALIDe following successful repayment of her first. With this loan she will purchase wholesale cassava and beans for resale.

Isabelle's dream is to save enough to build her own house and use it to provide rent income to her family.

loans.use: Purchasing cassava and beans for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria was born in 1952 and is now widowed. She has lived in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital, for the last 30 years. She received no education and raised four children, who have all received an education.

This is Maria's fifth loan through ALIDe, and she has a strong credit history. She hopes to purchase more ingredients to make doughnuts and chips, which has been her business for 25 years. Maria hopes to build her own home for her and her family.

loans.use: Purchasing wheat and beans to make doughnuts and chips

loans.name: Mariette

texts.en:
Mariette is 36 years old and lives with her husband and child who is in education. Mother and father work to take care of their child. She has just moved to a new area in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital.

Along with her change of location, she is hoping to change activities by selling wood and charcoal. She has previously had four loans through ALIDE, all repaid with no problems. With the loan she will purchase bulk charcoal and wood for resale at her stall. She hopes to become established in her new venture.

loans.use: Purchasing wood and charcoal to resell

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne was born in 1957 and is married with five children. She and her husband Etienne still have two children to look after, who both attend school. They live in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital.

Suzanne sells beans and bread at her stall, which has been her activity for the last 20 years. This is her fifth loan with ALIDE, following successful repayments in the past. With this loan she hopes to purchase more stock for her stall. In the long term she hopes to be able to strengthen and enlarge her business.

loans.use: Purchasing additional stock for making food to sell

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.en:
Eugénie has recently moved to a new area of Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She and her husband Félix look after three of their four children together.

At her food stall, Eugénie sells traditional dishes. She has run this stall for the past three years, and previously taken four loans with ALIDE which she has repaid in full. With this year-long loan, she will buy mutton from the local market to sell at her stand. In the long term she hopes to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: Purchasing mutton for cooking traditional food dishes to sell.

loans.name: Akpoton

texts.en:
Akpoton was born in 1965 and is now widowed with five children. She has lived at her house in Porto Novo since birth, where she now has seven mouths to feed.

For more than twenty years Akpoton has sold household goods from her stall, and this is now her fifth loan with ALIDE. With this one-year loan she will purchase more stock to further her sales. In the long term, Akpoton hopes to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: Purchase of various articles for resale at her stall

loans.name: Thiaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TIAAT est créé depuis trois ans et demi. Il est composé de 15 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage, d'affinité et de parenté. le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NOB SA JËKËR

Madame AIDA S. (debout à droite de la photo en pantalon noir et tricot rose) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. 

Elle fait un petit commerce d'encens et de parfums. Elle s'approvisionne soit à Touba (à environs 50 kilomètres) soit à la capitale du Sénégal (Dakar) 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de petit commerce et d'en faire la promotion. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de leur famille.
texts.en:
The Tiaat solidarity group was created three and a half years ago. It is composed of 15 women, all from the same neighborhood. They are linked by ties of neighborhood, kinship and affinity. The group is part of the Nob Sa Jeker “Banc Villageois”. 

Ms. Aida S. (standing right of the photo in black pants and pink sweater) is responsible for the group. She is 25 years old, married and the mother of one child.

She runs a small trade of incense and perfumes. She gets her supplies either from Touba (approximately 50 km) or from the capital of Senegal (Dakar).

Her new loan will enable her to improve her small business activity and promote it.

Her objective is to reinforce her savings at the “Banc Villageois” and support her husband in taking care of their family.

loans.use: Develop and promote her small business activity

loans.name: Bokk Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK XALAAT est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles sont unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce et l'embouche ovine. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR NDIAYE BALLE. 

Madame DIOUMA D. (debout à droite de la photo, habillée de vêtement mauve)est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce de lait caillé, fait de la transformation et vente d'huile de palme et de l'embouche bovine. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plus de 5 ans. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra au moins d'acheter un moutons pour l'embouche d'une part, et de continuer son petit commerce d'autre part.

Avec les bénéfices généré par ses activités elle soutient son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The Bokk Xalaat solidarity group was created December 4, 2007. It is composed of eleven women living in the same village. They are linked by ties of kinship and community. Their main activities are retail commerce and fattening of sheep. The group is part of the Keur Ndiaye Bale “Banc Villageois”.

Ms. Diouma D. (standing right of the photo, dressed in purple clothing) is responsible for the group. She is 31 years old, married and the mother of six children.

She has a small business retailing milk curd. She also processes and sells palm oil and fattens livestock. She is very experienced in this field of activity having practices it for over five years.

Her new loan will enable her to at least buy one sheep for fattening, and also continue her business activities.

With the profits generated by her activities she is supportive of her husband in taking care of the family.

loans.use: Develop her retai business and fatten livestock

loans.name: Nob Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NOB SA JEKER est créé le 30 décembre 2009 le jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de DIEWOL WOLOF qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 25 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village, ce qui favorise une bonne entente et une cohésion entre elles.

Madame YACINE S. (debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo, enroule d'une écharpe blanche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgé de 48 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 04 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle s'approvisionne à Touba environs à 50 kilomètre, pour revendre sa marchandise dans le village. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 6 ans

Son objectif est de constituer un capital assez important afin de mieux développer son activité commercial et prendre en charge sa famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group Nob Sa Jeker was created on December 30, 2009, the day of the inauguration of the Banc Villageois of Diewol Wolof to which it belongs. It is composed of 25 women from the same village, which helps promote a good rapport and a team spirit within the group.

Mrs. Yacine S. (standing on the far  right in the photo wearing a blank scarf) is the group’s leader. She is 48 years old. She is a widow and the mother of four children. She retails vegetables. She stocks up in Touba, about 50 km [30 miles[ away, in order to resell her goods in the village. She has been in this business for over six years. Her goal is to increase her work capital in order to better grow her business and be able to provide for her famiL..

loans.use: Grow her vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is currently in the business of selling paste (groundnuts and simsim--sesame seed) and charcoal. She is 33 years old, married, with three children. Two of them go to school. Hayat borrowed a loan to stock more paste (groundnuts and simsim) to sell. With extra profits from her business, Hayat hopes to buy land in the future.

loans.use: stock more paste (groundnuts and simsim) and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Ismael

texts.fr: Monsieur  Ismael  a  30  ans  et  est  marié.   Il  a  4 enfants  à  nourrir.  Pour cela, il  vend  la viande  de  bœuf  pour s’occuper  de  sa  famille. Il a déjà  remboursé  2  crédits  à wages. Pour acquerir les bœufs, il le fait à  Adetikopé et    a  commencé  cette  activité  en  1990.  Il demande  un prêt  pour  acheter  deux   bœufs, un mâle  et  une  femelle. Le monsieur en question est celui qui est entrait de couper la viande.
texts.en: Ismael is 30 years old and he is married. He has 4 children to feed. He sells beef meats to support his family.  He has already had 2 past loans with Wages (Kiva Field Partner). He buys beef cattle in Adetikope and he started his business in 1990. He requests a loan to purchase two heads of cattle, a male and a female. The individual in question is the one pictured butchering the meat.

loans.use: To purchase beef cattle.

loans.name: Moudachirou

texts.fr: Monsieur  Moudachirou  a 44  ans  et  est  marié. IL  a  2  enfants à  charge.  Pour s’occuper  de  ses  enfants,  il  exerce  comme  activité  la  couture.  IL cumule   17  ans  dans  cette  activité  et s’approvisionne  au  grand  marché  de  Lomé.  Il a 3 apprentis qui l’aident dans ces  activités. Il  demande  un prêt  pour  acheter  une  machine  à  coudre  et  répondre  à la demande sans croissante.
texts.en: Mr. Moudachirou is 44 years old and is married. He is responsible for 2 children. To care for his children he makes clothes. He has built up 17 years of experience in this profession and buys his materials in the big market in Lomé. He has 3 apprentices who help him with his business. He is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and respond to growing demand.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.fr: Dame  Falilatou est  mariée  et a 25 ans.  Elle  habite quartier   Kotokoukondji.  Elle  fait la  vente de sachets  pour  contribuer  au menage.   Elle  a  débuté  en   2007  et  achète  les  sachets  au  grand  marché de  Lomé.   Elle  sollicite  un  prêt  pour  acheter  12  douzaines de  sachets  ainsi   satisfaire  plus de  clients.
texts.en: Falilatou is married and is 25-years-old. She lives in the Kotokoukondji district. She sells bags to contribute to household costs. She began doing this in 2007 and buys the bags at the big market in Lomé. She is requesting a loan to buy 12 dozen bags so that she can meet the needs of more customers.

loans.use: To buy bags

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Koffivi  Edem

texts.fr: Monsieur  Edem   a  2  enfants et  est  marié.  Il  a  reçu de  Wages un prêt  et  a bien honoré  ses  engagements.    Il fait la vente  de  matériaux  de  construction.  IL  a commencé  en  2003  et s’approvisionne  au  Ghana  à Accra  et    au grand    marché  de  Lomé.  Ensuite il  revend à  Assivité  en face de SGGG.   Il a employé  dans  son magasin 2 personnes.  Il demande  un crédit pour  acheter  un lot  de tôles.
texts.en: Koffivi Edem has two children and is married. He has received a previous loan from Wages and has honored his commitment. He sells construction materials; he began in 2003 and he buys his products in Accra, Ghana and at main market in Lomé. Then he sells them in the area of Assivité in front of the building of the SGGG ( former Societe Generale du Golfe De Guinee). In his store he has two employees.  He requested this loan to buy a batch of plates.

loans.use: Purchase of construction material

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Monsieur  Koffi  a  36 ans  et  est  marié.  Il  est  né à Sokodé et  habite  Tokoin  Gbadago.    Il exerce  comme  activité  le    traitement de texte  et  la photocopie  dans un  atelier à  adoboukomé  non  loin  de  NSIA  TOGO.   Il  s’approvisionne à Sotimex et  cumule  4  ans  dans  cette  	activité.    Il  sollicite  un  prêt   pour  acheter  un ordinateur, une  machine à  relier  et   un  scaner.
texts.en: Mr.  Koffi  is 36 years old and married.  He was born in Sokodé and lives in Tokoin  Gbadago.  He runs a business doing word processing and photocopying in a workshop in Adoboukomé, not far from Nsia Togo.  He stocks up in Sotimex and has accumulated 4 years in this business.  He is asking for a loan to buy a computer, a binding machine and a scanner.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer, a binding machine and a scanner

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her late sister's children).    

Fatuma has a business selling plastics.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products at the market, retail.    Fatuma has requested a loan of 900,000  Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more plastics. She also generates additional income through selling soda and juice.

The main business challenges for Fatuma include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale.   Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for sale

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members -- her late sister’s children. Cissy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food for her family.

To earn a living, Cissy operates a pub. She has been in this business for 9 years, and she works 7 days per week. Cissy sells her products in a retail shop. She generates additional income by renting rooms. She explains that her main business challenges include seasonality and thievery.

Cissy is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings ($425) from MCDT SACCO. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more crates of beer, local gin, and soda. In the future, she hopes to own and operate a beer depot.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members -- her late sister’s children. Safina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity yet no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food for the family.

To earn a living, Safina has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 9 years, and she works 7 days per week. Safina sells her products in a retail shop. She explains that her main business challenges include seasonality and perishability. Safina generates additional income by renting rooms.

Safina is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings ($425) from MCDT SACCO. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more boxes of cabbages, onions, and tomatoes. In the future, she hopes to work directly with farmers.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 8 children, five of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a home that she rents, where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Hadjah has been selling plantains for six years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She lives in a home that she owns, and has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Teopista has been in the pub business for 3 years, and she works 7 days a week.  She sells her products from her home by means of retail. She also generates additional income by renting rooms.  She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin. The main business challenge for Teopista is seasonality .  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. lives in the Mpewo Valley neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns, but does not have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are treatment for illness and school fees.

Agnes has a restaurant where she sells fresh food as well as raw plantains. She has been in this business for five years, and works 6 days a week. She sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy plantains, cassava, rice and beef. The main business challenges for Agnes are changing prices and transport. Her goal is to buy her own plot of land for work.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, beef, cassava and rice

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. lives in the Mpewo Valley neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a home that she owns, and has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Madina has been in the restaurant business for five years, and she works 7 days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy plantains, chicken, sweet potatoes, maize flour and other ingredients.  The main business challenge for Madina is people in her debt who do not pay. Her goal is to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, chicken, and maize flour for her restuarant

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence Z. is a wholesale vendor of eggs. This is a new business venture for her: until a few months ago, she sold building materials. She also earns an additional income from running a small retail shop and aspires toward adding a business of rearing chickens. She cites seasonality as her primary business challenge. She works seven days out of every week. 

Florence lives in the Nakulabye neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Florence has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more trays of eggs to offer for resale.

She lives in a home that she rents and she has access to electricity and to piped water. The family's major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more trays of eggs to offer for resale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene N. K. has a market food stall business. She lives in the Kanyanya Mpewo Valley neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her sister's child. She has been in her business for over ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. She cites transportation as her primary business challenge.

Irene has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more Irish potatoes and cassava to offer for sale. Her eventual goal is to buy her own plot of land where she plans to build rental properties so that she can offer rooms for rent, thus increasing her income.

Irene lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of Irish potataoes and cassava to offer for sale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. They live in a home that she rents where she has access to neither electricity nor piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

Rehema has a business of selling sweet potatoes and cassava.  She works seven days out of every week selling her products at the market.  The main business challenges for Rehema include seasonality and defaulters.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sweet potatoes and cassava to sell. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N. lives in the Bubajjwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has two children, both of whom are in school. Sarah has a business of raising and selling poultry. She has been in this business for less than a year, and she works six days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market. Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more poultry feed and chicks. Sarah's goals are to buy a photocopy machine. Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her monthly expenses are paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally N. lives in the Kifumbira neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. They live in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expense is rent.

Sally has a business of selling Irish potatoes and tomatoes from home. Her main business challenge is seasonality. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. She earns additional income from her dry cleaning business. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more potatoes and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes and baskets of tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has six children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

She has a business of selling old shoes. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week. The main business challenges for Justine are seasonality and theft.

Justine has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand shoes. Her goals and aspirations are to buy herself a plot of land and to see that her children reach their university level studies.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, all of whom are in school. Mary has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 18 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Mary has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more charcoal. The main business challenge for Mary is transportation. Her goal is to buy her own plot of land. Mary has access to electricity and to piped water.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Hasfa

texts.en: Hasfa N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Hasfa has a business selling green bananas. She has been in this business for a few months, and she works seven days out of every week. Hasfa sells her products from home. Hasfa has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenge for Hasfa is transportation. Hasfa lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and to piped water.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her cousin. Flavia has a business of selling plantain (bunches of bananas). She has been in this business for ten years, and she works two days out of every week. Flavia has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. The main business challenges for Flavia are transportation and thieves. Her goal is to buy her own plot of land. Flavia lives in a home that she owns; she does not have access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas

loans.name: Sirida

texts.en:
Sirida N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Sirida has a business of selling fish. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. Sirida sells her products at the market. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of fish and firewood. The main business challenge for Sirida is seasonality. Her goal is to build her own home. Sirida lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy baskets of fish and firewood

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and none of her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication. 

She has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for a few months and she works seven days a week. She sells her products from home.  Her main business challenges are transportation and the rainy season.

Margaret has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO. Her goal is to become a wholesaler of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Teo has two businesses selling African clothing and selling chapats, or flat bread. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days a week. Teo sells her products from home. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell, as well as threads, a bag of charcoal, and cooking oil.   

The main business challenge for Teo is seasonality. Her goal is to build her own house. Teo lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Jane has a business doing tailoring. She has been in this business for 18 years, and she works six days a week. Jane sells her clothes by retail. Jane has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of cloth.   

The main business challenge for Jane is seasonality. Her goals are to eventually buy a plot of land. Jane lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and threads

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah K. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has seven children, four of whom are in school. Sarah has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days a week. Sarah sells her products from home. Sarah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She gets additional income from rental rooms. The main business challenge for Sarah is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to educate her children to university level and also to build more rental rooms. Sarah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity, but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina N. S. lives in the Kisenyi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Regina has a retail shop business. She has run this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. Regina has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.
Regina also earns additional income by selling milk. Her main business challenge is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to extend the business and sell her goods wholesale. Regina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella N. lives in the Nsiike Zone in  the Ndeeba neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. 

Stella owns a shop selling cosmetics. She has been in this business for three years, and works 7 days out of every week. 

Stella has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy hair weaves and cream relaxers for her shop.   The main business challenge for Stella is seasonality. 

Stella lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves and cream relaxers

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda B. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 6 children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother-in-law. 

Imelda has a restaurant business, where she also sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for ten years.  She works 6 days out of every week.  

Imelda has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more food stuffs like bunches of bananas, beef, and Irish potatoes.  The main business challenge for Imelda is seasonality.

Imelda lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy bananas, beef and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah Serunjongi lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Sarah has a retail shop business.  She has been in this business for 10 years, working 7 days out of every week.    She also generates additional income by renting rooms.

Sarah sells products in her shop by means of retail.    She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a jerrycan of cooking oil, a carton of salt, bags of sugar and boxes of soap.  The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and thieves.  Her aspiration for her business is to start selling wholesale only.    

Sarah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to resell

loans.name: La Bendicion De Xetacabaj Group

texts.en:
Doña Santa is 43 years old and married. She has five children, two currently in school. Although Santa never was able to attend school, she has been able to start and run her own retail clothing business. She started the business using her personal savings and the help of her husband, who works as a baker. Santa has had her business for the past 13 years. She is requesting a loan as a part of ¨La Bendicion D. Xetacabaj¨ group to help grow her business and increase sales with new materials. 

Santa is the featured member of ¨La Bendicion D. Xetacabaj¨ women´s group. The business activities of the other members of the group incluD.: typical clothing sales, food sales, and animal raising. These 17 women have organized to apply for this loan and each will use their portion in their respective businesses.

loans.use: Expand typical clothing sales stall

loans.name: El Milagro Group

texts.es: Doña Isabel Maria C. T., es casada, tienen 34 años D. edad, cursos el cuarto grado D. educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos que estan estudiando, se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. consumo diario y a la crianza D. animales, tiene 8 años D. experiencia con el negocio D. tienda que tiene, inicio con un pequeño capital prestado, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que es agricultor. DeciD. reunir a 10 compañeras mas para solictar un prétamo que les servirá para ampliar el capital D. trabajo D. cada una D. ellas. Cada una D. las integrantes se dedican a diversas actividades productivas como: servicio D. tienda D. consumo diario, venta D. refacciones, elaboración D. calzados, venta D. juguetes y crianza D. animales. Esperan mejorar sus ganancia y condición D. vida con el prestamo que hacen con ASDIR.
texts.en: Isabel Maria C. T. is married, 34-years-old, finished the fourth graD. in primary school, and has four children that are in school.  She works selling everyday items and raising animals and has eight years of experience in her store that she began with a small amount of loaned capital.  She has the support of her husband who works in agriculture.  She decided to get together ten other friends in order to request a loan that will help them to increase the working capital available to each one of them.  Each one of the members works in different areas such as: a store with everyday items, selling of spare parts, shoe-making, selling toys, and raising animals.  They hope to improve their profits and their standard of life with this loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Nimasac Group

texts.es: Doña Antonia Salome C. X., es casada, de 34 años de edad, ha cursado el sexto año de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la confeccion de pantalones, tiene 14 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica ala agricultura, ha decidido ampliar su capital de trabajo, y es por esa razon que reune a 14 compañeras mas con el fin de solicitar un prestamo y poder ampliar el capital de trabajo de cada una de ellas. Cada una de las integrantes se dedican a diversas actividades productivas como son: confección de pantalones, tejido de cortes típicos, elaboracion de muebles, y entre otras. Esperan mejorar sus ingresos y la condicionde vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Antonia Salome C. X. is 34 years old and married. She attended primary school up to the sixth grade. She has 3 children, who are in school. She works making pants. She has 14 years of experience at the job, and counts on the support of her husband, who works in farming. She’s decided to expand her working capital. This is why she met with 14 other women to request a loan and thus expand each of their working capital. All of the members work in various productive activities - for example, making pants, weaving traditional skirts, and building furniture, among others. They hope to improve their incomes and the living conditions of their families.

loans.use: Expanding Working Capital

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.en:
Antonia is 48 years old and married with seven children, two currently in primary school. Her husband works as a merchant. Antonia never went to school, but she has worked hard to start and run her tortilla stall and animal-raising business. She started these businesses six years ago with personal savings and the help of one of her daughters. 

Antonia is requesting a loan as part of the ¨Mujeres Progresistas Group¨ (Progressive Women´s Group) to grow these businesses in order to serve more clients. Her goal is to run and manage several stalls throught her area.

Other members of the Progressive Women´s Group are working in the following fields: consumer goods, footwear and various clothing manufacturing and sales. This is the group´s first loan through Asociacion ASDIR.

loans.use: Expand her tortilla stall and animal-raising business

loans.name: Santos Manuela

texts.es: Doña Santos Manuela T. T., de 40 años de edad, estudio todos grado de estudios en nivel primario, tiene 2 hijos de loas cuales 1 esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de consumo diario, donde vender articulos basicos de primera necesidad, lleva 12 años de experiencia con esta tienda, incio siendo un tienda pequeña y espera ver su tienda grande y con mejores ingresos de ganacias, gracias al prestamos que esta haciendo hacieindoen ASDIR.
texts.en: Mrs. Santos Manuela T. T., 40, finished all grades of elementary school and has two children one of whom is in school.  She is a merchant.  She has a grocery store selling basic need items.  She’s been in business with the store for 12 years.  It started out as a small store and she hopes to see her store grown and improve profits thanks to the loans she’s making with ASDIR.

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.en:
Elda is 33 years old and married. Her husband works as a waiter. She has two children, both currently in primary school. Elda went through primary school before she started to work for a living. Ten years ago, Elda launched her business selling everyday goods and medecine. Her business started with a loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to expand her store. In the future, Elda´s goal is to have a comfortable amount of working capital and continue to operate a successful business. 

Elda is a member of the Azucenas Group, which consists of 12 members who have organized together to apply for this loan. Business activities of group members incluD.: sale of household goods, medecine sales, typical clothing sales (blouses, skirts, dresses), apron sales and animal raising. This is the second loan through ASDIR for the Azucenas group. The first loan was paid back with no problems.

loans.use: retail business expansion

loans.name: Nicolasa Ventura

texts.es: Soña Nicolasa Ventura, es una señora casada, de 25 años de edad, cursos todo el nivel de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 esta estudiando, se dedica a costurar tejidos y su esposo se dedica a la carpinteria, tiene 9 años de experiencia como operaria, ahora quiere tener su propio negocio y seguirse apoyando con su esposo, quiere ver su negocio grande y con buenos beneficios para cancelar su prstamo a tiempo y mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Nicolasa Ventura, age 25, is a married woman who completed her elementary school education. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Nicolasa produces woven fabrics while her husband works at a carpentry shop where he has nine years of experience as an employee.

Now she wants to have her own business and continue helping her husband. Nicolasa foresees having a large business that generates a good income so that she can repay her loan on time and improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Operating capital for her weaving business

loans.name: Las Rosas De Pabatoc Group

texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old and married. She has 6 children and all are currently attending school. Alicia went to school through 6th graD. before starting to work for a living. Using her own savings and with help from her husband, Alicia started a business selling women´s blouses. She has been in the business for 12 years. Alicia is requesting a loan to purchase materials to help her business grow. She hopes to increase her sales and expand her business in the future by selling different types of merchandise. 

Alicia is part of the group Las Rosas D. Pabatoc. Members of this group are involved in activities including: typical clothing sales, jeans-making, other clothing sales, sporting goods sales and animal raising and selling.

loans.use: purchase clothing materials to grow the business

loans.name: Maria Juliana

texts.en:
Maria Juliana is 48 years old and lives in the highland region of Totonicapan, Guatemala. She is married with 5 children, and her husband currently works in the United States. Maria finished elementary school before starting to work for a living. She currently runs a home furniture business, which she started on her own. She has been in the business for 14 years.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase more furniture materials for her store. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her sales and in time grow her business in order to serve more clients. This is Maria´s third loan through ASDIR, and the other two loans were paid back in full with no problems.

loans.use: working capital for her furniture business

loans.name: Juana Virginia

texts.es: Doña Juana Virginia M. T., es casada, tiene 25 años de edad, se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de tejidos, lo cual lleva 4 años con este trabajo, esmpezo siendo operaria, y actualmente realiza este trabajo en su casa de habitacion. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es piloto, solicita un prestamo para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo y ampliar l volumen de la produccion en el trabajo que realiza, quiere ver su negocio grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Virginia M. T. is married.  She’s 25 years old and works making all kinds of knits.  She’s been in this business for four years; she started out as an employee but now works from home.  Her husband, whose a pilot, supports her efforts.

She is asking for a loan to use as working capital to expand the volume of her production; she wants to see her business be large.

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en:
Lhamsuren, 43, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband works as an engineer and both of her children attend a local secondary school. 

She has been operating a clothing-trading business since 1996. She rents a stall at an outdoor market, where she sells a variety of clothes, such as hats, scarves and other outerwear, depending on the seasons. 

She wants to expand her business and operate her own store in the future. She is a modest and hardworking person who says, "I would like to have my own store in the future." 

Lhamsuren is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 Mongolian tugriks to purchase spring and summer clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase spring and summer clothes

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en:
Enhtaivan, 54, is widowed and lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in someone's backyard in a Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger.
Enhtaivan has been selling used clothes at a local market for 15 years. She has bad legs and needs to use sticks when she walks. Even though she has trouble with her legs she has been able to do her job and increase her business. She began operating her outdoor stall with only 15 items of clothing and now she sells more than 100 pieces. In the summer she makes more profit as construction workers buy used clothes for their work. Her daughter always helps her with sales. Enhtaivan is a hardworking and brave person who says, "I am trying very hard to buy land and build a house by making more profit from my business." She is requesting a loan of 400,000 MNT to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj, 52, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a plot of land that they own. His wife is unemployed and his older daughter attends community college. 

Nyamdorj is a certified carpenter and began making wood products in 1999. He started his business with a working capital of 50,000 MNT.  Now, his current working capital is 710,000 MNT.  He makes ger components such as walls, doors and roofs. He tries to make quality products so that he can attract more customers. 

Nyamdorj is a modest and hardworking person. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more timber and materials for his woodcraft business.

loans.use: To purchase timber and building materials for carpentry business

loans.name: Togtohbayar

texts.en:
Togtohbayar, 27, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. They live in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic housing tent) in his father's backyard. 

In 2008, Togtohbayar began selling foodstuffs with his wife. They own a container, which is located at a local market where they operate their business. Togtohbayar's current working capital is 2,650,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT). They purchase the food for their business from Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Togtohbayar wants to expand his business and operate a wholesale food trading center. He is a hardworking and sociable person who says, " I want to have my own land and house in the future after I expand my business." 

Togtohbayar is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugrik to purchase food supplies such as candies, biscuits, rice, noodles, and sugar for his business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs such as candies, biscuits, rice, noodles, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Erdene-Ochir

texts.en: Erdene-Ochir, 47, is married and lives with his wife and daughter in Uvs province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, where they enjoy a decent standard of living. His wife works as a loan facilitator for a financial institution and his daughter attends college. Erdene-Ochir began selling meat in 2004. He purchases meat from local individuals and sells them at his stall in the market. His wife replaces him when she has free time and he takes care of the purchases. He wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. Erdene-Ochir is a hardworking and modest person who says, " I am trying hard to support my family and take care of my daughter's study fees. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more meat for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa, 43, is widowed and lives with her eight year old son in Hentii, Mongolia. Her son attends a local primary school. In 2009 she began using her car as a taxi, then bought a new car with the money she made from this business. Her business has become more stable and now she has regular customers. She supports her family with the income she makes from taxi driving. Bolormaa is a hardworking, single mother who says: "I recently upgraded my car and I feel much better now as a taxi driver. I will do the best I can for my son." She is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to purchase tires for her car and to pay it off in full.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her taxi

loans.name: Byambabaatar

texts.en: Byambabaatar, 49, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on the outskirts of town. His two older children attend college while the younger two attend a local secondary school. He and his wife are both doctors who operate a pharmacy in addition to their regular jobs. Their business is very helpful for the ger-district residents who live far from downtown. Their current working capital is 1,500,000 MNT and their monthly gross income is 350,000 MNT. They want to expand their business and enlarge their pharmacy by increasing the amount of drugs they sell. Byambabaatar is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT for this purpose.  He is a sociable person who says: “I want to expand my business and enlarge my pharmacy and open a private hospital with a laboratory.”

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for his pharmacy

loans.name: Buyantogtoh

texts.en: Buyantogtoh, 57, is married and lives with her husband and a son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. They enjoy a decent standard of living. She began selling foods in 2000 and now her business is more stable. Besides operating a food store, she sells groceries and commodities to the herders who live far from the city center, by traveling from one place to another in her car. Buyantogoth is a hardworking person with initiative who says: "I am trying to expand my business and increase my profits in order to help my son start his own life." She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to enlarge her food store and purchase more foods.

loans.use: To purchase more foods to sell

loans.name: Demeddorj

texts.en: Demeddorj, 56, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolin nomadic housing tent, and have a decent standard of living. His wife is retired but works as a salesperson for their son-in-law's food store. His daughter, Ichinhorloo, works as a salesperson and gets paid 200,000 MNT per month. His son operates a taxi service. Demeddorj operated a thrift shop between 2005 and 2008. He began driving a taxi as well as transporting goods with his mini-truck in 2008. Now he is trying to expand his current business and operate a spare parts store. He is a modest and hardworking person who says,: "I would like to operate a spare parts business and increase my working capital."  He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts that he can sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his bakery

loans.name: Odonhuu

texts.en:
Odonhuu, 45, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Uvs province of Mongolia. They live in a house and they have a decent standard of living. His wife helps him with his business, and his youngest son attends local secondary school. 

Odonhuu used to operate a welding service and began a cell phone repair service and cellphone parts trading business in 2009. He operates his cell phone repair service in a rented shop where his wife sells cell phones. He pays 45,000 MNT for the monthly rent of the shop and his monthly gross income is between 200,000 and 250,000 MNT.

 Odonhuu is a hard-working and modest person and as a result of their family-based business, they have bought their current house and the car, which is in the photo. By expanding the business, they want to buy a shelter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, for their children. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more cell phone parts and tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more cell phone parts and tools

loans.name: Bayartogtoh

texts.en: Bayartogtoh, 27, is married and lives with her husband in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a plot of land that they have owned for the past seven years. Her husband operates a raw material business and works for a construction company in the summertime. Bayartogtoh began selling consumer goods in 2008 with her sister. Now she operates a rented stall at a local market, where she sells imported clothing from China. She goes to China once or twice a month to purchase clothing. She wants to expand her business and operate more stalls where she can sell a variety of clothes. Bayartogtoh is a hardworking and active person who says, "I want to expand my current business and operate more stalls or a kiosk in the future. We would like to build a house on our property." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks to purchase clothing from China for her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing from China

loans.name: Josue 1-9 Group

texts.es:
el grupo Josue 1-9 esta integrado por un hombre y dos mujeres los cuales se conocen desde hace varios años, son unidos y viven en la Aldea la Cuesta de la ciudad de Nacaome. A continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
la señora Aurora M. tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada.
sus clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de fardo de ropa usada y tambien para ropa nueva.

la señora Florinda Isabel F. tiene 37 años de edad, esta soltera y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva. todos los dias sale a vender su ropa a varios lugares cercanos de la Aldea la Cuesta.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva.
 
el señor Roberto C. R., esta soltero y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, su fuerte es la venta de sandias y de melones,  sale en su carro pick-up a vender a las zonas de pespire, nacaome, aramecina y otros caserios cercanos.
El credito lo utilizara para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The Josue 1-9 Group is made up of one man and two women. They have known each other for years and are very cohesive. They live in La Cuesta village within the city limits of Nacaome. Below are more details on their different businesses:

Mrs. Aurora M. is 51 years old and married. She works selling new and used clothing. Her customers are her neighbors, friends and family. She will use this loan to buy used clothing in bulk and also new clothing.

Mrs. Florinda Isabel F. is 37 years old and single. She works selling new clothing. Each day she goes out to sell her clothing in different places close to the village of La Cuesta. She will use this loan to buy new clothing.

Mr. Roberto C. R. is single and works selling fruits and vegetables. Selling watermelon and melon is his specialty. He goes out in his pick-up truck to sell his products in the areas of Pespire, Nacaome, Aramecina and other nearby small villages. He will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing, new clothing, fruits and vegetables in bulk.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: 020402 Xuan Phu - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Huong P. T. (401001) is a 27-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Huong is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 020402 Xuan Phu - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa (020402 Xuan Phu - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa). Huong is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Huong operates a family member's fishing business.The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish. Huong has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities. In 2011, Huong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Huong is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women for the first time. She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Huong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. D. T. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Huong P. T. (401001) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Huong là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương. Huong thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Huong kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND. Vào 2011, Huong đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Huong đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND. loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 0203014 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Dung N. T. (203087) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Dung is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 0203014 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa.

Dung is married and has 1 adult -aged child. She operates a family member's business, harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Dung has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from it.

In 2011, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dung is requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Dung from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  M. T. Hong (203088) is a 22-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.

2.  B. T. Hong (203089) is a 23-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.

3.  L. T. Ty (203090) is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.

4.  N. T. Chi (203091) is a 60-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.

5.  N. T. Them (203092) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Dung thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Dung kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND. loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 0304017 Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en:
Loan N. T. (115) is a 59-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Loan is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 0304017 Lien Ha-Hoang Thanh (0304017 Lien Ha-Hoang Thanh).

Loan is married and has five adult children. To making a living, Loan operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for saL.. Loan has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Loan joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to expand a shelter for her livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be her eighth loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Loan plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. N. T. Binh (26) is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. N. T. Son (2) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

3. L. T. Xuyen (21) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

4. N. T. Ngo (27) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products.

5. L. T. Xuyen (22) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products.

About the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angelina's Group

texts.en:
Angelina A. is from the village of Esperanza West. She is 58 years old and the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Angelina A.'s Group.

Angelina is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $114 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

Angelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Reynaluz

texts.en:
Reynaluz G. is from the village of Brgy. Bagahabag,Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old, widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Reynaluz sells fruit and vegetables at a local market. Reynaluz has had her business for about five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

In 2011, Reynaluz joined Kiva field partner ASKI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaluz is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use any additional revenue generated from her business to financially support members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
