loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita B., age 46, makes and sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. She is from the village of Centro 2. Merlita is married and has four school-aged children. 

In 2009, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. 

Merlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar soltero, sus hijos estudian, sus planes que todos se preparen profesionalmente. Tiene su propio negocio que es venta de ropa en su casa de habitación por encargo y venta en general, tiene trayectoria en la venta de ropa, iniciándolo con ahorro propios vendiendo ambulantemente, su mayor necesidad es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda ya que requiere de seguridad para su negocio.
Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedras cantera, bloques, zinc, alambre dulce, estribus, tablones, para construir un cuarto de la parte trasera de la vivienda.
Obteniendo un mayor comodidad, seguridad y protección para su familia y negocio.
texts.en:
Cesar is single; his children are studying.  His plans are that they all prepare themselves professionally.  He has his own clothing sales business at home.  He sells both based on prior orders and as general sales.  He has a history selling clothes having started off as a street vendor using his own savings.  His greatest need is to improve his house’s infrastructure because he needs security for his business.

He will use the loan to buy building materials like: cement, sand, paving stones, concrete blocks, zinc metal sheeting, wire mesh, struts and beams to build a room on the rear of this house thus obtaining more comfort, security and protection for his family and for his business.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

Florentina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Florentina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Felomina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Felomina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Norma

In 2009, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She is now requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Norma’s 5th loan from PMPC. Arlyn is from the village of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn runs a business selling fish.  Arlyn has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use some for working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Arlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For Tourist Guide equipment.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is a married lady. The husband is a casual laborer and they have four children between 19 years old and 8 years old. 

Her business is located at the busy Nyamasaria market in Kisumu, Kenya. Kisumu is the region of Kenya known for production of fish and well known as the lake basin. 

Beatrice owns a food kiosk and serves ready-made food to the local people. She has been in this business for the last four years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Beatrice is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy fish to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to expand her business and employ good cooks in the future. She also sees herself being able to supply fish to the local schools and organizations. She describes herself as loving, caring and humble.

loans.use: To buy fish to cook

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the business premises

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas M. M. is a married man. His wife stays home to take care of their three children and does the household chores, while Thomas goes out to run the business. Their children range in age between two years and twelve years old. Thomas owns a general store in which he sells such items as detergents, food stuffs and beverages to the local people. He has been doing this business for five years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

Thomas is using his loan of KES 50,000 to add more inventory to grow his business and to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to expand his business to a supermarket. He describes himself as a very innovative person.

loans.use: Food stuffs, beverages, detergents etc.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah W. N. is 37 years old, single and has two children, 18 and 21 years old. She owns a beauty salon within the town of Kitengela and it is usually very busy, especially on Mondays and Fridays since they are the market days. Annah has been in this business for seventeen years and has two employees. Her target market are the women in the area. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge is the large number of people doing the same kind of business in the area. However. Annah works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 40,000 to open a barber shop to augment her current income. She hopes to expand her business, buy a plot of land and build. She describes herself as welcoming and patient with her customers.

loans.use: to open a barber shop

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface M. M. is 41 years old, married to a teacher and they have three children aged between 10 and 15 years old. They hope to give their children good education to the university level. Boniface owns a taxi and provides taxi transport services to the local people. His business is located in Kitengela and he has been in this business for five years. Boniface says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is security risks associated with theft. Boniface works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of KES 90,000 to buy spare parts to service his car. The car, if in good condition, will attract a bigger clientele thus expanding his business. Boniface hopes to own a fleet of cars for his taxi business. He describes himself as outgoing and focused.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke, age 36, is a fish vendor, a business he has operated for five years. He is the married father of four children. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been motivated to work hard in his business. He has also received business management training. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale vending in the future.   

He had previously serviced a loan from Faulu Kenya. He is now requesting another loan of 20,000 Kes in order to buy a refrigerator for the preservation of fish.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for the preservation of fish

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a member of the Skylimit Group in Faulu Kenya.  The members of the group share business ideas, save their money on a weekly basis and guarantee each other's loans. Hence, he opted to join the group so that he would access loans easily from Faulu Kenya.  

He sells gas cylinders to earn his living. He has been in the business for over 24 years. He has employed three people in his business. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy gas accessories.

loans.use: To buy gas accessories

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 35 years old and married with two children. He runs a retail shop to earn his living. He has been operating the business for 10 years and has employed five people. He is also employed.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business. He hopes to grow his business by adding more stock. He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables, cereals and sodas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, cereals and sodas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en: Jonah is 44 years old and the father of four.  He does construction and carpentry. In this business, he has employed two people. He also runs a restaurant so as to supplement his family’s income. Since Jonah joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage his finances. He dreams of owning a construction company in the future. He needs a  loan of 50,000 kes to expand his business premises.

loans.use: To expand his business premises

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 43 years old and the single mother of two. She runs a retail shop so as to provide for her children. She is also employed. With the income from her business, she is able to educate her children.  Since Cynthia joined Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to manage her finances by saving her money. She hopes to grow her business into wholesale in the future. She needs 50,000 Kes to buy maize, beans and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and cooking fat

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 36 years old and married. To earn a living, he does printing and sells stationery. He started the business 10 years ago. John also runs a taxi business to earn extra income. He has employed two people in his business. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has managed to buy a piece of land. He hopes to grow his business so as to earn more income. He has requested a loan of 50,000 kes to buy stationery and repair his printer.

loans.use: To buy stationery and repair his printer

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 38 years old and runs a taxi business. He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access loan easily. Therefore, he has managed to grow his business. He hopes to open other businesses in the future. He has been guaranteed a loan of 40, 000 KES with his group member in Faulu Kenya. With the loan, he will repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his car.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en: Zachary is a member of the Unity Self-Help group in Faulu Kenya. He is a married man and the father of two. He does carpentry and welding to earn a living. He has been in this business for six years, and he does tailoring as well. He was previously making construction bricks to earn a living. Zachary is very determined in his business and he hopes to open another business outlet in the future. With 40,000 Kes, he will buy timber, iron bars, and shoe soles.

loans.use: To buy timber, iron bars, and shoe soles.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 49-year-old married woman who is blessed with four children. She runs a curio shop where she sells beaded bags, fabric, and bangles. For extra income, she sells cereals. She was previously selling fish to earn a living. She hopes to open another curio shop in the future, and dreams of expanding her shop into wholesale. She has requested 80,000 Kes to buy more fabric, beads, and bags.

loans.use: To buy more fabric, beads, and bags.

loans.name: Sabeti

texts.en:
Sabeti is a member of Faulu Kenya.  She has a  quarrying business to earn income.  It has been fourteen years since she started the business.  So far, she has employed three people.  She gained experience in running the business from being previously employed at a quarry.  

Through faulu Kenya, Sabeti has learned how to run her own business.  She hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested for 20,000 kes to buy a water pump.

loans.use: To buy water pump

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 58 years old, and a mother of three children ages: 35, 25 and 20.  She has been practicing dairy farming for over seven years.  She also does horticultural farming.  She has been able to boost her farming through Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to become a large-scale farmer in the future.  She requested 50,000 kes which she will use to a buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en: Nicodemus is 28 years old and a single father of one.  He runs a green grocery shop for a living. He started the business in 2005.  He was previously selling sugarcane for a living.  He also runs a barber shop to earn a living.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has opened another grocery shop.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in five years.  He dreams of owning a pick-up and a piece of land in the future.  He has requested for 50,000 Kes to buy bananas, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy bananas, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a businesswoman who lives in Nairobi with her husband and two children. For the past six years, she has been selling household goods to earn a living. She is also employed and therefore she has employed two people to check on her business when she is at work. Judy has gained business management skills through the trainings offered by Faulu Kenya. She hopes to develop her business into wholesale in the future. Judy has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy plates and cooking pans.

loans.use: to buy plates and cooking pans

loans.name: Maruja Pilar

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zona urbana marginal que carecen de servicios básicos.

Desde hace cinco años tiene instalado en el segundo sector del mercado de abastos de Moshoqueque un puesto de venta de verduras. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de legumbres y tubérculos frescos los cuales adquiere em el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la familia, ya que lo que su esposo gana como albañil no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares. El negocio de Maruja siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. 

Ella desea adquirir más mercadería por lotes para que disminuya sus costos y le permita incrementar su nivel de ventas. Por ello há creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. 

Maruja es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maruja is 39 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, one of the most densely populated districts of the Lambayeque region. It is noted primarily for its high poverty index since people generally live in marginal urban areas that lack basic services.

For the past five years, she has had a vegetable stand set up in the second section of the Moshoqueque wholesale food market. Every day, she offers her customers a variety of fresh vegetables and tubers which she gets from the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo. This business is an important source of income for her family since her husband’s earnings as a builder are not enough to cover the family expenses. Maruja always has customers at her business who prefer her good service and friendliness.

She wants to obtain more merchandise in batches to lower her costs and allow her to increase her level of sales. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

Maruja is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her biggest dream is to continue working as a businesswoman and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy her merchandise in batches

loans.name: Liliana Maribel

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos aún dependientes. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de San José, un distrito cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca y que se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de pescado seco en el primer sector del mercado de Moshoqueque, desde hace más de cinco años. Ella ayuda a su esposo con los gastos económicos de su familia, su esposo trabajar en labores relacionadas con la pesca  en una lancha desde hace algunos años. Gracias a las actividades que realizan han podido construir su vivienda.

Liliana desea ampliar su negocio de venta adquiriendo pescado seco a otros pescadores de la zona con menores costos para ofrecerlo en venta y así incrementar sus niveles de ventas y por consiguiente mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Liliana is 26 years old, married, and has two children who are still her dependents. She lives with her family in the District of San José, an area whose economy depends primarily on fishing and is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past five years, she has worked selling dried fish in the first section of the Moshoqueque market. She helps her husband, who has worked for several years in jobs related to fishing from a boat, with the family expenses. Thanks to their jobs, they have been able to build their house.

Liliana wants to expand her sales business, obtaining dried fish from other area fishermen who have lower prices. This way, she can sell it and increase her level of sales as well as improve her quality of life. In order to achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more products to expand her business

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 67 años de edad. Vive con su esposo en el distrito de Nueva Arica ubicado a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Tiene hijos mayores que ya no viven con ella.  

Dirige una bodega donde vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en su negocio. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y fidelizada. Es muy conocida en su región y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Desea usar su préstamo para comprar más productos para la tienda para mejor responder al pedido de sus clientes. Ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Dominga, 67, lives with her husband in the Nueva Arica district located over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.  She has adult children that no longer live with her.

She runs a store selling groceries and basic need items.  She has more than 10 years experience in her business.  She has a well established regular customer base.  She is very well known in her region and she has very good personal and work references.

She wants to use the loan to buy more products for the store to improve her response to customer requests.  She has thought it convenient, therefore, to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona es una viuda D. 70 años D. edad.  Tiene hijos mayores que ya no viven con ella. Vive en su casa propia en el distrito D. Nueva Arica, ubicado a más D. 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, la capital D. la región D. Lambayeque.

DesD. hace más D. 20 años, se dedica a la venta D. animales al público en general en el mercado local. Ha pedido un préstamo para comprar más animales para su negocio. Desea aumentar su venta para lograr mayores ingresos y usarlos para pagar gastos personales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1,000 nuevos soles. Simona sigue siendo muy trabajadora y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Simona, 70, is a widow.  She has adult children that no longer live with her.  She lives in her own house in the Nueva Arica district located over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

For over 20 years she’s been selling animals to the general public and in the local market.  She has asked for a loan to buy more animals for her business.  She wants to increase sales in order to earn higher income to use for personal expenses.

Because of this she has felt it advisable to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  Simona continues to be very hard working and has very good personal and work references.

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Perpetua Del Socorro

texts.es:
Perpetua es soltera y tiene 45 años de edad. No tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en Nueva Arica, ubicado a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en el terreno cerca de su casa. Cuando los animales ya han alcanzado el tamaño y peso ideal los ofrece en venta al público en general en el mercado local diariamente.

Ha pedido el préstamo para comprar más animales para su corral. Desea aumentar su venta para lograr mayores ingresos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles. Perpetua es muy trabajadora y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Perpetua, 45, is single and doesn’t have any children.  She lives in her parents’ house in Nueva Arica located over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

For over ten years she’s been raising small farm animals on property near her house.  When the animals reach ideal size and weight she sells them to the general public daily at the local market.

She has asked for a loan to buy more animals for her corral.  She wants to increase sales to earn higher income.  Because of this she has considered it advisable to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  Perpetua is very hard working and has good personal and work references.

loans.use: To buy more barnyard animals.

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa con su padre en el caserío Las Mercedes en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos como agua y luz.

María se dedica al siembro de arroz en la  tierra cerca de su casa.  Ha pasado la mayoría de su vida trabajando esta tierra  así que conoce perfectamente su rubro. Vende su arroz a los comerciantes que visitan la región y a sus vecinos en el mercado local.

Desea usar su crédito para comprar más fertilizantes para el cultivo de su arroz. Espera lograr una mejor producción para vender su producto a un buen precio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María, 48, is single and has a son.  She lives at home with her father in Las Lomas district’s Las Mercedes hamlet, an agricultural zone located in Piura province, more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.  She currently does not have basic utilities like water and electricity.

María grows rice in a field near her house.  She’s spent most of her life working this land so she knows her line of work perfectly.  She sells her rice to merchants that visit the region and to her neighbors at the local market.

She wants to use the loan to buy more fertilizer for her rice crops.  She hopes to attain better production to sell her product at a better price.  Because of this she has deemed it convenient to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for her rice crops.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 46 años, es soltera y tiene 2 hijas independientes. Es propietaria de su casa la cual ha ido construyendo poco a poco con los ingresos  que ha obtenido de su trabajo. Vive en Monsefú ubicado a más de cuarenta minutos de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de 10 años, Sabina se dedica a la producción de artesanía, como sombreros, los cuales vende en el parque de Monsefú. Una de sus hijas la apoya en la fabricación de sus productos. Sabina es muy conocida en la zona por su negocio y cuenta con una clientela muy fidelizada que siempre pide sus productos. 

Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más materiales para la fabricación de su artesanía. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Sabina, age 46, is single and has two independent daughters.  She owns her house, which she has been building little by little with the income she has gotten from her work.  She lives in Monsefú, which is over 40 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For over ten years Sabina has been making handicrafts like hats that she sells in the Mansefú park.  One of her daughters helps her make her products.  Sabina is very well known for her business in the zone .  She has very loyal customers who always ask for her products.

She wishes to expand her business by purchasing more materials to make handicrafts.  That is why she believes it is advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,800 soles.

loans.use: To buy raw material to make her handicrafts

loans.name: Sandra Pilar

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 21 años y vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia. Viven en la parte rural del caserío San Eduardo – Colera en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Aún no se cuenta con servicios básicos como luz y agua potable.

Desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como maquillaje, perfumes y colonias. Vende sus productos en su domicilio y también visita sus clientes en sus domicilios en caseríos cercanos. Para este rubro, no hay mejor competencia en la zona porque cuenta con una clientela ya establecida.

Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más mercadería. Espera incrementar sus ventas para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de la vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Sandra, 21, lives with her husband and child in her own house in the rural part of San Eduardo-Colera settlement in Tambogrande district, an agricultural zone located in Piura province which is in Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.  She still does not have basic utilities like electricity and potable water.

She has been selling beauty products like makeup, perfume and colognes, for the past three years.  She sells from home but also visits her customers door to door in nearby settlements.  She has no competition in this line of work because she has a well-established, regular customer base.

She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise.  She hopes to increase sales to increase income and improve her family’s quality of life. Because of this she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Nancy Maribel

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo aún a su cargo. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 10 años, Nancy cuenta con una bodega donde vende a sus vecinos abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Es muy conocida en el mercado y cuenta con una clientela establecida y fidelizada. 

Desea invertir su crédito en su negocio para comprar más mercadería. Espera aumentar su margen de utilidad para seguir cuidando a su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 900 nuevos soles. Nancy es muy trabajadora y responsable y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.  Ha solicitado préstamos a Edpyme en el pasado y siempre cumplió con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old, single and has one son still in her care. She lives in her own house in the Motupe district, a farming area in Lambayeque province, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 10 years, Nancy has had a store where she sells groceries and basic necessities to her neighbors. She is well-known in the market and has an established and loyal customer base. 

She wants to invest her loan in her business in order to buy more merchandise. She hopes to increase her profit margin in order to continue caring for her family. Therefore, she thought it advisable to request a loan of 900 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Nancy is very hardworking and responsible, and has good personal and work-related references. She has requested loans from Edpyme in the past and always met her obligations in a punctual manner.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Daniel Alberto

texts.es:
Daniel es tiene 25 años de edad. Vive en casa de sus padres en Olmos, un distrito ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Daniel brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior.  Transporte sus clientes en los distritos de Olmos y Campiñas. Tiene dos años de experiencia en esta actividad y ya cuenta con una clientela establecida y fidelizada.

Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo, su herramienta de trabajo. Necesita mantener su moto en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y usarlos para gastos familiares y personales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Daniel es muy conocido en su caserío. Tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos en su comunidad urbana.
texts.en:
Daniel is 25 years old. He lives in his parents' house in Olmos, a district located in the province of Lambayeque, M. than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Daniel provides passenger transport services with his moto-taxi, a vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for carrying passengers. He transports his passengers within the districts of Olmos and Campiñas. He has two years of experience with this work, and he already has a well-established and loyal customer base. 

He would like to use the loan for the maintenance and repair of his vehicle, which is his work equipment. He needs to keep his moto-taxi in good condition so that he can keep offering good service to his customers. With the help of a loan, he hopes to increase his income, which he will use for family and personal expenses. For this reason, he decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles.

Daniel is well-known in his neighborhood. He has good personal and work references from his neighbors and others who know him in his urban community.

loans.use: Maintaining and repairing his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Amada es una madre D. familia D. 47 años. Vive con su esposo e hijo en la parte rural D. distrito TambogranD.. Éste es una zona agrícola situada en la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque. Amada y su familia no cuentan con servicios básicos como agua potable y luz. 

DesD. hace cinco años, se dedica a la crianza D. ovinos en la parte posterior D. su domicilio. Cría animales menores y cuando ya han alcanzado el tamaño y peso ideal los ofrece en venta al público en general en los mercados locales. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y fidelizada.

Desea invertir su capital en la compra D. más alimentos balanceados para sus animales para que alcancen un mejor tamaño. Con la inversión del préstamo, espera poder mejorar el precio D. sus ovinos y aumentar su margen D. utilidad. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Amada is a 47-year-old mother. She lives with her husband a son in the rural part of the TambogranD. district. It is an agricultural area located in the Piura province and region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. Amada and her family do not have basic utilities like drinking water and electricity.

She has worked raising sheep in the back part of her property for the past five years. She raises young animals and when they have reached ideal size and weight, she sells them to the general public at the local markets. She has an established and loyal clientele.

She wants to invest her capital in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals so that they reach a bigger size. With this investment, she hopes to be able to increase the price of her sheep and her profit margin. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Bethy Elena

texts.es:
Bethy tiene 38 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de sus padres en la parte urbana del distrito de Olmos,  ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella vende por catálogo ropa de mujer y hombre. Visita a sus vecinos y amistades y les ofrece sus productos.  Aprendió esta actividad de su madre, lo que quiere decir que conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y no hay mayor competencia en la zona. Es muy trabajadora y creativa. 

Desea ampliar su negocio y comprar más mercadería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. Espera mejorar sus ingresos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida. Su anhelo es un día crear su propia marca de ropa y tener su propio taller de fabricación.
texts.en:
Bethy is 38 years old and single. She lives in her parents’ house in the urban part of the Olmos district, located in the Lambayeque province more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells men’s and women’s clothing by catalog. She visits her neighbors and friends and offers her products to them. She learned this business from her mother, which means that she knows this area of work perfectly. She has an established clientele and there is no other competition in the area. She is very hardworking and creative.

She wants to expand her business and purchase more merchandise. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN). She hopes to improve her earnings to have a better quality of life. Her dream is to one day create her own clothing line and have her own clothing workshop.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Grimaldo

texts.es:
Grimaldo tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores. Vive con su familia en su casa propia en Macuaco, una pequeña comunidad en el distrito de Nueva Arica ubicado a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la cultivación de arroz. Vende su producto a los comerciantes y al público en general en el mercado local. Desea comprar fertilizantes para lograr una mejor producción de arroz y así venderlo a mejor precio en el mercado.  Por ello, solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1,500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes. Grimaldo es muy trabajador y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Grimaldo is 47 years old, married, and he has 2 young children. He lives with his family in a house that they own in Macuaco. It is a small community in the district of Nueva Arica, located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque.

For the past 10 years he has been cultivating rice. He sells his product to merchants and to the general public in the local market. He wants to purchase fertilizers to achieve a better rice yield and to sell at a better price in the market. For this reason he requests a loan through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. Grimaldo is very hard working and he has very good personal and work-related references.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Mirtha Elena

texts.es:
Mirtha es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad. Vive con su esposo e hijo menor en la parte rural del caserío Pueblo Libre en el distrito de Tambogrande. Éste es una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Tiene su casa propia pero no cuenta con servicios básicos como agua o luz.

Mirtha se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como pavos y gallinas. Además, cría cerdos. Tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en este rubro. Ella cría animales menores y cuando ya han alcanzado el tamaño y peso ideal los ofrece en venta al público en general en el mercado local diariamente. 

Mirtha desea invertir su crédito en la compra de alimento balanceado para que sus animales puedan lograr un mejor tamaño y peso. Desea lograr mejores ingresos para seguir apoyando su familia. Para lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,300 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 42 year-old mother who lives with her husband and one dependent child in the rural part of Pueblo Libre village, in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area which is located in Piura province, in the region of the same name.  It is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Mirtha owns her own home but she doesn't have basic services such as water or light.

Mirtha's business is raising poultry such as turkey and hens.  She also raises pigs.  She has 5 years experience in this field.  She raises young animals and when they have reached an ideal size and weight she sells them to the general public daily in the local market.

Mirtha would like to invest her loan in buying balanced animal feed so that her animals can achieve a better size and weight.  She would like to make better profits so that she can continue supporting her family.  In order to achieve her goals, she is requesting a loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Hermelegindo

texts.es:
Hermelegindo es padre de familia de 54 años. Vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia en Nanchoc, una comunidad pequeña en Cajamarca, una zona agrícola a más de 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace diez años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. El cría animales menores y cuando ya han alcanzado el tamaño y peso ideal los ofrece en venta a algunos negociantes y al público en general en los mercados locales. 

Desea invertir su crédito en su negocio para comprar más animales para su corral. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. Hermelegindo cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Hermelegindo is a 54-year-old family father. He lives with his wife and their two children in their own house in Nanchoc, a small community in Cajamarca, which is a rural area located over 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

For ten years he has been breeding and selling animals. He breeds small animals and when they have reached the ideal size and weight, he offers them for sale to merchants and the general public at the local markets.

Hermelegindo wants to invest the loan in his business and buy several animals for his farm. Therefore he thought that it was appropriate to apply for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa. He has good personal and work references.

loans.use: To buy several animals for his farm

loans.name: Pedro Miguel

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo. Vive en su propia casa con sus padres en el distrito Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. No cuentan con servicios básicos como agua o luz. 

Desde hace cinco años, se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino. También se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos. Realiza estas actividades en un terreno situado cerca de su domicilio que es propio. Vende sus animales y ladrillos en el mercado local y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fidelizada. 

Pedro pide un préstamo para comprar más alimentación balanceada para sus ovinos. También desea ampliar su ladrillera. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1,500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Pedro, aged 43, is single and the father of a son. He lives with his parents in his own house in the district of Tambogrande, a rural area in the province of Piura, located in the region of the same name, over 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. They lack basic services like water and electricity.

For five years Pedro has been breeding sheep. In addition, he manufactures and sells bricks.  He does these activities on his own plot of land near his house. He sells the sheep and the bricks at the local market and can count on a stable and loyal clientele.

Pedro applied for a loan to buy balanced feed for his sheep. He also wants to expand his brickworks activity. Therefore he thought that it was appropriate to apply for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his animals and improve his workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for sale during the school term

loans.name: Adama S.

texts.en: This is 31 year-old Adama S. C..  She is married and has one child who is 15 years old. In 2005, Adama established her assorted utensil items business. She began her business because she wants to sustain herself and family.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Adama has already received and successfully repaid two group loans, and she now requires an individual loan in order to purchase different types of utensils. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Adama plans to be a supplier to other traders. She plans to open a shop and hire workers.  She is serious and determined. Transportation cost and inflation are her main business challenges. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Additonal assorted utensils - pans, bowls, bucket, rubbers etc. in larger quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more assorted items for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw material to produce gara (dyed fabric) clothing

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 50 años, es una mujer muy risueña y amable. Vive en su casa propia con su esposo  Alberto jubilado, de 67 años y sus 3 hijos de los 6 que tuvo en total, y que todos son mayores e independientes. Desde hace dos años Irma, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y calcetines para todas las edades. Este negocio las desarrolla  con la ayuda de sus hijas, quienes le ayudan a vender a sus amistades, por lo que no tiene la necesidad de emplear mayor tiempo en ello. Y, para proveerse de más mercaderías acude a los emporios comerciales del centro de Lima, en donde compra al por mayor a precios muy cómodo, y los vende a un precio cómodo, por lo que capta buenas utilidades de su negocio. En estos dos años de sus ventas, se siente muy satisfecha por su negocio, ya que los realiza de manera independiente. Está segura, que de seguir trabajando con el mismo ímpetu  logre ampliar su negocio, por ello le urge contar con más diversidad de ropas y para todas las edades  y calcetines de todas las marcas,  para dinamizar  más su negocio y, de ese modo más adelante continuar construyendo su casa. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo se siente muy comprometida con su grupo comunal y con MFP, por la ayuda que le dieron, por ello dice “no defraudar la confianza  dada” Con el crédito que solicita, las piensa invertir en el incremento de lencerías en general, para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Irma is 50 years old.  She is a very cheerful and kind woman who lives in her own home with her husband, 67 year-old Alberto, who is retired, and 3 of her 6 children.  All of her children are grown up and live independently.

For two years, Irma has been selling underwear and socks for all ages.  She carries out her business with the help of her daughters who sell to their friends which means that she doesn't have to spend so much time on her business.  In order to stock up on merchandise, she visits the commercial centers in the middle of Lima where she buys her goods wholesale for very reasonable prices and then sells them at a reasonable price.  This means that she makes good profits in her business.

Over the two years in which she has been making these sales, Irma has felt very satisfied with her business since she sells independently.  She is sure that if she continues to work with the same amount of energy, she will manage to expand her business.  For this reason, she is keen to have a wider variety of clothes for all ages and all different brands of socks in order to energize her business some more and thereby, in the future, continue building her home.

This is Irma's ninth loan with MFP and over the years she has felt very obliged to her community bank and MFP for the help that they have given her.  For this reason, she says that she "does not wish to let down those who have placed their trust in her".  Irma is planning to spend her loan on increasing her stock of underwear in general in order to continue working.

loans.use: to stock up with underwear in order to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Santigie K..  He is married, and has three children aged 3, 6, and 12 years. In 1996, Santigie established his fuel business to earn income to support himself and his family.  Working 7 days a week and 19 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to expand his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Santigie plans to construct a house, support his children's education through university, establish a savings account for his retirement and open another shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drums of fuel for resale

loans.name: Marie Lamin

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Marie Lamin K..  She is married, and has three children aged 4, 11 and 13 years. In 1991, Marie Lamin K. established her used clothing business to earn income to help her husband support the family.  Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy assorted used clothing. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, she plans to buy a piece of land, educate her children and open another shop.  She is serious and determined.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Hawa M..  She is married, and has five children aged 6, 9, 13, 15 and 18 years. In 2001, Hawa M. established her assorted food business because she wanted to be self-reliant. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. She needs a loan of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy more food items such as milk, sugar, maggi, salt, onions, and yeast. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Hawa M. plans to be a supplier to other traders. She plans to open a bigger store and hire workers. Inflation is her biggest business challenge. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more assorted food items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more local food for resale

loans.name: Ibrahim M.

texts.en: This is 27 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 4 and 6 years. In 2004, Ibrahim M. K. established his assorted goods business. He began his business because he wanted a means to support his family.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Ibrahim plans to open another shop and hire workers   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Purchase more food items for his shop

loans.name: Isha

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Isha K. I.  She is married, and has 3 children, aged 6, 8 and 12 years. In 2005, Isha K. I established her assorted foods business. She began her business to sustain herself and her family.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 . Isha K. I requires a loan for working capital to purchase more food items by the bag. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000 . In the future, Isha K. I plans to be a supplier to other traders for retailing. She plans to open a bigger store and hire workers.  She is serious and determined. Transportation cost is her challenge in the business  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food  for resale

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: This is 31 year-old Adama.  She is married, and has one child, aged 15 years. In 2005, Adama established her food business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain herself and family.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Adama has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan to help buy a large quantity of food items for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, she plans to open a shop and hire workers. Transportation costs and inflation are her challenges in the business.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more stock to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for gara cloth production

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian is 33 years old. She is a married, and has 2 children aged 5 and 11. In 2006, Marian established her plastic slippers business. She began her business with the view of getting enough money to help her husband support their family. She opens her business 6 days a week and 10 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.Marian requires a loan in order to purchase more slippers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy large quantities of stock

loans.name: Tikdankay

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Tikdankay J.. She is married and has five children aged 4, 7, 9, 11 and 13. In 1995, Tikdankay established her plastic utensil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income and facilitate the educational process for her children. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 in order to add stock  such as pans - 15 sets @ Le 65,000, 20 rubber bowls @ Le 110,000 and other items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of home utensils

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Isatu. She is married and has two children aged thirteen and seven, plus one additional dependent who lives with her because she is her younger sister. In 2006, Isatu established a plastic bowl business. She began her business because she wanted to be independent. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,162,200 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy more business stock. Isatu hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately  230,000 SLL. In the future, she plans to build a house and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls for her business

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: This is 31 year-old Mabinty.  She is single, and has one child. She has one additional dependent, her younger brother.  In the year 2000, Mabinty established her pan dishes business. Mabinty began this business because she was inspired by the successes of her aunty in the same type. She opens her business 6 days a week and 10 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,800,000. Mabinty requires a loan in order to increase her stock and she also saves from frequent traveling.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of pan dishes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Kadiatu D..  She is married and has 2 children ages 12 and 18 years. She also has 1 additional dependent, whom she adopted.  In the year 2001, Kadiatu took over a business selling food and drinks from her mother. She has been able to manage the business and has a very good loan repayment history. She opens her business 6 days a week and 6 hours a day.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy bags of rice, gallons of vegetable oil and other food items. In the future, Kadiatu D. hopes to have a more spacious place for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: Blanca madre soltera, tiene tres hijos ya mayores, que se encuentre bien sus hijos es su objetivo.  Le ayuda económicamente para que cubra algunos gastos de la casa, ella trabaja como operaria desde hace un tiempo. Su mayor necesidad mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda la zona donde habita es de peligro por tal requiere seguridad para su persona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, alambre de amarre, láminas de zinc.  Para construir el frente de la casa y parte del muro lateral.
texts.en: Blanca is a single mother and she has three grown children. Her objective is to be well with her children. They help her to cover some of the household expenses. She has been working as an operator for some time. Her greatest need is to improve the infrastructure of her house. The area where she lives is dangerous and so she needs this for her personal safety. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, construction bocks, wiring, and zinc sheets to build a front portion to the house and to build a part of the side perimeter wall.

loans.use: to build the front section of her house

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is 33 years old. She is married and has 2 children ages 4 and 6 years old. She also has one relative who is a dependant. In 2004, Salamatu B. established her business selling plastic utensils. She began her business when she noticed that plastic utensils were not found much in town and people needed them, especially women.

She opens her business 6 days a week and 9 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,800,000 SLL  in order to buy more stock of plastic wares.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bundles of plastic slippers for her business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is Fatmata K.. She is married and has no children, but she has 2 additional dependents: her younger brothers. In the year 2003, Fatmata established her business selling plastic kitchen utensils. She opens her business 6 days a week and 11 hours a day. Fatmata has a good credit rating. 

She needs a loan of 4,800,000 SLL in order to purchase more kitchen utensils for her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to support her children through their university education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Lamrana. She is married and has 1 child. Lamrana established her clothing business in 2005. She began her business when she got business capital from her husband, who actually advised her to go into such a business. She opens her business 6 days a week and 10 hours a day.

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,800,000 SLL. Lamrana requires a loan in order to buy more bales of used clothing for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba, 40 years old, is married and has two children, one 18 years old and the other 8 months old.  Because it is a widely-used product, Kumba established her charcoal business in 2003 and has developed it into profitable enterprise, open seven days a week and nine hours a day. She is requesting  a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal.  In the future, Kumba plans to acquire a piece of land and educate her children well.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers for her business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Zainab. She is single, and has one child aged 18 years. She has one additional dependent, the child of her friend. In 1987, Zainab established her foodstuffs business. She opens her business six days a week and 11 hours a day. Zainab has a good loan repayment history. She needs a loan Le 3,000,000 to help her buy more foodstuffs for her business. In the future, Zainab plans to complete her building project. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Patrick A.

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Patrick. He is married, and has two children aged 10 and 15 years. He has three additional dependents; they were street children whom he decided to help. In 2007, Patrick established his pharmacy business. He decided to start this business because after completing his studies in medicine, he saw that there were no clinics or pharmacies around. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business. He needs a loan of Le 4,500,000 in order to purchase more drugs, first aid kits, and do some repairs to the shop. In the future, Patrick plans to further his studies in the medical field, and also to give his children a quality education. Patrick says, "God been my helper. This loan will enable me to achieve my goals." He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy more pharmaceutical supplies for resale and to make repairs to his shop.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban A. F., tiene la edad de 23 años, está casado y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad de un año de edad al igual que su señora esposa. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia del su cafetal para tenerlo en mejores condiciones de producción esta próxima cosecha que  viene.  El cuenta con el terreno y la experiencia para poder seguir adelante con su  cafetal, lo cual quiere es mejorarlo aun mas para mejores cosechas este año. Esteban pretende seguir creciendo como persona y como caficultor de la zona, al igual quiere brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y cumplir algunas metas que se propuso este año con su pequeña familia.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Esteban A. F., age 23, is married and has a one-year-old son, who is his biggest priority along with his wife. He wants to buy supplies for his coffee plantation to have it in good condition for the next harvest. He depends on his land and his experience to run his plantation, which he hopes to improve for a better harvest this year. 

Esteban wants to keep growing as a person and as a coffee grower; he also hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life. This is Esteban's first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from a formal bank, but FUDECOSUR's loan application process is simple and offers lower interest rates.

loans.use: Hired help and purchase of supplies for coffee plantation.

loans.name: Daysi María

texts.es:
Doña Daysi O. es una señora soltera, tiene 57 años vive en la comunidad de Olivia de Sixaola. Vive con sus hijos y nietos. Es una clienta con mucha trayectoria en la Fundación, perteneció a un banco mujer de esa comunidad, se independizó y empezó a solicitar el crédito individual hasta la fecha. En sus diferentes actividades ha sido financiada por la Fundación. Se puede clasificar por su moral de pago como clienta tipo A.
Se dedica a varias actividades como es la agricultura, avicultura y servicios de comidas. Siembra los granos básicos, plátano, banano. También tiene gallinas ponedoras, en donde tiene contratos con otras personas para la venta de sus huevos. Además de contrato con la Universidad de Costa Rica, para dar la alimentación a estudiantes que tiene que ir de gira para el TCU a su comunidad.
Ella se levanta temprano y primero ve sus animales y siembras, después hace los oficios domésticos con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Su meta es hacer un pozo de agua para minimizar los gastos de la misma, ya que el agua del Acueducto le sale mas alto el costo.
texts.en:
Daysi O. is a single, 57-year-old woman who lives in the community of Olivia de Sixaola with her children and grandchildren. She has a long history with Fundación Mujer – she was a member of a women’s bank in the community, she became independent, and then began requesting individual loans. She has been funded by Fundación Mujer in her different businesses and has good payment history.

She works in different areas of business such as agriculture, poultry farming, and food service. She grows basic grains, plantains, and bananas. She also has laying hens and has agreements with other people to sell the eggs. In addition, she has a contract with the University of Costa Rica to provide meals to the students who have to go on visits for their university community service.

She gets up early and first sees to her animals and crops. Later, she does the household tasks with the help of her children.

Her goal is to create a water well to minimize her expenses, as water from the Water Service is more expensive.

loans.use: To buy raw material and create a water well.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Bendecidos” perteneciente a la comuna de Puente Alto. Ella tiene un almacén de abarrotes y lácteos en su casa, desde hace 10 años.
Con este préstamo comprará bebidas.
Su sueño es tener un minimarket en donde tendría más variedad de productos. Su motivación es darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos: la mayor de 15 y el menor de 3 años, con quienes vive. 
El negocio de Olimpia es el único sustento económico de su hogar.
Para Olimpia los préstamos Fondo Esperanza han sido de gran ayuda para mantener su negocio, ya que además de comprar mercadería, logró ampliar un poco el espacio físico de su almacén.
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Olimpia is a member of the 'Los Bendecidos' (The Blessed) community bank which is located in the town of Puente Alto.  She has a store in her home where she sells groceries and dairy products.  She has owned her store for 10 years and will use this loan to buy drinks.

Olimpia's dream is to own a mini-market where she will sell a larger variety of products.  Her motivation is to provide her 2 children with a better quality of life.  Her eldest child is 15 and her youngest is 3.  Olimpia's business is the only source of financial support for her household.

Fondo Esperanza's loans have been a great help to Olimpia in keeping her business running since they have enabled her to buy merchandise and also to expand the physical size of her store a little.

Puente Alto is a town which is located in the north of Santiago, the capital of Chile.  It was founded as a small, rural village at the end of the 19th Century but, given its demographic growth, it is currently one of the most populous towns in Chile, with more than 600,000 inhabitants.  It is the gateway to one of the foothill areas of the Metropolitan region which is known as 'Cajón del Maipo' (Maipo Canyon).  This area has spaces where people can hike, ride horses, raft and take part in other activities.  It also offers lodging and food services.

loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia forma parte del banco comunal “Los Bendecidos” perteneciente a la comuna de Puente Alto. Ella vende mote con huesillo en una feria rotatoria cercana a su casa, desde hace 7 años. Trabaja allí 5 días a la semana y le ayuda una hermana que la acompaña 2 veces a la semana en la venta, pero sin ninguna ganancia económica.
Con este préstamo Leticia comprará huesillos.
El sueño de Leticia es comprar un vehículo para tirar su carro, ya que queda muy agotada cuando lo traslada de lugar.
Su negocio es su único sustento económico, ya que vive sola en su hogar.
A Leticia le han servido mucho los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha adquirido cosas necesarias para su negocio como por ejemplo una máquina conservadora, la cual utiliza para mantener el jugo del mote con huesillos fresco y helado. Además también le han servido las enseñanzas sobre administración de su negocio que recibe durante las reuniones junto a sus compañeros de Fondo Esperanza.
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Leticia is part of the “Los Bendecidos” (The Blessed) Communal Bank in the town Puente Alto .  She has been selling “mote con huesillo” (a sweet drink / dessert made with peaches) for seven years at a traveling fair that is close to her house.

She works there five days a week.  One of her sisters goes with her and helps her with sales twice a week.  She does this without financial gain.

Leticia will buy “huesillos” (sun-dried peaches) with this loan.

Leticia’s dream is to buy a vehicle to pull her cart.  She is very exhausted when she moves from one place to another.

Her business is her only financial support because she lives alone in her house.

The loans from Fondo Esperanza have helped her a lot.  She had gotten the things she needs for her business.  For example, she got a cooler, which she uses to keep the mote con huesillos juice fresh and cold.  They have also helped her with the education about business administration that she gets during the meetings with her colleagues from Fondo Esperanza.

Puente Alto is a town north of Santiago, the capital of Chile.  It was founded as a rural town at the end of the 19th century.  Given its growth, it is currently one of the most populous towns in Chile with over 600,000 inhabitants.  It is the gateway to one of the foothill areas of the Metropolitan region, which is known as 'Cajón del Maipo' (Maipo Canyon). This area has spaces where people can hike, ride horses, raft and take part in other activities. It also offers lodging and food services.

loans.use: Food: Sun-dried peaches

loans.name: Greyda Catalina

texts.es: La señora Greyda  Catalina R. , tiene la edad de 30 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo que labora como mecánico , para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar ellos tiene a cargo dos niñas las cuales estudian su primaria y necesitan del apoyo de ambos , doña Greyda tiene el sueño de algún día poder comprar un tramo en el mercado para poder estar  estable en su negocio de frutas y verduras , durante este tiempo ah luchado día a día para brindarles sus pequeñas un mejor bienestar ya que con el primer crédito compro materiales de construcción p ara hacer el repello de la casa por la parte de adelante , ahora quiere comprar bloques , cemento , arenas y otros materiales para terminar de cerrar un cuarto ya que ella quiere que en un futuro las niñas tengan su propio cuarto .
texts.en: Mrs. Greyda Catalina Rios is 30 years old and she lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with her husband. He works as a mechanic in order to contribute towards the household expenses. They have two girls in their care who are in primary school and they need the support of them both. Greyda's dream is to purchase some day a stand in the market in order to have s table business location to sell fruits and vegetables. Throughout this time she has been struggling day after day to provide her little girls with well-being. With the first loan she was able to purchase construction materials to plaster the front section of the house. She now requires to purchase construction blocks, cement, sand, and other materials needed to finish building a room. She will need it in the future so that her daughters will have their own room.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del Banco comunal “Luz de esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de sus productos de amasandería, entre los cuales se encuentran pasteles, alfajores, queques, chocolates, turrones, galletas, empanadas de cóctel y pan amasado. 
María trabaja a pedido, por lo que sus clientes frecuentes son conocidos quienes le solicitan cierta cantidad de sus productos de amasandería a domicilio, ella se dedica a este rubro desde hace 3 años. Durante este tiempo su clientela ha ido en aumento, debido a la calidad de sus productos. 
María compra su mercadería en supermercados mayoristas, lugar donde los precios son más convenientes.
Con el préstamo de Fondo esperanza mas unos ahorros que María tiene en su poder, comprará materiales de construcción para fabricar un local establecido en el ante jardín de su casa, lo que convertirá en un bazar y confitería para vender todos sus productos. La motivación de realizar este proyecto es debido a la ubicación donde se encuentra su casa, ya que cerca tiene un colegio. El cual atraerá nuevos y más clientes. Para concretar este proyecto necesita esperar un permiso para ubicar su local al interior de su casa, el cual consiste en la patente de “Bazar y confitería”.
María vive con sus 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad.
Su sueño es concretar su proyecto del Bazar y confitería, para brindarles a sus hijos una vida más confortable y una mejor calidad en su educación.
Para María participar  de Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que le han enseñado a distribuir mejor sus ganancias y el préstamo obtenido le generará mayores ingresos por lo que está muy agradecida. También disfruta mucho de las reuniones que realiza Fondo Esperanza, debido al compañerismo que se ha generado.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en: Maria is a member of the Luz de Esperanza community bank in the Chilean town of Curico.  She operates a business making and selling baked goods: pies, alfajores, cakes, chocolates, cookies, etc.  Maria has operated the business for 3 years and she works to order.  She knows her customers and they know her.  They come to her house to order whatever baked goods they need.  She has steadily added customers over the years as her reputation for making quality products has grown.  Maria buys her supplies at retail supermarkets because the prices are better.  She will use this loan from Fondo Esperanza, plus her own savings, to buy construction materials for adding a space to her house where she can set up a shop.  Her house is near a school so she thinks building the shop there will help her business.  She hopes to attract new customers, as well.  To complete the project, she needs a permit to set up a home-based store.  Maria lives with her 2 children, 11- and 7-years old, respectively.  She wants to set up the bakery so that she can provide her children with a good education and a better life.  Fondo Esperanza has been a great help to Maria's business because she has learned how to better spend her money and the loans that she's received from the bank have helped her to increase her income.  She also enjoys the regular meetings that Fondo Esperanza arranges with other members of the bank.  Curico is a town in Maule, a region of central Chile.  The area has a Mediterranean climate and is considered to be among the most pleasant in the country.  It's also know for its wines and its natural beauty.  According to the latest census figures, the area is also one of the poorest in Chile despite a growing workforce.

loans.use: Construction materials for food business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del Banco comunal “Luz de esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante, ya que vende artículos de menaje (loza), juguetes, plantas (cactus) y principalmente ropa usada y nueva. El lugar donde vende sus artículos es en una feria libre.
María trabajó durante 33 años en el sector público como técnico paramédico, sin embargo sufrió un accidente vascular que la mantuvo sin caminar durante mucho tiempo, debido a esto recibe una pensión de invalidez. En la actualidad se encuentra muy bien de salud y recibe tratamiento médico. Debido a esto, que desde hace 3 años se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante.
Su mercadería, principalmente la ropa, la compra en Santiago en locales mayoristas, para abaratar costos. Y en Curicó compra artículos de menaje y plantas. Durante la temporada escolar correspondiente al mes de marzo, sus ganancias son altas.
Es por esto que el crédito de fondo esperanza lo utilizará para comprar ropa de colegio, específicamente calcetas, pantalones, buzos y ropa interior.
María vive con su hija quien también trabaja, por lo que existe otro ingreso económico en el hogar.
El sueño de María es tener un local establecido en el cual pueda vender sus artículos para que mejoren sus ingresos y así tener una  vida más confortable. Y es este también el motivo de continuar trabajando en el rubro.
Para María los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que le dan facilidades para cancelar su crédito. También disfruta mucho de las reuniones que realiza Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha conocido gente muy buena con la que ha generado lazos de amistad.
