Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Luz de Esperanza communal bank that is in the city of Curicó. 

She works as a street vendor selling articles of the home (dishes) toys, plants (cactus) but mostly used and new clothes.  She sells at an open market.  Maria worked for 33 years in the public sector as a paramedic.  She had a vascular accident that kept her from walking for a long time and because of this she received a disability pension.  Currently she is healthy and receives medical treatment.  Three years ago she started working as a street vendor.  She buys most of her merchandise, mostly clothing, from wholesalers in Santiago to keep costs down.  And in Curicó she buys house wares and plants.  During the school season in March, she does very well.
She will use the loan to buy school clothes, specifically knitted items, pants, gym clothes and underwear.  Maria lives with her daughter who also works, and this gives the home another source of income.

Maria’s dream is to have a permanent stall where she can sell her products to improve her earnings and have a more comfortable life.  And this is also her reason to continue working in her business.
For Maria the financing terms from Fondo Esperanza have been a great support for her business since they allow her to pay off her loans.  She also enjoys the meetings at Fondo Esperanza and she has meet very good people with whom she has become friends. 

Curicó is in the Maule region, in the center of the country.  The climate is Mediterranean and Curicó is thought to be one of the most pleasant areas of the country.  It is also known for its wines and beautiful surroundings.  
Despite the increase in work in the area, it is still, according to the last census, one of the poorest in the country.

loans.use: To buy school clothing, specifically knitted items, pants, gym clothes, and underwear

loans.name: Frolida

texts.en: Frolida is 55 years old, and has 5 children, the eldest is 17 and the youngest is 1. She is married to a farmer. Frolida sells food stuffs such as beans, sorghum, and a local juice called Umutobe. She has had this business for 14 years. She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business, and with the profits, she hopes to renovate her home.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 24, married, and has a 1-year-old child. She and her husband own a boutique together for the past 3 years. They would like this loan to reinvest in their business, and with the profits, they hope to increase their capital and begin a savings account.

loans.use: Reinvest in their business

loans.name: Story Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is 31 years old and she has two children who are ages 8 and 3 years old. She owns a store in which she sells different kinds of household items such as soap candles, sugar etc. She has run this business since 2005. Dativa is requesting this loan to reinvest in her business, and she hopes to add the profits to her savings.

loans.use: To reinvest in her boutique

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are 3 and 1 years old. Her husband makes a living as a farmer while she has owned a general store for the last two years. Epiphanie is applying for this loan to buy new items to sell to her customers, and plans to use her profits to continue expanding her store.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine is 32 years old, married and has two children. She and her husband work together selling food. They have been in business for six years and hope to use this loan to expand their business. If she is able to earn additional income, she would also like improve her house.

loans.use: to expand a small food-selling business

loans.name: Xaverina

texts.en: Xaverina is  49, widowed and has two children who are 23 and 19 years old. For the last 10 years, she has made a living selling food such as green bananas. She has applied for this loan to buy more bananas to sell to her customers, and hopes to use the money she earns to pay her children's school fees and continue expanding her small business.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 45, single and has three children. Her oldest child is 25 and her youngest is 3. For the last 24 years, she has made a living by selling goats. She has applied for this loan to buy more goals to sell, and is very committed to continue expanding her business by reinvesting her profits in it.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence, who was born in 1962, is a hardworking mother of three children, all in school. Her first child was born in 1989, while the youngest was born in 1993. Since 1994, Gaudence has been selling a local juice called umutobe, which is made out of yellow bananas. She is now requesting a loan to buy more bananas for the business, and plans to reinvest back into her enterprise the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy bananas.

loans.name: Abahujumutima Group

texts.en:
The President of Abahujumutima Group is Pollonette, pictured with the yellow shirt and red skirt, holding the group's blue passbook. Pollonette is 46, widowed, and has five children ranging in age from 4 years to 18 years old, all except the youngest enrolled in school.

Pollonette has been selling vegetables for 16 years, and will use this loan to buy additional inventory of fruit and vegetables. With any profits realized, she will feed her children, pay for their school fees, and improve her house.

loans.use: Additional inventory of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en: Venantie, who was born in 1976, has four children ranging in age from 6 to 13. Venantie sells foodstuffs and is requesting a loan to purchase more. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 27, unmarried, and does not have any children. For the past six years, he has run a shop where he sells common supplies such as salt, sugar, and other various items. So far, this business has allowed himl to purchase a piece of land. With the profits he hopes to realize from this loan, he wants to increase his capital and eventually buy his own house.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory of salt, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Djawa

texts.en:
Djawa is 34 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 9 and 17. All of her children are in school. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. 

Djawa has been selling used clothing for twelve years, and recently her business has allowed her to buy a motorcycle for herself. She plans to use the profits gained from this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: buying additional inventory of used clothing

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 33 years old and has five children between the ages of 5 and 15.  Currently all her school age children attend school.  Mediatrice's husband works with her in their general store, which they have had for ten years.  The business has allowed them to pay school fees and to buy a house for the family.

With this loan Mediatrice will purchase more stock, such as rice, sugar, bananas, potatoes, mineral water and other drinks.  If she and her husband make any profits with this loan, they plan to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, bananas, potatoes, mineral water and other drinks.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene is 26 years old, and he is single. He sells phone accessories, lotions and perfumes, and he has operated this business for five years. He has been able to afford to buy his own house because of this business. He is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in his business and will reinvest the profits he hopes to make.

loans.use: Reinvesting in his business.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne is a 32-year-old mother of four children between 1 and 12 years old, three of whom go to school. Joselyne has owned a small store selling potatoes and bananas for 13 years, and it has allowed her to buy her own house. Her husband is also a vendor.

Joselyne will use her loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell. With any profits she makes from the use of the loan, she plans to make enhancements to her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Afrodis

texts.en:
Afrodis is 32 years old and has two children, aged 1 and 4. The first child has enrolled in nursery school. 

Afrodis has been in business for eight years as a food seller. He has been saving money to buy her own home.

He is requesting a loan to buy more food and he intends to use the profits gained from this loan to buy the house and some domestic animals.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of potatoes, beans, rice and more

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 30 years old, married to a motor taxi driver, and they have five children between the ages of 2 and 10.  Claudette has a small store that sells cassava leaves.  She has been doing this for three years.  The business has allowed her to build a house, buy a motor taxi for her husband and to buy land as well

Claudette will use her loan to purchase more cassava leaves to sell.  With any profits she plans to pay school fees and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava leaves to sell

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 28 years old and she has three children who are between the ages of 2 and 8 years old. Apart from the youngest, the other children are enrolled in school. 

Jeannette owns a boutique in which she sells items such as candles. She is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 25 years old and has one child who is two years old. 

Claudette owns a shop in which she sells food such as rice and peanuts and other items such as candles. She runs the shop together with her husband. 

Claudette is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is 28, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 7. Both of her children are enrolled in school. 

Aline's husband is a seller of building materials, and Alien sells beans, sugar, rice, tomatoes, and other vegetables at her shop. Aline has been in this business for two years. 

With this loan, Aline will buy additional inventory for her shop, and with the profits, she hopes to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy additional beans, sugar, rice, tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 30 years old and works as a tailor in her own shop.  She is married to a technician and they have three children between the ages of 5 and 10 years.  All her children go to school. Jeanette has been very successful in her business, which she has been operating for five years. It has allowed her to purchase a house for her family.

Jeanette plans to use her loan to purchase more material to make the traditional Rwandan dresses for women. She plans to pay for her children's school fees with any profits.

loans.use: To purchase material to make traditional Rwandan dresses

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 26, married, and has two children, ages 2 and 4. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. 

For the past 3.5 years, Rachel has owned a shop where she sells household goods and food. With this loan, she will be purchasing additional rice, oil, sugar and drinks to sell. Since opening her business, Rachel has been able to buy her own home. She hopes to reinvest any profits she sees from this loan in growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice, oil, sugar and drinks to sell

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 36 years old.  She has a 9-year-old child.  Her husband owns a bar. Alphonsine sells fruits and vegetables to earn income.  She is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children, aged 2 and 5 years.  Her older child is in nursery school and the younger one is not yet old enough for school. 

Since 1996, Beatha has been running  a shop in which she sells shoes, bags, plates, soaps, cottons, and other housewares. This business has allowed Beatha to add annexes to her home.  Beatha's husband is in the same business, running a shop in a different market. 

With this loan, Beatha intends to buy additional shoes, bags and other housewares to sell.  She hopes to reinvest to profits back into her business.

loans.use: To buy additional shoes, bags and other housewares to sell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 35 years old, and she has two children who are 13 years old (twins). Both of her children go to school and her husband sells a variety of goods. Chantal sells second hand clothes and she has done this business for 15 years. Chantal is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothes, and she plans to pay school fees with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: Buying more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Aloyse

texts.en:
Aloyse is 46 years old. She has three children who are between the ages three to seven years old. All her children are in schoo,l and her husband sells different kinds of items, depending on the maket demand.

Aloyse sells shoes, and she has done this business for three years and this business has enabled her meet the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more shoes. With the profits she hopes to make, she plans to renovate her house

loans.use: Buying more shoe inventory.

loans.name: Marriette

texts.en: Marriette was born in 1973. She has two children who are 5 and 3 years old. Marriette owns a bar in which she sells several types of beer, and she has done this business for 4 years. Marriette is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her bar by buying more beer.

loans.use: Buying beer to sell

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 28 years old, and he has two children who are 2 and 6 years old. He is a moto-taxi driver, and he is requesting a loan in order to buy another motorcycle for using in his business. With the profits he plans to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 40 years old and has 7 children who are between the ages of 9 and 21 years. Marie is a widow and is very hard working. Marie's husband was a farmer and always helped raise the children. Marie sells food stuffs such as beans and peanuts, and she has done this business for 11 years. Marie is requesting a loan in order to buy more food stuffs and make more profits.

loans.use: Buy additional foodstuffs for her store

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en: Jean de Dieu is 31years old. He has 3 children who are ages 1 to 7 years. He owns a shop in which he sells various products such as salt, candles, etc. He is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in his shop and make more profits. With the profits he plans to feed his family.

loans.use: To reinvest in his business selling salt, candles and general supplies.

loans.name: Jacques

texts.en: Jacques is 48 years old and is married to a tailor. They have four children who are between the ages of 9 and 17 years old. Jacques sells bicycles and he has done this business for five years. He is requesting a loan in order to invest in his business and with the profits he plans to buy some animals for rearing.

loans.use: investing in his bicycle store

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 25 years old and is single and hard-working. She owns and runs a restaurant and she has done so for two years. Rachel is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant. She plans to save her profits.

loans.use: buying additional food for her restaurant

loans.name: Verediana

texts.en: Verediana is 49 years old, and she has six children who are between the ages of 8 and 26 years old. She sells bread and she has done this business for eight years while her husband sells other foodstuffs. Verediana is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her bread business and plans to expand her house with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: reinvest in her bread business

loans.name: Epaphrodite

texts.en: Epaphrodite is 32 years old and has 3 children who are between the ages of 6 and 10 years old. Her husband is a carpenter, and Epaphrodite has sold food stuffs, such as rice and beans, for 12 years. Epaphrodite requests a loan in order to purchase more food stuffs and make more profits. With the profits she plans to feed her family.

loans.use: To buy additional food inventory

loans.name: Turunguka Group

texts.fr:
Christine K. est une commerçante âgée de 34 ans qui habite  la commune urbaine de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce des habits appeles communément friperies au Marche de Kanyosha il ya de cela 1 an et 6 mois. Elle a fait ses études secondaires techniques jusqu’en 3e année en Comptabilité . Elle est mariée a Leonard Minani ,un commercant de matelas, et ont ensemble 6 enfants dont 4 sont a l’école. Ils prennent aussi en charge un 1 enfant de sa famille proche. Elle   arrivait au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame, mais elle intègre maintenant le crédit solidaire. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  diversifier son business en y ajoutant les produits alimentaires comme l’huile de palme, du poisson sec, et autres articles pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle espère  atteindre le niveau d’une grande commerçante dans l’avenir si elle ne rencontre pas encore des problèmes lies au manque de produits sur le marche.

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« Turunguka»
texts.en: Christine K., aged 34, is a shopkeeper who lives in the urban commune of Kanyosha, in the capital Bujumbura. For a year and six months, she has had a business involving clothing, commonly called friperies (second-hand clothing), at the Kanyosha Market. She has attained the third year of trade schooling in accounting. Christine is married to Leonard Minani, a mattress seller, and together they have six children, of whom four are in school. They also support a child from the immediate family. Christine is now on her fourth community loan cycle with Turame, but she is now part of a solidarity loan. She is asking for a Kiva loan to diversify her business by including grocery items, such as palm oil, dried fish, and other item, so as to make a large profit. She aspires to the heights of a major merchant in the future if she does not encounter any more problems related to product shortages on the market. She is a member of the solidarity group “Turunguka”.

loans.use: Diversifying her business by including grocery items, such as palm oil, dried fish, and more

loans.name: Tuzanyumwete Group

texts.fr:
Perpétue M. est une commerçante âgée de 40 ans qui habite  la commune urbaine de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de détails comme les habits (pagnes pour dames) mais aussi des produits alimentaires comme le lait depuis 6 ans. Elle a fait ses études secondaires techniques d’administration avec un diplôme A2 . Elle est mariée a Jonas Minani ,un Consultant dans l’enseignement des métiers, et ont ensemble 6 enfants dont 4 sont a l’école. Elle   arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant beaucoup de pagnes pour dames mais aussi diversifier son business en y apportant les produits de boutique dans l’espoir de réaliser de grandes épargnes et ainsi accroitre son business. Elle espère  atteindre le niveau d’une grande commerçante dans l’avenir

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Tuzanyumwete».
texts.en:
Perpétue M. is a 40 year-old shopkeeper who lives in the Kanyosha commune in the municipality of Bujumbura. For six years she has sold items such as dresses (wax cloth robes for women) and also food products such as milk. She achieved the A2 level of secondary education. She is married to Jonas Minani, a skill training consultant, and they have six children together, four of whom attend school. Perpétue is on her fourth loan with the Turame credit association. 

She is seeking a Kiva loan in order to grow her capital by purchasing many wax cloths for women, and by diversifying her business with the aim of putting some savings aside and growing her business. She would like to become a prominent shopkeeper in the future. 

She is a member of the Tuzanyumwete group.

loans.use: to boost her capital by purchasing ladies' pagnes (wax cloth robes), and also to diversify her business

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret is a forty-six-year-old widow with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been  selling flour for four years starting with one bag. Now she sells fourteen bags in a month. Her hardship is poor quality flour due to the rainy season and her vision is owning a store plus building a permanent house. Gorret needs the loan to buy cassava flour for sale.

loans.use: Buying cassava flour

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a fifty-five-year-old married man with seven children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He was in agriculture for four years and then he started buying and selling coffee. Now he also processes coffee for sale. His hardship is that the business is seasonal. His vision is business growth plus educating his children. Wilson needs the loan to buy a motor for his maize mill.

loans.use: Buying a motor for his maize mill

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda, and has been a carpenter for the last four years. He used to work for others but now he has his own workshop. His hardship is lack of enough manpower, and his vision is business expansion and educating his children. Sem needs the loan to buy lumber for his carpentry work.

loans.use: To buy lumber for his carpentry work.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 25-year-old married man with three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop for eight years which he started with capital of 70,000 shillings and now has 7,000,000 shillings. He experiences hardship due to price fluctuation and his vision is a wholesale business plus educating his children. Charles needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a twenty nine year old enterprising man living in a family house in Kyenjojo Uganda. He has the desire tp educate his siblings to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. He is an grower of tea and has been farming for two years. The business is good as he has an assured market in the local factory. He has challenges in that he has limited capital to meet the quality needed at the factory. His dream is to expand his tea estate. Kenneth needs the loan to plant tea.

loans.use: Planting tea.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 48-year-old married man with eight children. He lives in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For 20 years, he has been in the agricultural sector, which has facilitated him in providing promptly the basic needs of the family. He has challenges in the price fluctuation of the products and the prolonged dry season that leads to poor yields; nonetheless, he wishes to venture into mechanized agriculture. 

Edward needs the loan to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for planting

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a 32-year-old hardworking man living in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For three years he has been in the retail trade, and the money generated has enabled him to take care of his parents. He faces the challenge of having limited funds to meet the demands of his customers and he longs to become a wholesale trader. Kenneth needs this loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan is a sixty-seven-year-old enterprising married man.  He has four children and lives in his own permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He has been engaged in agriculture for four years.  He started with two acres of land but now farms on six acres.  His ambition is owning about fifty acres. Dan needs a loan to prepare land for farming.

loans.use: To prepare land for farming

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a twenty-seven-year-old married woman with four children, living in her own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has a dream of buying land and educating her children. 

For six years she has been in the retail trading business.  Her  business is still at its boom stage despite the high cost of rent in town.  Hawa needs a loan to purchase sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar,cooking oil ,maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a forty-eight-year-old married woman with seven children.  She has her own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is the bread winner of the family and her dream is setting up a sustainable income-generating activity and educating her children.

For thirty years she has been into farming, running a large banana plantation despite challenges in price fluctuations.  Agnes desires to venture into livestock and poultry.  She needs this loan to clear her farm and buy chickens.

loans.use: To clear farmland and buy chickens

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-seven-year-old married man living in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He buys and sells maize and has been in business for ten years.  The fluctuating price of maize is a challenge for him.  His dream is to own a store. Joseph needs this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Geofry

texts.en:
Geofry is a 46-year-old married man with nine children. He lives in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been trading in goats for two years. He got his initial capital from farming. 

He has a challenge in high transport costs. His dream is to own a ranch. Geofry needs the loan to buy goats for resale.

loans.use: Buying goats to sell

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a very hardworking married man with seven children. He is the sole breadwinner of the family and lives in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He longs to educate his children up to university. 

For 10 years, he has been rearing animals. He has challenges in transport costs and prolonged dry seasons; however, he wishes to set up a modern farm. Saidi needs the loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a forty nine year old married man with seven children living in his own house with a dream of educating his children to attain a degree as minimum qualification. For thirty years he has been working in the agricultural sector and the proceeds have enabled him to pay school fees for his children. He has challenges of price fluctuations and in future he wants to be a specialized commercial farmer. Francis needs the loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: Buying maize for planting.

loans.name: Tukole Kakindo Group

texts.en: Christine, with hand raised, is a member of Tukole Kakindo group. She is 43 years old and the mother of six. Her spouse is a business man and they live in their own three-room house in Hioma, Uganda. She started her business selling clothes and textiles with a capital of 200,000ugx and now she has  3,000,000ugx in working capital. She faces the challenge of customers who fail to pay their debts; her aspiration is owning a boutique. Christine needs the loan to buy more clothes for sell.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and textiles to sell.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is a 53-year-old hard-working woman, married, and a mother of 8 living in her own house in Hioma, Uganda. Safina has been operating a clothing and textile business for 10 years, and she started small, but now it's gradually improving. She faces a challenge of bad debtors and hopes that her business will grow bigger than what it is now. Safina needs the loan to purchase clothing, bags and suitcases for sale.

loans.use: Buying clothing, suitcases & bags for sale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 38 years old married with 4 children, and her husband is a farmer living in Hioma, Uganda. She has been running a hotel business for 5 years and started it after selling her farm surplus produce. She dreams of owning a popular hotel in town and educating her children. Evelyn needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Paying school fees.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is married with 4 children, living in Hioma, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children up to University. For three years he has been operating a shop, and this has enabled him to pay school fees for his children. He has a challenge of price fluctuation, and his desire is owning a wholesale shop. Patrick needs the loan to buy rice, sugar and maize flour for selling.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar and maize flour for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a married woman with 3 children living in her own house in Hioma, Uganda. For seven years she has been trading in maize and beans. She faces a challenge of inadequate business capital and inthe future, she hopes to set up a store. Vivian needs the loan for to buy maize and beans for seling.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for selling

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en: Hadijah is  a 32-year-old married woman and the breadwinner of the family living in Hioma, Uganda. She has been running a business of shoes and hair weaves for two years. She started with capital of 500,000ugx, but now she has a stock of 1,200,000ugx. She hopes to set up a boutique. Hadijah needs the loan to buy shoes and weaves for selling.

loans.use: Buying shoes & weaves for selling.

loans.name: Kanyatsi Tukibaghuma Group

texts.en: Jostus is a twenty-nine year-old married man with four children.  He owns a house in Kasese ,Uganda. He has been  trading in coffee for the last seven years.  He started with capital of 200,000UGX and now has one million as working capital. His challenges include price fluctuation and pests and his vision is to set up a coffee store that supplies the western region of Uganda.He is a member of Kanyatsi Tukibaghuma group where each member guarantees the other.Jostus needs the loan to buy coffee for sell.

loans.use: Buying  coffee for sell.

loans.name: Mwanandonga

texts.en:
Mwanandogo is a married woman with four children, all graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills.

Mwanandogo has operated a business selling charcoal for the past fifteen years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also sells firewood, which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanandogo faces a major business challenge of high transportation costs for charcoal. She hopes to establish real estate houses in the future.

Mwanandogo plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cement, boards... to renovate her house

loans.name: Agustin

texts.fr: Augustin U. est travailleur de centre de sante, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il est ne a Rwanda, il est marie, et il a 5 enfants entre 6 mois et 15 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école, et Augustin a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  Il va utiliser ce prêt pour le paiement des minervaux de ces enfants, et l’achat de l’aliment pour sa famille.  Il voudrait éduquer ses enfants pour qu’ils terminent leurs études, et avoir la bonne vie pour sa famille.
texts.en: Augustin U. is a health care worker and has been a client of ACB since 2007. He was born in Rwanda, is married, and has five children, ages 6 months to 15 years of age. Four of his children attend school. Augustin himself has completed six years of primary schooling. He is going to use this loan to cover the school fees for his children and to buy food for his family. He would like to educate his children, so that they complete their studies, and to provide a good life for his family.

loans.use: Paying the school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying beans for retail sale

loans.name: Twunganirane Dusabirana Group

texts.fr: Janvier Niyibizi est notre client depuis 2011, il est marié,il a 4 enfants entre 7 et 1 an, le lieu et pays de naissance est Bugesera – Rwanda, il est membre du groupe solidaire appelé Twunganirane Dusabirana. Il fait le commerce de détaille de récolte (haricot, sorgho, chèvres,…), et son prêt c’est pour acheter ses articles. Il veut augmenter son capital pour améliorer ses activités de son commerce. Son ambition et vision c’est d’élever ses enfants jusqu'à un niveau élevé. Et faire du bien pour sa famille.
texts.en: Janvier Niyibizi has been our client since 2011. He is married and has four children, ages 1 to 7. His place of birth is Bugesera, in Rwanda. He is a member of the solidarity group called Twunganirane Dusabirana.  His retail business involves farm products (beans, sorghum, goats...), and his loan is for buying his supplies. Janvier wants to increase his capital to improve his commerce. His ambition and vision is to raise his children well and to do some good for his family.

loans.use: Buying supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing oil, rice and powdered milk for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing various goods for door-to-door sales

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing goats, beans and sorghum

loans.name: Nhlanhlayethu Group

texts.en:
Ntombikayise is 47 years old and married with 7 children between the ages of 10 and 33. She sells mats house to house in Mtubatuba, KwaZ. Natal in South Africa. She is wearing a black and white head scarf in the photo above.

She's been in this business for 10 years. She also earns income from the government's child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is that her customers do not pay on time.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy material for making mats. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children to school. In the future, she would like to see herself being a mats supplier.

She thanks WDB and Kiva very much.

loans.use: Buy material for making mats

loans.name: Wandile Group

texts.en:
Bahlakaniphile is 65 years old and married with 3 children, aged 20, 28, and 30. One of them is still attending school. She sells meat, vegetables, fruit, and clothes from her home. She has other four relatives that she lives with and takes care of. She also receives other income from the government's old age support grant. In the photo, she is the second from the left.

She's been in this business for over 6 years. She says that the main challenge to her business is that the customers buy on credit and pay later than she expected. Bahlakaniphile would like to own a big vegetable market and butchery in five years' time.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Business and KIVA to buy fruit and vegetables, meat, clothes, and cold drinks. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children to university and driving school. In five years' time she would like to build a shelter specially for her business. 

She added that KIVA and WDB are very helpful to them because they can easily manage to do their businesses from their very own home.

loans.use: Buying meat, cold drinks, clothes, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Qalakancane Group

texts.en:
Makhosazana is 62 years of age, single and has two children who are 27 and 35. She runs a clothing business in Mtubatuba, South Africa (KZN). She is pictured in the center of the photo, raising her hand.

She has been in her business for seven years and sells new clothes in town. She also receives a child support grant from the government. She says the main challenges to her business are customers who do not pay on time.

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy material of making mats like a saw, needles, etc. She also adds that the extra income from this loan will help her extend her home and take her child to tertiary education. In future she would like to see her business grow and become a supplier.

loans.use: To buy clothing and mat-making materials, e.g., needles and a saw

loans.name: Erdenesuvd

texts.en:
Erdenesuvd is 31, single, and a micro-entrepreneur. She lives in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She studied to become a tourism manager. She sells machine oil and motor oil at her two stalls with help from her younger brother. She also helps and supports her younger brother’s family by operating her business.

When she first began her business in 1996, she was only 16 years old and she had 20,000 MNT in working capital at her small stall. Since this time, she has been working hard and her business has grown so that today she has 2,000,000 MNT in working capital invested in her two stalls. She built her own small house with her business earnings in 2010. 

She wants to use this loan to help support her during this very busy shopping season of the year. She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more machine oil and motor oil to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more machine oil and motor oil

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en: Amarjargal is a 42-year-old, hardworking woman who supports her family by running a clothing retail store at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent), in the suburbia of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has two elder daughters in college and a younger son and daughter in kindergarten. Since Amarjargal and her husband are meeting their childrens’ tuition fee expenses, they are trying their best to have enough money for future needs. Amarjargal and her husband started their clothing business in 2007, with 500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in their working capital. They have two stalls at the market; therefore, Amarjargal and her husband work separately. She frequently imports clothes from Beijing and Ereen from China, plus Amarjargal sews and produces coats, leather jackets and other different kinds of clothes by herself and sells them at her stall as well. Amarjargal is requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase more clothes for the upcoming season. Her priority is to give an excellent education and better living conditions to her children. Moreover, she wants to buy a car at a reasonable price.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for the upcoming season

loans.name: Erdenedalai

texts.en:
Erdenedalai, age 27, lives with his wife, their two small daughters (ages one and three) and his mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger districts of the city. His mother is retired, so she babysits Erdenedalai’s kids and stays at home. 

Erdenedalai supports his family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia with the help of his wife.

When he first began his business, he had 1,800,000 MNT in working capital in 2006. At the beginning stages of his business, he rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for him because the middleman could dismiss him at any time. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand. However, in 2008, Erdenedalai had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make his business more stable.

As a result of his hard work, today he has 3,000,000 MNT in his working capital. Besides that, with the profit of her business, he bought a used car, as transportation has became an essential need for his family. Erdenedalai is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT in order to purchase more clothes for spring. 

His goal for 2011 is to build his own house, where his family can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring to offer for sale in his retail stall

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is 27-year-old accomplished and hardworking young woman from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She lives in a small house in the suburbia with her husband and two kids. Her husband works at furniture manufacturing company and daughter goes to a kindergarten while her son attends local public school. 

She started running a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, in 2006 with 200,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in her working capital. At the beginning stages of her business, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. At this time her stall had 1 million MNT in working capital. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand.
However, in 2007, Ms. Odgerel had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. As a result of her hard work, today she has 2,500,000 MNT in her working capital. Besides that, with the profit of her business, she managed to build new small house for living and bought two yards to extend. Moreover, she has just bought a car, which is used for couple years, which has become essential need for her family. 

Altantuya is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT. With this loan, she wants to import more clothes for spring from Beijing, China. Her long term objective is to buy an apartment where her family can have a better living condition. Altantuya and her husband are trying their best to achieve their goals.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en: Gerelmaa is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 9 and 18, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Her daughter is a student while her son attends public school. Her husband is also an entrepreneur. Gerelmaa supports her family by operating two clothing retail stalls at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with her husband. When she first began her business in 2000, she sold all types of her handmade coats at another person's stall and had 200,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Now her business has grown so that today, her working capital is 3,000,000 MNT. She sells clothes imported from Ereen, a border city of China, as well as her handmade clothes in her own two stalls. During these years, she has been successfully improving her life and her business. With her profits, she bought a medium-sized ger and car in 2008. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase clothing materials and more clothes from Ereen. Her goal in 2011 is to expand her business with this loan and then to be able to buy her own small house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and clothing materials to sew coats

loans.name: Mendsuren

texts.en:
Mendsuren is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three children, aged between 10 and 15, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, in the outer districts of the city. Her children attend public school. Her husband works as a top sergeant at a local squad of soldiers.

Mendsuren supports her family by operating two clothing retail stalls at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She began her business in 2002. Her business has grown so that today she has 2,000,000 Mongollian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She has been successfully expanding her business and has been able to improve her living conditions. She bought a car for her husband in 2008 and built her small house in 2009 with her business earnings. With this loan of 1,500,000 MNT, she’ll purchase more coats for spring from Beijing, the capital city of China.

She wants to improve her business with this loan, and to be able to expand her small house.

loans.use: To purchase more coats for spring.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Batsaikhan is 42 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer districts of the city. Her daughter attends college.

Batsaikhan supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with help from her husband.

When she first began his business, at Narantuul in 2000, she didn’t have a stall and she sold her handmade clothing at her friend's stall. In 2002, she expanded her business by beginning to rent her own stall. Today she has 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) and sells clothes imported from Ereen, a city bordering on China, as well as her handmade clothes. She bought her land with 2 million MNT of her business profits in 2008. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more clothes for spring.

Her goal is to grow her business with this loan and be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring.

loans.name: Gunjilmaa

texts.en:
Gunjilmaa is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children, aged from 7 to 21 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Her son works as a driver at a local company, while both of her daughters attend public school.

She supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, with help from her husband.

She began her business in 2000. Her business has grown so that today she has 2,500,000 Mongollian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She sells clothes imported from Ereen, a border city of China, as well as her handmade coats in her stall.

She has been successfully expanding her business and was able to improve her living conditions. She said "I want to grow my business with this loan and I would like to be able to build my own house in the future." in order to increase her variety of products for spring, she is requesting a loan 1,500,000 MNT.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring.

loans.name: Tsatsral

texts.en:
Tsatsral is 27, married, and a micro-entrepreneur. She lives with her husband and two children, aged two and four, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her children attend kindergarten. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. For the past five years, she has supported her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, with help from her husband.

She began her business in 2005, and today her working capital is 2.6 million MNT. She purchases her products every three months from Ereen, a city that borders on China. She is friendly and has a lot of regular customers. She wants to expand her working capital with this loan, and to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to increase her clothing inventory for spring. 

Her goal is to improve her living conditions by building her own small house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing inventory for spring.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es: Arístides, de 56 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado esposo Heraclio de 57 años y de su hija mayor, de los seis que tiene, pues el resto son mayores y tienen sus propias familias. Esta trabajadora mujer siempre se las ingenió para generarse sus propios ingresos, ni los años ni el tiempo le han quitado las ganas que tiene de salir adelante. En la actualidad brinda menús (comida diaria) en el paradero de la línea de transportes donde trabaja su esposo. En el lugar atiende a diario a todos los trabajadores y le brinda su comida; además ofrece gaseosas y chupetes de hielo, y le va muy bien solo que le hace falta constante capital para invertirlo. Aunque empieza a cocinar muy temprano se esfuerza por atender a tiempo a sus comensales y a partir del mediodía empieza a servirles con la ayuda de una de sus hijas. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de diversos comestibles en su restaurante, pues algunos comensales a veces le piden algo y ella no les puede ofrecer, de esta manera quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Arístides tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que le hacen falta para continuar con su negocio; además quiere empezar a implementar su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Arístides is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Heraclio who is 57, and her eldest daughter.  She has six children but the rest of them are adults and have their own families.  This hard-working woman has always been able to generate her own income and neither her age nor lack of time have been able to stand in her way as far as getting ahead is concerned.

She has a food stall set up at the bus-stop of the transport line where her husband works.  She sells food, softdrinks and popsicles to all the workers on a daily basis.  Business is going well but she needs more capital to cover costs.  She gets up very early in the morning to cook the food that she later serves to her customers at noon with the help of one of her daughters.

In the future she would like to set up a grocery store in her stall because sometimes customers ask for certain products that she doensn't have.  She sees this as a way of increasing her income.

This is her fifth loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time since she would not want to disappoint the lenders who are making it possible for her to continue working and seeking a better lifestyle.  Arístides plans to use the loan to purchase food stall ingredients and grocery store products.

loans.use: To purchase food stall ingredients and grocery store products

loans.name: Jazmina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jazmina es una mujer comerciante, con su propio negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos, iniciando hace seis años, con productos de Avon que envió su  hermano de los Estados Unidos de América.
Para ella fue una gran ayuda ya que es madre soltera de dos hijos, y ha logrado aprovechar esta oportunidad de invertir más en su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias, con los financiamientos que la institución ha dado. 
Lo que comprara es una paca de ropa de segunda mano, y cosméticos en variedad para seguir atrayendo clientes nuevos, a si como incrementar las ventas para un mejor resultado en su economía.
texts.en:
Jazmina is a merchant with her own business selling clothing and cosmetics, which she has been doing for six years. She sells Avon products that her brother sends from the United States.

The loan that the institution has given her has been a great help to her because she is a single mother to two children. She has used this opportunity to invest more in her business so she can have greater earnings. 

She will buy a bale of second-hand clothing and a variety of cosmetics, so that she can continue to attract new clients. This way she will increase sales so she can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing to increase her variety of clothing, and to buy costmetics

loans.name: Rosita Jorgina

texts.es: La señora Rosita Jorgina V. C. , tiene la edad de 39 años , habita en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposo el cual labora como albañil , para apoyarla con los gastos de hogar , ellos  tienen tres hijos  los cuales estudian y le apoyan con el negocio , doña Rosita desde hace   16 años se dedica a la venta de ropa , zapatos , cosméticos entre otras actividades para poder darle un mejor bienestar a sus hijos , los planes  hacia un futuro es poder verlos realizados con unos profesionales y no pasen todas las necesidades por las  cuales se ha enfrentado para poder darle el alimento de cada día ,la señora con el primer crédito amplio su negocio ya que ella ahora tiene hasta un pequeño salón de belleza para obtener más ingresos  , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva ya que ah mejorado su condición de vida , ahora quiere este segundo ciclo para invertirlo en comprar de ropa y zapato.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosita Jorgina V. C. is 39 years old and lives in the town of Concepción. She and her husband, who works as a mason, support one another with the household expenses. They have three children in school who help her with her business. For the past sixteen years, Doña Rosita has been selling clothes, shoes, and cosmetics to provide for her children’s welfare. Her plans for the future include seeing them become professionals. There is not a day that goes by in which she tries to meet the daily needs of her children.

With her first loan, Sra. Rosita expanded her business and now she has a small beauty salon that helps her generate more income. She is grateful for the support AFODENIC has provided with the Kiva funds so that she could improve her living conditions. Now that she is in her second loan cycle, Rosita wants to invest in the purchase of clothing and shoes.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillerma, de 44 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Julio de 50 años y de sus tres hijos, de los cuales solo se hace cargo de los dos menores, pues el mayor ya trabaja y se mantiene, juntos se esfuerzan por progresar cada día. Desde hace tres años, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la preparación de diversidad de postres y tortas que deja tres veces a la semana en las tiendas aledañas a su casa. Dice que este negocio empezó en conjunto pues se unieron junto a algunas damas de su zona y se ha vuelto muy provechoso. Ahora se ayudan, pero comercializan por separado sus productos y esta muy contenta pues obtiene buenas ganancias que le han permitido comprar sus propios moldes con el tiempo. Es una labor que le gusta mucho y le ha permitido crecer empresarialmente pues tiene nuevos compradores y sus ganancias han aumentado; además prepara bocaditos para diversos eventos de su zona, lo que le permite ganar bien, sobretodo durante los fines de semana. Para el futuro tiene planeado, junto con sus amigas, formalizar su empresa para lograr vender grandes cadenas de tiendas y colocar su marca. Es el 16avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar progresando en su negocio. Guillerma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que necesita para continuar con su negocio; además tiene un gran pedido de bocaditos para un evento y quiere cumplir sin dificultad.
texts.en:
Guillerma is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Julio who is 50, and their three children.  They are only financially responsible for the youngest two since their eldest works and is independent.  For three years now this hard-working woman has been in the bakery business and sells all kinds of desserts and cakes to the neighboring stores where she makes delivery three times a week.  

She began the business with other women in her neighborhood and it has become very profitable. They continue to help each other but sell their products individually.  Guillerma is happy about the fact that she has been able to buy her own molds over time thanks to her high earnings.  She enjoys her work and has been able to grow her business, increase her customer base and make more income.  She also sells hors d'oeuvres for special events in the area, especially on weekends, and this provides additional income.

In the future she would like to set up a company, with her friends and under their own brand, that would supply to large chain stores.  This is her 16th loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time since she would not want to disappoint the lenders who are helping her get ahead.  Guillerma plans to use the loan to buy ingredients so she can continue with her business, and to help with the cost of a large hors d'oeuvres order she has for an upcoming event.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for bakery products

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es: Jakeline, de 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus hermanos menores; y a pesar de su juventud ella se esfuerza a diario para salir adelante. Desde hace un año, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca; dice que empezó porque su madre vendía y así la animó a ofrecer a sus amigas y conocidas. Le esta yendo muy bien pues obtiene ganancias mensuales que le permiten pagar sus estudios de diseño de modas y también se dedica a diseñar ropa, y por esta razón necesita un capital que le permita invertir en tela y los implementos necesarios para empezar a fabricar modelos para  cambio de estación. Aunque ya empezó con el negocio de confección de ropa, quiere aumentarlo pues tiene muchos contactos, y así espera aumentar sus ganancias. Como es una joven muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de ropa, pero ella quiere crear su propio estilo y moda. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Jakeline tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de tela para empezar a confeccionar pantalones de polar y también comprará algunos productos de belleza, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jakeline is 20 years and lives with her parents and younger siblings.  Despite her young age she has worked hard every day to get ahead.  For a year now she has been selling a well-known brand of beauty products.  She started this activity at the suggestion of her mother who was already selling the products and thought her daughter could sell to her friends and aquaintances.

Business is going well and she is able to obtain enough monthly income to cover the cost of her fashion design course.  She also designs cloths and needs capital to purchase fabric and necessary items to begin making clothes for the upcoming season.

Although she has already begun her dressmaking business she wants to expand and increase her customer base and earnings.  As a young entrepreneur she plans to open a clothing store and sell her own styles and fashions.  This is her first loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time since she would not want to disappoint the lenders who are helping her to develop and improve her lifestyle.  Jakeline plans to use the loan to purchase fabric to make polar trousers and to buy beauty products so she can increase earnings.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and beauty products

loans.name: Kony Alexander

texts.es: La señora Kony  Alexander C. C. , tiene la edad de 29 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo que labora como mecánico ; ya que tiene tres hijos que necesitan del apoyo de ambos , los sueños de doña Kony es poder apoyarlo hasta que terminen sus estudios , doña Kony desde hace siete año se dedica a los trabajos de campo ya que su papá le heredo un pequeño terreno donde ella cultiva piña , la cual carece de fertilizantes e insumos  , teniendo como resultado una descoloración amarillenta. La mayor dificultad que se le presento en este segundo crédito fue la baja del precio de la piña  y solo saco el costo de la inversión. Se siente contenta  con el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de Kiva, ya que los interés son bajos y eso le ayuda a mejor su condiciones de vida, con crédito para pequeños agricultores como ella. El préstamo lo quiere para la comprar fertilizantes e insumos.
texts.en:
Sra. Kony Alexander C. C. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband who works as a mechanic. They have three children who need support from both of them. Doña Kony dreams of helping them finish their studies. For the past seven years, she has been cultivating pineapple on a small plot of land that she inherited from her father. Her crops lack fertilizers and supplies, which has resulted in a yellowish discoloration. The greatest difficulty she faces upon receiving her second loan is the low price of pineapple, so she is only requesting the minimum amount needed for this investment.

Kony is pleased to have the support of Kiva funds through AFODENIC because the interest rates are low, which helps small farmers like her improve their living conditions. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 29 años, vive al lado de su esposo Carlos de 33 años, que es albañil y su hija pequeña; juntos se esfuerzan a diario por salir adelante. Desde hace dos años, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas (papas y hot dog fritos) en su carrito sanguchero que saca todos los días afuera de la casa de su hermano, ya que se ubica dentro de zona muy transitada y comercial. Le gusta mucho su labor, pues le permite trabajar durante pocas horas, de 6 de la tarde a 11 de la noche, y así obtiene buenas ganancias diarias. Dice que prepara todo desde el mediodía sin descuidar sus labores del hogar, pero lo que todavía no ha podido concretar es adecuar un lugar para que sus comensales degusten de sus platillos  con tranquilidad, es por esta razón que le gustaría comprar mesas y sillas en el futuro. Ella necesita invertir el crédito en ingredientes al por mayor para continuar con su negocio sin problemas, además empezará comprando dos  bancas para que sus comensales se sientan cómodos. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lidia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que le hacen falta para su negocio como (papas, aceite, huevos, hamburguesas) asimismo comprar gas para su cocina, del mismo modo desea comprar dos bancas para la comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lidia is 29 years old and lives with her husband Carlos, 33, and their young daughter.  They make a daily effort to get ahead.  For two years now this hard-working woman has been selling hamburgers and "salchipapas" (hot dogs and french fries) out of a cart that she parks every day outside her brother's home which is in a very busy shopping area.  She enjoys her work, which she does from 6:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m., and obtains significant daily earnings.

Her work preparations begin at noon, after she has done the housework.  She hasn't been able to find an adequate place where her customers can enjoy their food in a calm atmosphere so she would like to buy tables and chairs in the future.

She needs a loan to purchase cooking ingredients in bulk so she can keep the business going without difficulties and she wants to buy two benches for her customers so they are more comfortable.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time since she does not want to disappoint the lenders who are helping her get ahead.  Lidia plans to use the loan to purchase ingredients for her business (potatoes, oil, eggs, hamburgers), cooking gas and two benches.

loans.use: To purchase non-perishable goods and cooking gas

loans.name: Desarrollo Comunitario 5 Group

texts.en:
Alberto’s group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home there in a simple structure with his long-term partner.

Alberto is excited to be taking his 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business selling coconuts by purchasing more coconuts to sell.

Alberto will use the profits to invest in his home by adding telephone services, buying some concrete block for his house and some medicine.  His long-term ambition is to have a truck to haul his coconuts and an improved business. He thanks you all for your support. 

Alberto is the coordinator of his group, Desrrollo Comunitario 5 (Community Development), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

loans.use: to buy coconuts

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Teofilo de 44 años y sus tres hijos de los cuales solo se hace cargo del último, pues los mayores trabajan y se mantienen; juntos buscan alcanzar el progreso. Desde hace 10 años, esta dama se dedica al negocio de artesanía, ella al lado de su esposo y tres ayudantes más fabrican diferentes accesorios (collares, pulseras, aretes y anillos). El tiempo y las ganancias le permitieron comprarse su propia máquina y los implementos necesarios que necesitaba para producir en mayor cantidad,  es por esta razón es que esta muy satisfecha. Su esposo comercializa la producción en accesorios en diferentes distritos turísticos de la capital y obtiene regulares ganancias. Solo que necesita un capital para invertirlo en cantidad de materiales, pues quiere comprar en cantidad la piedra y tintes que emplea en la fabricación de los accesorios, pues como vive al norte de la ciudad si compra de a pocos gasta mucho pasaje. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su producción y empezar a exportar sus accesorios. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Vilma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales en cantidad que necesita para continuar con su trabajo, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Vilma is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Teofilo, 44, and their three children.  They are financially responsible only for the youngest child since the older two have jobs and cover their own expenses.  All together they are seeking a better lifestyle.  For ten years now Vilma has been making handicrafts together with her husband and three assistants.  They make different kinds of accessories (necklaces, bracelets, earrings and rings).  Over time, with their earnings they have been able to buy their own machine and necessary tools to produce more quantity, for which they are very happy.

Her husband sells the products in the tourist areas of the city and makes a regular income.  But more funding is required to buy bulk materials such as stones and dyes that are used in the production process.  Since they live north of the city it is more expensive to make frequent trips to purchase small amounts.

Being an enterprising woman, Vilma has plans to increase production and begin exporting her accessories.  This is her third loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time since she would not want to disappoint the lenders who are helping her get ahead.  She plans to use the loan to purchase bulk materials for her work so she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase bulk materials to make necklaces

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maritza; La socia tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, (33,30,14); la socia es jubilada y se dedica a elaborar chompas ella teje lindas chompas D. lana para mujeres, varones y niños; la socia  también venD. ropas, para niños y adultos; la socia desea en esta oportunidad el crédito para poder comprar ropa y también invertir una parte D. dinero en la compra D. madejas D. lanas, hilos, agujas y botones. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocioy desea comprar lana.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Amauta" located in the district and province of Urubamba, department of Cusco. 

The member is Maritza, 50 years of age, married with three children (33, 30 and 14). She is retired and dedicates her time to making sweaters. She knits beautiful wool sweaters for women, men and children and also sells clothing for adults and children. The member wishes to take advantage of the loan being offered to buy clothing and also invest part of the money in the purchase of skeins of wool yarn, thread, needles and buttons. The member seeks the loan to invest in her business. 

The member is happy with the loan that has been granted and promises to make her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar casado, su esposa sabe de repostería la cual practica siendo un ingreso extra, sus cuatros hijos estudian, el objetivo que se profesionalicen. Trabajo como taxista desde hace tiempo siendo el medio de sustentar a su familia. Su mayor proyecto es realizar mejoras poco a poco en su vivienda para ofrecerle a sus familia seguridad, comodidad.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a su desarrollo en lo personal. Con el préstamo comprará materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedra cantera, alambre de amarre, hierro, azulejos para construir la parte de la cocina que requiere de remodelarlo ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Cesar is married; his wife knows a lot about dessert making, which she does to bring in extra income.  Their four children study with the objective of becoming professionals.  He has worked for awhile as a taxi driver, which is how he sustains his family.  His big project is making improvements little by little to their home to offer his family security and comfort.

He is grateful to the bank for the support in his personal development.  With the loan he will buy construction materials: cement, sand, granite, fastening wire, iron, and floor tiles to build the part of the kitchen that needs remodeling since it is in bad condition.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 42 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Chichero, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hermosos hijos. Actualmente, Hilda vive en la ciudad donde nació y se encuentra muy feliz de vivir en su tierra natal, ella nos cuenta que la mayoría de los pobladores que viven en la ciudad se dedican a la elaboración, compra y venta de artesanía. Hilda no es la excepción y también se dedica a ese negocio, ella pertenece a la Asociación de Artesanos Kusicoyllor de Chinchero. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. 

Hilda en esta oportunidad requiere el microcrédito para comprar más artesanía o materiales para la fabricación de chompas de lana, bufandas y entre otras.
texts.en:
Hilda is 42 years of age and was born in the city of Chichero. She is married and has three beautiful children with her husband. Currently Hilda lives in the city of her birth and finds she is quite happy living in her native land. She tells us that the majority of the inhabitants of the city earn their living creating, buying and selling handicraft. Hilda is no exception and also dedicates herself to that business. She belongs to the Kusicoyllor Handcrafter's Association of Chinchero. She has been at her business for fifteen years and is doing very well thanks to the perseverance she shows in her work. 

Hilda on this occasion requires the loan for the purchase of more handcrafted goods or materials for making wool sweaters and scarves, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase more handcrafted goods or materials.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: El señor Carlos Luis López P. , tiene la edad de 42 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la  cual labora como domestica , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar  ellos tienen tres hijos la mayor  es  casada y  los dos menores estudian , don Carlos tiene el sueño de algún día poder comprar un camioneta de segunda  para ya no pagar acarreo ; ya que cada vez que traslada su producto al mercado tiene que pagar acarreo para venderlo , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de recurso para poder establecer una manzana de piña y  así mismo obtener más ingreso , don Carlos cuenta con una producción de piña de hace dos años  la cual necesita inducirla para poder sacar un buen tamaño , sabor y color , El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos .
texts.en: Mr. Carlos Luis L. P. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife, who works as a domestic employee to help cover their cost of living.  They have three children; the oldest is married and the younger two are in school.  Carlos has the dream of one day buying a used truck so that he doesn't have to pay transport fees anymore, since every time he moves his product to the market he has to pay for transportation to be able to sell it.  His major difficulty is the lack of resources to be able to establish a larger plot of pineapple and therefore bring in more money.  Carlos has been growing pineapple for 2 years.  Pineapple needs help to get a good size, flavor and color.  The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and inputs

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana nació en la ciudad D. Chinchero y tiene 56 años D. edad. Actualmente, Juana vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació junto con su pareja, ella y su esposo tiene cuatro hijos D. las cuales todos son profesionales. Juana nos cuenta que no fue fácil sacar adelante a su familia pero las adversidades se hicieron cada días más fuerte. Ahora,  Juana trabaja para asegurar su vejez pues se dedica a la venta D. comestibles y comida en la pequeña tienda donD. comparte los rubros. Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Victoria” donD. se presta dinero pero en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles y útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Juana was born in the city of Chinchero and is 56 years of age. Currently Juana lives in the same city where she was born along with her partner. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are professionals. Juana tells us that raising her family was not easy but the adversities maD. them stronger day by day. Now Juana works to proviD. security in her old age, selling both grocery items and prepared foods in a small store.  

Juana belongs to the communal bank "Nueva Victoria" [New Victory] where money is loaned out. On this occasion she requires the loan to purchase grocery items and school supplies.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and school supplies

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: La Srta. Blanca nacida en San Matías Provincia de Santa Cruz de la Sierra soltera de 25 años de edad,  la Srta. Blanca administra un taller de conversión a gas recibiendo un porcentaje de los trabajos realizados, le va muy bien en esta actividad, ella es una persona joven y muy trabajadora. El crédito que se le otorgo para el incremento de su capital de trabajo (compra de emulador, variador de avance, fierros, pernos y otros). "manifestó su satisfacción agradeciendo por la rapidez del crédito y la confianza depositada en ella".
texts.en: Blanca was born in San Matías in the province of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She's 25-years-old and single. She runs a gas conversion shop and receives a portion from the work she does. She enjoys this activity. She's a young, hardworking person. This loan is to increase her working capital (purchase of an emulator, advancement variator, metal, bolts, and other things). She's grateful for the speed of the loan and the trust it she has received.

loans.use: to buy an emulator, advancement variator, metal, bolts, and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Elizabeth; La socia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos, (22,20); la socia es docente y actualmente ella enseña en el colegio Comercio 41 de señoritas; la socia pertenece a este banco comunal desde hace 10 años y le gusta reunirse con sus amigas con este motivo, ella comenta que es un grupo alegre, ameno y muy bien organizado; la socia con este crédito desea invertir en la educación de sus hijos, ellos están en la universidad y la socia junto a su esposo se hacen cargo de los estudios de sus hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus hijos.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the Amauta Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Elizabeth is 52 years old, married, and has two children (22 and 20).  She is a teacher, and she is currently teaching at the Comercio 41 school for girls.  She has belonged to this communal bank for ten years.  She likes getting together with her friends regarding her communal bank.  She says that the group is happy, agreeable, and very well organized.

She wishes to use the loan to invest in her children’s education.  They are attending the university.  She and her husband take responsibility for their children’s education.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her children’s education.

She is happy with the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 42 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de chincheros, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa unión tiene  6 hijos, ella nos cuenta que en la ciudad de chinchero se encuentra una de las más importantes ciudad arqueológicas del Imperio de los Incas y por ende las mayoría de los pobladores se dedican  a la elaboración, venta y compra de artesanía.
