Sus clientas se sienten contentas por la manera como las atiende y entrega los pedidos a tiempo, al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta porque podrá comprar su mercancía y con las ganancias que obtenga podrá apoyar a su familia porque su mamá se encuentra en recuperación de una operación que le realizaron y ella es el único apoyo que tiene. Observaciones, la señora que no se ve bien se llama Victoria R..
texts.en:
The name of this group is "The Emeralds of Huatecalco" and it is located in the state of Morelos in Mexico. This community is well known because the majority of the population is dedicated to the cultivation of sugar cane. This is the most important business in the region. The group is made up of 11 members. Maria Natividad N. Penaloza is a member of the group. She  sells cosmetics, a business she started three years ago. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise and to be able to fill the orders that she has outstanding. She is single and she is 19 years old. She has a grade 9 education. her clients are happy for the way they are serviced and because she delivers their orders on time.  At the time when she requested her loan she was happy because she will be able to purchase merchandise and with the earnings she will be able to support her family. Her mother is convalescing in hospital from an operation and hers is the only support they have. 

Note: The individual that cannot be seen clearly is Victoria R..

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Amig Chaco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIG CHACO” iniciará el ciclo número ocho en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Julia, la  presidenta.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de medicamentos, costura, venta de dulces, venta de tejidos de ropa para bebé, venta de comida, producción de estuco, venta de ropa de niños, elaboración de colchas tejidas para bebé.

La señora Julia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C. “Amig Chaco”  siete ciclos, aproximadamente  tres años y medio.  Con respeto a su actividad económica, la señora Julia tuvo como negocio el tejido de chompas y sus créditos iniciales fueron destinados a la compra de lana;  desde hace un año tiene el negocio de costura de chamarras.  El cambio de negocio fue debido a que uno de sus hijos aprendió a coser deportivos en un país  extranjero; cuando su hijo regresó le propuso iniciar el negocio de costura de deportivos y ella aceptó.  Además de trabajar con la costura de deportivos, la señora Julia indica que negocia con papa, haba y arbeja.  Este último negocio requiere que la señora Julia viaje a las ferias que se efectúan en el campo, compre los productos mencionados y los traiga para la venta en la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito de este ciclo es para comprar tela para los deportivos y  papa, haba y arbejas.

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a sus cuatro hijos (27 años, 25 años, 22 años, 20 años) y velar por ella misma, siendo que no tiene pareja.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustó que le dieran la oportunidad de recibir  crédito con la garantía solidaria, “es un crédito fácil” dijo ella.
texts.en:
The “AMIG CHACO” community bank will begin its eighth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Collpani center.  It is made up of eight members. The community bank is led by a board of directors and the head of this is Julia, the president. The community bank's members' businesses are varied. Among them we have: selling medications, sewing, selling candies, selling fabric for children's clothing, selling food, making stucco, selling children's clothes, and making babies' blankets.    

Julia, the president of the community bank, indicates that she has been a part of “Amig Chaco” for seven cycles, approximately three years and a half. In regards to her economic activity, Julia had a business knitting sweaters and her first loans were for buying wool. For a year she has had a business sewing jackets. The change was due to the fact that one of her children learned to sew jackets abroad. When her son came home, he proposed starting the business sewing jackets and she agreed. In addition to sewing jackets, Julia trades in potatoes, beans and peas. This business requires Julia to travel to the markets in the countryside where she buys the products and brings them to sell in the city of El Alto.

The loan this cycle is to buy fabric for the jackets and potatoes, beans and peas. 

The way of working allows her to generate resources to support her four children as much as possible (aged 27, 25, 22 and 20) as well as to take care of herself, since she is single. 
  
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she liked that she was given the chance to receive a loan withe the supportive co-sign. "It's an easy loan" she said.

loans.use: to buy fabric, potatoes, beans and peas.

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en:
One has to learn and re-learn certain values in life in order to develop the right attitude and become successful. At the age of 50, Paciencia Pisuana is committed to re-learning many things in her life. She only attained a high school education, but she makes sure she understands and applies every lesson she receives from CCT* as a community partner. Paciencia and her husband Ferdinand, who is employed as a chauffeur, live in Dasmarinas, Cavite, where they have raised four children. One of their children stays at home, one is employed, one is in enrolled in high school, and the youngest  is in elementary school.
 
Paciencia is a determined entrepreneur. She patiently manages her own little sari-sari (variety) store daily, which is situated near their home. Here she sells instant noodles, sachets of shampoo, and detergent, as well as soft drinks, which serve as a popular thirst quencher in the hot weather. She also runs a carinderia (small eatery), where she cooks meals for busy working people. In addition, she sells mineral water as an additional source of income. Together, these micro-entrepreneurial efforts enable her to earn Php 10,000 per month.

To help her improve her primary business, she is applying for a Php 9,000 loan. She will use this to replenish the stock of products she offers in her store. She knows she has to do this in order to offer her regular customers fresher options and encourage them to patronize her store. With additional money on hand and with a commitment to continuous learning, Paciencia is positive that she will become more profitable with her business.

As with any other entrepreneur, it is Pacienca's dream to make her sari-sari store grow. She aims to earn more in order to be able to save more and to level up her business. But her deepest dreams are as simple as they can be: amidst all the hassle of running a sari-sari store, a carinderia, and a mineral water business, she desires a peaceful, healthy life - not just for herself but for her entire family.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to replenish and expand the stock of goods she offers in her store

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Helping other people is an immense goal. Nelson G., age 45 and unmarried, is willing to take on that goal even as he lives out the spirit of entrepreneurship. Nelson reached college level in his education and is now pursuing his own business. One way in in which he helps is offering financial support to a family member. He has lived in Silang, Cavite, for five years. During that time, Nelson has operated a pig raising business and a farm. He is adept at raising healthy pigs to offer for for sale and has a true green thumb when it comes to producing quality crops. He is well aware of the techniques and the seasons involving these agricultural small-scale businesses, and this level of experience allows him to earn Php 6,000 every month. Nelson employs one person to help him with the routine tasks of the business.

To help him grow his business, he is applying for a Php 40,000 loan. He will purchase pig feed and fertilizer for his farm with this money. Also, he plans to take measures to maintain the condition of his farm. His business requires real effort, and the loan will be a great help toward sustaining his business.

The decrease in the production of piglets in his piggery has recently greatly affected his business. But rather than focusing on his loss, Nelson aspires toward raising thirty productive sows in a set span of time. Greater than this business goal is his overarching aim of being able to serve the Lord in whatever he does, which leads eventually to serving others for His name’s sake. Nelson also dreams of going abroad to work someday.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Estrelito

texts.en:
Estrelito S., 43, a community partner of CCT*, has a pure father’s heart for his children. Even as he gives full energy to his businesses, he is thinking of his children. Estrelito is married to Emelda and together they take care of four children, two in college and two in high school. Their family resides in Silang, Cavite.

For the past ten years, Estrelito has managed a piggery and operated a tricycle for a living. Due to his determination and perseverance, he is able to earn PHP 7,000 monthly. Sheer determination, however, isn’t enough to develop his businesses. Estrelito is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 from CCT/Kiva. He will use the money to buy pig feed and to maintain his tricycle. The loan will help him tremendously as it ensures the efficient daily operations of the tricycle to augment the family’s needs and the greater possibility that the piggery will yield additional profits. 

One grave challenge Estrelito faces is the untimely death of his sow, which greatly affects his piggery. Nevertheless, the business continues and the loan will help him recover. Estrelito focuses on developing his businesses because this is his means of supporting his beloved children and ensuring their graduation from college.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and to maintain his tricycle

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena V., 43, a community partner of CCT*, dreams of living simply. Lorena was unable to pursue college. At present, she runs her own small business and raises four dear children with Arnulfo, a baker. They used to live in Romblon, a part of Luzon near Visayas, and now reside in Silang, Cavite.

Like many of her fellow community partners, Lorena runs her own sari-sari (variety) store and co-manages a bakery with Arnulfo. Lorena has been operating these businesses for 21 years and is very knowledgeable of her customers’ preferences. With one employee, Lorena is able to earn roughly PHP 10,000 every month.

Lorena is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase grocery items and ingredients, such as flour and sugar, for the bakery . She also plans to buy sacks of rice for sale. Lorena acknowledges the big help this loan brings to her businesses, as it facilitates sustainability. Consequently, the loan contributes to her family’s daily living.

Customers’ debts that do not get paid often make Lorena's head ache; nevertheless, she strives on, believing that nothing can hinder her from reaching her goal of making her business prosper. Lorena dreams of seeing her children graduate, because this is the chief basis of her success—ensuring that her children will have a good future.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store and ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Love makes life sweeter, no matter what form it may take. For Cristeta D. G., it is the love for her daughter that makes life more meaningful each day. Cristeta, 47, reached college and is a single parent to a daughter who is in elementary school. They live in Dasmariñas, Cavite.

When it comes to her business, Cristeta sees to it that the products she makes are sweet and appealing to her customers. She makes her own pulvoron (powdered milk candy) and biscuits, selling them in packs. This requires cooking expertise since just a little bit more of one ingredient will make the delicacies taste different and regular customers are very keen about the taste of the food. Cristeta is able to earn PHP 10,600 monthly from her business.

Cristeta is requesting a loan of PHP 32,000 to purchase enough LPG (liquefied petroleum gas), plastic and other essential materials to cook and package her products. Cristeta continuously strives to improve her business because her ultimate goal is to become successful, including being a good mother. She wants to become financially stable in order to be able to support her daughter's education up until college.

As a CCT community partner, Cristeta faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy essential materials to cook and package her candy and biscuits

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario C., a CCT* community partner, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business. AT 48, she is single and focuses her energy on being a micro-entrepreneur. Rosario has reached college and is complementing her knowledge with the encouragement she receives from fellowships in CCT. She presently resides in Dasmarinas, Cavite.

Rosario has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for five years. She adapts well to the trends in her neighborhood, knowing which popular brands of food, shampoo, drinks and other products people want. Because of her expertise in this field, she is able to earn PHP 10,000 monthly.

Rosario knows she can do more to produce more. She is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to help her develop her business. She intends to use this loan to buy more quantities of quality merchandise. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store. Rosario is doing everything possible to see her business grow and stabilize because she wants to become successful in life, be it on a personal or business level.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry B. is 43 and single. She turns scrap into something useful and makes money out of it. She is certain that what she does benefits not only her, but also the people around her. She is a community partner in CCT*, where she spends a great deal of time learning how to improve her business and live a fulfilled life by getting to know more about the Creator. She presently resides in GMA, Cavite.

Cherry's main business is rug making, using scraps of cloth. Her working space is an extension of her house. She has been making rugs for ten years and is able to earn PHP 10,000 every month.

Cherry is requesting a  loan of PHP 50,000 to help develop her business. She will use this loan to buy cloth scraps in bulk, thereby freeing her to focus on the craft of rug making itself. Cherry also mentions being able to purchase other daily needs with this loan.

Purchasing cloth scraps with a small budget is really difficult and selling the rugs also requires extra effort at times. But Cherry is determined to make her business grow and eventually stabilize. She channels most of her energy and time on her business because she believes that, through this business, she can attain a life that is worth living.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase cloth scraps for rug making

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P., 52, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business. She is happily married to Norberto, 52, a bus conductor.  They are blessed with two children who are already working. Together, they live in Molino, Bacoor, Cavite.

Running a sari-sari (variety) store is Teresita's occupation. She has run this small-scale business for five years. She adapts well to the trends in her neighborhood when it comes to popular brands of food, shampoo, and drinks.  She also sells some children's toys, accessories and kitchen merchandise.  Because of her expertise in this field, she earns at least Php10,000 monthly.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to request a Php50,000 loan. She intends to use this loan to buy more quality merchandise to sell in her store. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store.

Teresita is doing everything she can in order to see her business grow and expand. She wants to become successful in life, be it in her family life or in her business.  She wants to start another store as a branch someday.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To replenish her store's stock

loans.name: Ester Guiquing's Group

texts.en:
Ester G. is from the village of Brgy. Canyogan Abajo, Tumuini, Isabela. Ester is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ester is married and has four school-aged children. She is 41 years old. To make a living, Ester raises pigs for fattening and sale. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Ester joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase hog feed and other supplies. This will be Ester's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina H., 49, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business. She is happily married to Remo, 56, a driver.  They are blessed with one child who is currently studying in a local public high school. Together, they live in Maricaban, Pasay City.

Running a sari-sari (variety) store is Lina's occupation. She has run this small-scale business for five years. She adapts well to the trends in her neighborhood when it comes to popular brands of food, shampoo, and drinks.  She also operates a mineral water refilling station. Because of her expertise in this field, she earns at least Php10,000 monthly.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to request a Php15,000 loan. She intends to use this loan to buy more quality merchandise to sell in her store. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store.

Lina is doing everything she can in order to see her business grow and expand. She wants to become successful in life, be it in her family life or in her business.  She wants to start another store as a branch someday.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Marelin

texts.en:
Marelin S., 42, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business.  She is separated from her husband and thus works hard to earn a living for herself and her child. She and her child live in Maricaban, Pasay City.

Running a sari-sari (variety) store is Marelin's occupation. She has run this small-scale business for two years. She adapts well to the trends in her neighborhood when it comes to popular brands of food, shampoo, and drinks.  She also sells some children's toys, accessories, and kitchen merchandise.  Because of her expertise in this field, she earns at least Php10,000 monthly.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to request a Php14,000 loan. She intends to use this loan to buy more quality merchandise to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store.

Marelin is doing everything she can in order to see her business grow and expand. She wants to become successful in life, be it in her family life or in her business.  She prays for good health and a happy life.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros R., 62, a mother of one child who is currently studying in college.  Milagros works hard to help her husband Perlito who is a taxicab driver.  Together, they live in Apilo Cuz, Pasay City.

Milagros has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing for infants, teens, and adults.  She buys these items at wholesale prices and sells them to her patrons with a minimum markup.  Monthly, she earns an estimated income of around Php6,000.

To help her grow this business, she is requesting a loan of Php15,000. She intends to use this money to buy additional merchandise from known local brands. She is thankful because this loan will enable her to meet the growing number of orders as the number of her regular customers increases.

Milagros strives hard, knowing that her income from this effort will make her prepared for any urgent, unexpected need. She also dreams of a good and happy life for her family.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to restock her clothing business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma M., 51, is a single mother who has solely provided for her child's education up to college level. Vilma is a college undergraduate who runs a business buying and selling frozen meats, such as sausages, hot dogs, sweetened pork meat, etc. Every day, Vilma makes sure that she earns enough to meet her family's daily needs, including school expenses for her child. Vilma and her child live in Apilo Cruz, Pasay City.

Vilma buys frozen food products from manufacturers at wholesale prices and then sells these items piecemeal with a minimum markup. She also supplies balot (a fertilized duck egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell) to balot vendors in her locality. Vilma earns an estimated monthly income of PHP 10,000.

To help her continue business operations, Vilma would like to request a PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy frozen meats in bulk and to purchase food items ordered in advance by her customers. She will also use the loan to purchase trays of eggs for balot making. Vilma believes she will gain an increase in her earning capacity as a result of this loan. Vilma fervently prays for good health and successful studies for her child. She also hopes to someday establish another outlet for her business.

As a CCT community partner, Vilma faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy frozen meats in bulk

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl A., a CCT* community partner, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business. She is happily married to Leonardo, her business partner, and they are blessed with a child who is currently studying. The family lives on Edang Street, Pasay City.

Cheryl has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for four years. She adapts well to the trends in her neighborhood, knowing which popular brands of food, shampoo, drinks and other products people want. Because of her expertise in this field, she is able to earn PHP 10,000 monthly.

But Cheryl knows she can do more to produce more. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to help her develop her business. She intends to use this loan to buy more quantities of quality merchandise. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store. Cheryl is doing everything possible to see her business grow and stabilize because she wants to become successful in life, be it on a personal or business level.

As a CCT community partner, Cheryl faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to restock her inventory

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia B., 52, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business. She is happily married to Constantino, a caddy, who also helps her run her business. They live in Maricaban, Pasay City.

Nelia has been buying and selling golf balls for four years. She buys the balls at wholesale prices and then sells them at a piecemeal rate. Her store is located outside the Philippine Navy golf course in Fort Bonifacio and is very accessible to all golf players who are her immediate customers. Nelia earns an estimated monthly income of PHP 10,000.

But Nelia knows she can do more to produce more. She is requesting a loan of PHP 24,000 to help her expand her business. She intends to use the loan to buy more quantities of quality golf balls to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store.

Nelia is doing everything possible to see her business grow and stabilize because she wants to become successful in life, be it on a personal or business level. She also dreams of someday being able to renovate her house. As a CCT community partner, Nelia faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy golf balls

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe P., 52, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business. She is happily married to Demetrio and they are blessed with children who are currently studying. The family lives in Bagong Silang, Pasay City.

Fe has been buying and selling golf balls for several years. She buys the balls at wholesale prices and then sells them at a piecemeal rate. Her store is located outside the Philippine Navy golf course in Fort Bonifacio, which is very accessible to all golf players who are her immediate customers. Nelia earns an estimated monthly income of PHP 10,000.

But Fe knows she can do more to produce more. She is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to help her expand her business. She intends to use the loan to buy more quantities of quality golf balls to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store.

Fe is doing everything possible to see her business grow and stabilize because she wants to become successful in life, be it on a personal or business level. She also prays that her children will be successful someday and land stable jobs. As a CCT community partner, Fe faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy golf balls

loans.name: Carlina's Group

texts.en:
Carlina R. is from the village of Benito Soliven, San Mariano, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Carlina is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carlina is single. She owns & operates a business selling fish balls and other dimsums to the local community. Carlina has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Carlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yolly Panilo's Group

texts.en:
Yolly P. is from the village of Carmencita Delfin Albano, Tumuini, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Yolly is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Yolly is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns & operates a business, preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Yolly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Yolly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase kitchen appliances, pots and pans and wooden tables

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto de 37 años de edad, residen en San Miguel, vive con su madre, es soltero, no tiene hijos, se dedica al cultivo de pipián, esta oficio lo realiza desde hace 15 años, el cual aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 5:00pm, él comercializa la producción en el mercado municipal donde ya tiene los clientes que le compran.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes para sembrar en una manzana de terreno el pipián, esta  compra es muy necesaria para que él lleve a cabo su trabajo y pueda continuar comercializando esta hortaliza.
El se proyecta tener un negocio fuerte para tener estable el ingreso y ayudar a su familia con los gastos e ir superándose poco a poco.
texts.en:
Roberto is 37 years old and he lives in San Miguel. He lives with his mother. He is single and he doesn't have children. He cultivates gourds, a business he has had for the past 15 years, a business he learned from his father. He works every day from 6am to 5pm and he sells his products at the municipal market where he already has clients who buy from him. 

He requests a loan to purchase fertilizers to plant a measure of gourds. This is a very necessary purchase to make his work succeed and in order to continue selling his produce.

His goal is to have a strong business in order to help his family with the expenses and to keep improving gradually.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his plantation

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Rosa D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en San  Miguel, vive con su esposo, tiene un taller D. sastrería, este negocio fue fundado por iniciativa propia, hace 6 años, aprendió la confección D. prendas D. vestir en una academia D. corte y confección, trabajo todos los días D. 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. telas, hilos, ciper, botones, entre otros materiales que les son necesarios. Esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el taller D. aquellos materiales que son imprescindibles para el desarrollo D. su trabajo, esperando brindar una mejor atención a los clientes, y generar más utilidades para cubrir sus necesidades y reinvertir en el taller.
El objetivo D. doña Rosa es mantenerse en el negocio que por años le ha dado todo lo necesario para vivir, por tal razón trabaja día con día en  este taller.
texts.en:
Rosa is 60 years old and she lives in San Miguel. She lives with her husband. She has a tailoring shop. This business was started under her own initiative six years ago. She learned to make articles of clothing from a tailoring academy. She works every day from 7am to 6pm. 

She requests a loan to purchase fabrics, threads, zippers, and buttons among other necessary materials. This investment will help her reinforce her shop with those materials that are essential to carry out her work. She hopes to proviD. her clients with better service and to generate a greater income to proviD. for her needs and to reinvest in the shop. 

Rosa's objective is to keep up the same business that for years has provided her with what she needs to live. For this reason she works day after day in this shop.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya, 43, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband is employed; her older daughter attends college while her younger two daughters go to secondary school. They have a below average standard of living. 

Altantuya used to work as a salesperson at someone else's consumer goods stall. She began operating her own stall in 2008. Now her business has become more stable and she wants to expand. She is a hardworking person who says, "Our family members want to finish the house which is currently being built. And we want to have our own store by expanding our business." She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business from Erlian, a city on the Chinese border.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Dagdulam

texts.en:
Dagdulam, 37, is widowed and lives with her daughter in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. Her daughter currently attends the local secondary school. Her daughter wants to help her with the business and to become her co-worker after attending a vocational training course. 

Dagdulam began sewing clothes and other items at her home in 2009. In 2010 she attended a vocational training course where she learnt how to make outer covers for the Mongolian ger. She wants to increase her production by buying a sewing machine. She is a hardworking and modest person who says, "working as a team would increase my profit and I would like to cooperate with people in order to increase my productivity". She is requesting a loan of 2,100,000 MNT to buy a sewing machine and more materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and more materials

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya , 30, is married and lives with her husband and one daughter in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past eight years. They have a decent standard of living. 

Enhtuya started selling food stuffs in 2000. At first she operated her grocery business in a small town with her husband. She came to the province center to sell coal and firewood in 2005. She takes orders from customers and delivers coal and firewood to their homes. She began making clothes and sewing handcraft items in addition to her business. Now her husband operates a transportation business using his mini-truck. Their children still help them, even though they have their own lives. 

Enhtuya is a hardworking person who says, "my husband and I have been trying hard to help our children start their own lives and we still need to make money to support our life. We want to continue operating our business." She is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase clothing that she can sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Zundui

texts.en:
Zundui, 59, is married and lives with his wife and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned for several years.

 He began selling children's clothing in 2007. His wife helps him with the business. He started his business with a working capital of 500,000 MNT and his current working capital is 2,300,000 MNT. His business has become more stable and he has many regular customers. He wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. 

Zundui is a hardworking and sociable person who says, "I would like to expand my business and make more profit." He is requesting a loan of 400,000 MNT to purchase more children's clothing to sell at his stall.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets, nails, and beams to repair the roof

loans.name: Munhtuya

texts.en:
Munhtuya, 40, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. Her husband works with her while her daughters attend college and the local school.

She began cooking and selling food in 2001. She makes dumplings and sells them with tea to the business operators in the market. Her daily net income is between 50,000 and 60,000 MNT. She wants to expand her business and increase her profit. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, "be positive and your dreams will come true." She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more food for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food

loans.name: Las Muñecas Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "las muñecas "  es un banco que actualmente se encuentra en su  tercer ciclo, en sus anteriores ciclos demostraron ser muy cumplidas y responsables son clientes que se dedican al comercio D. venta D. ropa y servicios, la presidenta es la Sra. Yolanda vive en casa anticrético en la zona D. la chimba, la señora tiene un hijo, el estado civil D. la señora es  soltera se dedica al comercio D. ropa desD. muy joven, el crédito saco para aumentar su capital comprando mercadería como chompas y pantalones para su venta, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable que saca adelante sola a su hijo y desea para el un futuro mejor, que estudie sea profesional, la Sra. Yolanda esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The "Las Muñecas" (Dolls) community bank is entering its third loan cycle.  Over previous loan cycles the members of this bank have shown themselves to be very punctual and responsible.  Their businesses are selling clothes and offering services.

The bank's president is Yolanda who lives in a rental house in La Chimba neighborhood.  She is single and has one child.  Yolanda has been selling clothes since she was very young.  She has requested this loan to increase her working capital, buying merchandise such as sweaters and pants to sell.

Yolanda is a very hard-working and responsible person who is getting her son ahead in life on her own.  She wishes for a better future for her son.  She would like him to study and become a professional.  Yolanda is very grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to continue building a wall in front of his house.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es: El banco de Emprendimiento "AZUCENAS " es un Banco que se encuentra en su segundo  ciclo,  todas las socias  han  demostraron ser  personas responsables y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: como Presidenta esta la Sra. Ysabel quien es la líder y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio de venta de bisutería( Joyas para niñas, trabas para el cabello, sujetadores de cabello y  adornos)  ambulando por la Zona de  Valle Hermoso. Esta Casada  y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, y el crédito que solicitó es para la compra de Sujetadores de pelo y trabas para niñas en cantidad. Como Tesorera esta la  Sra. Emiliana  quien  esta Separada y tiene 3 hijas pequeñas y tiene como negocio Venta de Salchipapas y refrescos en la zona de la laguna  y solicitó el crédito para compra de papa y aceite para la elaboracion de las salchipapas es socia nueva pero las señoras del grupo la consideran como  una persona muy responsable y puntual y la secretaria es la Sra. Rielmy quien es casada y  tiene 2  hijos y  su negocio es  tienda de Barrio que se e en su domicilio    es una persona  activa y respetada por el grupo, solicito el crédito para compra de abarrotes como fideos, arroz y azucar para surtir su tienda. Todas las socias son personas responsables que se dedican al comercio minorista y están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Emprendimiento Azucenas Bank is in its second loan cycle. All the members have demonstrated themselves to be responsible and hard workers. Mrs. Ysabel is the president, leader and founder of the group. She sells custom jewelry going from place to place through Valle Hermoso. She is married and has two small children. She is requesting a loan to purchase hair clips and barrettes for little girls. 
Mrs. Emiliana is the treasurer; she is separated and has three small daughters. Her business is to sell ‘salchipapas’ (sausage rolled in potatoes) and soft drinks in the Laguna Alalay zone. She is requesting the loan to increase her working capital. She is a new member but is considered by the other members to be a very responsible and punctual person.
Mrs. Rielmy is the secretary; she is married and has two children. Her business is a local store which she has in her house. She is an active person and is respected by the rest of the group. She is requesting the loan to increase her working capital. 
The above three members represent the group.
All the members are very responsible people who run small businesses. They are very grateful for the loan and support.

loans.use: to purchase hair clips and barrettes

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
María, es una cliente D. 34 años D. edad, es casada y vive con su familia en una casa propia en Morropón, en el departamento D. Piura, a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. muebles D. trabajo como sillas y mesas en su casa.  Esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 5 años y cuenta con clientela fidelizada a la fecha, quienes acuden a ella por el tipo mercadería que ofrece y la amabilidad que la caracteriza.  Los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad ayudan para la manutención D. su familia.

María quiere ampliar su stock D. mercadería.  Por ello ha creido conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles D. Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 34 years old costumer. She is married and lives with her family in their own house in Morropon, in the department of Piura, four hours away from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the Department of Lambayeque.

She buys and sells working furniture, like chairs and tables, at her house. She has been doing this for five years and has loyal costumers who return to buy from her because of the merchandise she offers and her characteristic amiability. Her income contributes to support her family.

Maria wishes to increase the stock in her business therefore she is requesting a loan of 2.000 NS through Edpyme Alternative to accomplish her objective.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase her stock.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 37  años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus  hijos en una zona rural de Pasabar  La Granja ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, los cuales cría en un ambiente dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente Luis tiene su mototaxi con el cual es más fácil la comercialización de sus animales ademas ofrece servicio de transporte de Olmos a sus caseríos. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Luis desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luis is 37 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and children in the rural zone of Pasabar La Granja. This is located in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area with substantial commercial activity in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Luis’ business is raising and selling farm animals. He raises them in a space in his house and then, when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the general public and to the dealers that often visit the area. 

In addition, Luis has a mototaxi that makes it easier to transport the animals. He also offers taxi service to Olmos for his community. With the income from both of these activities, he is able to support his family.

Luis would like to enlarge his business by buying more animals and balanced feed. This would lead to increased sales. For this reason, he is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 new soles.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Segundo Florentino

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en un centropoblado el Pueblito ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Segundo trabaja en ele colegio Nº 10793 como profesor de educacion primaria ubicado en el centro poblado asata  Isabel, adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, el suele sembrar maracuyá, y limón esta actividad la aprendio de su padre.

Segundo desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Segundo es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Segundo is 40 years old and single.  He lives with his family in a community called El Pueblito, in Olmos district.  This is an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Segundo works in School No. 10793 as an elementary school teacher.  The school is located in Asata Isabel community.  He also farms, growing passion fruit and lemons.  He learned this business from his father.

Segundo would like to acquire fertilizers so that he can look after his crops.  In this way, he hopes to obtain a good harvest.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Segundo is a calm and responsible person.  His biggest wish is to grow as a businessman and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mas cuatro años, el suele sembrar maracuyá y luego comercializarlo a una fabrica industrial de la zona cerca al distrito de donde vive, cuenta con experiencia gracias a las ensenñnazas de su padre y es conocido en el mercado.

Walter  desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maracuyá, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Además le permitira incrementar su capital de trabajo. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Walter es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Walter is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in Olmos district.  This is an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Walter has been farming for more than four years.  He grows passion fruit which he then sells to a factory in his area, near the district where he lives.  He has experience thanks to being taught by his father and he is well known in the market.

Walter would like to acquire fertilizers so that he can care for his passion fruit crop.  In this way, he hopes to obtain a good harvest.  This will also allow him to increase his working capital.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Walter is a calm and responsible person.  His greatest wish is to grow as a businessman and to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops and to increase his capital

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline es una joven madre de familia, tiene 18 años de edad y tiene dos pequeños hijos, reside junto a su esposo en el caserío Cruceta del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de clima semitropical que se encuentra situada en la región Piura, a casi cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a vender comida y bebidas en su domicilio. Ella prepara diversos platos típicos de la zona y los ofrece a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un buen trato. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a que prepara sus comidas con muy buena sazón. Su negocio encuentra demanda principalmente los fines de semana. Con los ingresos que ella percibe se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Jackeline desea adquirir mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad. Asimismo desea invertir en la compra de bebidas de modo que su negocio pueda desarrollarse de modo estable. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que tiene  muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a young mother to her two small children. She is 18 years old and lives with her husband in Cruceta in the Tambogrande district. This is an agriculturally rich area with a semi tropical climate in the Piura region, 5 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For 2 years she has sold food and drinks out of her home. She makes various dishes that are typical to the area and treats her customers well. Her business is well received because she prepares the food with very good flavor. She gets most of her business over the weekends. With the income that she earns she is able to help her husband with the family expenses. 

Jackeline wants to purchase tables and chairs to better serve her customers. She also wants to invest in the purchase of drinks so that her business can grow stably. To achieve her goal she is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 soles. She is a very hardworking woman with a strong desire to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs to better serve her customers.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Cruceta, uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se encuentra ubicada a casi cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio en donde elabora diversos trabajos de imprenta y serigrafía en todo tipo de materiales como tarjetas, polos, sellos etc. Actualmente su negocio cuenta con bastante acogida debido a la campaña electoral que se vive en todo el país. Adicionalmente su esposo trabaja como pintor y también cuentan con un equipo de sonido el cual alquilan para amenizar diversas actividades sociales.

Ana María desea contar con dinero para poder comprar útiles escolares a sus menores hijos, los cuales ya empezaron a estudiar en la escuela local, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. Ella es una mujer que siempre trabaja dando lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, 31, lives with her husband and their two children in the town of Cruceta, one of the towns that make up the rural district of Tambogrande, a semitropical region of Peru, about five hours from the city of Chiclayo.  

Ana Maria operates a small home-based printing and silkscreening business for all kinds of things from business cards to clothing to stamps.  Demand for her printing services is especially high now because of the upcoming national elections.  Her husband works as a painter and operates a business renting sound equipment for parties and other events.  

Ana Maria is applying for a loan so that she can buy the supplies her children need for the school year that has just started.  She needs 500 new soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy what they need.  Ana Maria works hard to support her family and make the best life she can for them.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Jackeline Baltazara

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en el caserío Punto Cuatro, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito agrícola de Mochumí, el lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace dos años en la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella ofrece estos productos a los vecinos de su localidad, actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes ya fidelizados que siempre acuden a ella para solicitar los productos que necesitan. Jackeline no se conforma y siempre se encuentra buscando nuevos clientes, ya que mientras más clientes capte, la empresa que le provee de productos suele darle más puntos por los cuales percibe más ganancias.

Adicionalmente ella se dedica a la preparación de comida las cual ofrece en venta en su domicilio a sus vecinos, este negocio ha sido iniciado hace poco y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados que siempre recurren a adquirir los alimentos que ofrece.  Con estos ingresos que obtiene,  ella apoya a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía familiar, el trabaja en un taller mecánico.

Jackeline desea adquirir  mesas y sillas para implementar su negocio de venta de comida y bebida, de modo que pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. 

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla, en aquella oportunidad pudo implementar su negocio  de cosméticos y con las ganancias que obtuvo pudo sacar adelante su nuevo negocio. Por ello se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le ayudaron a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jackeline, 30, lives with her husband and their two children in the town of Punto Cuatro, a town in the rural district of Mochumi, some forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  

Jackeline operates a business selling beauty products.  She buys her merchandise from catalogs and sells them to local customers.  She has a loyal group of customers who always come to for whatever products they need.  Jackeline doesn't rest on her laurels, though.  She's always looking for new customers because the company that supplies her merchandise rewards her with more points which, in turn, increases her income.  

Jackeline also earns money making and selling prepared foods which she sells in the neighborhood.  She has a loyal set of customers for this business, too, neighbors who come back to buy the meals she makes.  With her income from the two businesses, she can help her husband support the family.  (Her husband is a mechanic.)

Jackeline wants to buy tables and chairs so that she can expand her food business.  She is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,500 new soles loan.  

Jackeline has borrowed from Kiva before, using Edpyme Alternativa and its subidiary, Capital Semilla, to set up her beauty products business.  Her earnings from that business allowed her to start this new business.  For that, she is very grateful to everyone who has supported her.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs for restaurant business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro menores hijos en el caserío Insculas, una zona rural que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, el lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la compra y comercialización de carne de pollo, gallina y otras aves en su domicilio. Ella adquiere los animales a los negociantes y vecinos de la zona para luego comercializarlos entre sus vecinos. El negocio es de mucha ayuda a su comunidad ya que, al estar alejados del pueblo más cercano, pueden adquirir carne fresca a diario. Su esposo es agricultor y actualmente siembra sandías, con lo que ambos ganan tratan de salir adelante y progresar.

Mercedes desea adquirir más animales para seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus vecinos, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en su negocio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles. Ella ya es una cliente antigua de Edpyme Alternativa y debido a su puntualidad y responsabilidad se ha ganado la confianza y estima necesarias para seguir trabajando juntos.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 36, lives with her husband and their four young children in Insculas, a small town in the rural districut of Olmos, about two hours from the Peruvian city of Chiclayo.  

Mercedes has operated a business buying and selling meat for six years.  She operates the business at her house.  She buys chickens and other birds from local traders and others in the neighborhood who have poultry to sell.  Her neighbors are also her customers.  The business is an important service for the neighborhood because it's the only place in the immediate area where local people can buy fresh meat.  Mercedes' husband farms watermelons and their combined income allows them to support their family.  

Mercedes wants to buy more birds so that she can better meet demand for her products.  This 1,800 new soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa will allow her to improve and expand her business.   Mercedes is a long-time customer of Edpyme Alternativa and the bank trusts that she will repay this loan on time.

loans.use: buy more animals for meat business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more snacks and organges for her business.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
Juan  es un padre de familia de 28 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el centro poblado menor el Chorro ubicado en el distrito de Pomalca. Un distrito agrícola conocido por la siembra de caña de azúcar y sus derivados, que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a mas de treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Juan  se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la ganadería desde siete años. El cría ganado vacuno el cual pastea por los campos aledaños a  su casa y los guarda en un  pequeño establo que ha construido en la parte posterior a su vivienda. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente vende la leche que recoge a los acopiadores de la zona.

El desea adquirir  alimento balanceado es decir forraje por que el pasto se ha escaseado y desea que su ganado este en las mejores condiciones, asimismo quiere realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juan is the father of a family and he is 28 years old. He is married and he lives together with his wife and their three children in the minor population centre of El Chorro, located in the district of Pomalca. It is an agricultural district known for its sugar cane plantations and its derivative products. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

Juan has been dedicating himself to cattle farming activities for seven years. He raises cattle and he shepherds them in fields separate from his house and he keeps them in a small stable that he has built as part of his house. He feeds those grains and natural grasses and when they have reached a good level of development he offers them up for sale to the merchants who visit the region where he lives. He also sells the milk that he collects to the distributors in the region. 

He wishes to acquire balanced feed, that is to say foraging, because there is a shortage in hay and he wants to keep his herd in better shape. He also wants to carry out some improvements to his home. In order to reach his objective he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de La Victoria, una zona con movimiento comercial y agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a más de quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella  cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí el ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes.  Asimismo ellas se dedica  a la artesanía específicamente a la elaboración de sombreros, El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de dos años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. 

Elva desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes asi como comprar insumos para elaborar sombreros. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elva is 35 years old, married, and she lives together with her family in the district of La Victoria, a commercial and agricultural region located more than fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the region of Lambayeque. 

She has a convenience store installed in her house. From there she sells to her neighbors a variety of products that are of daily use and basic needs and groceries. She is also an artisan, specifically involved in the production of sombreros. Her business is two years old and she has a loyal and stable client base.

Elva wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise in order to satisfy her clients’ demands. She will also purchase materials to make sombreros. For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store and to acquire materials to make sombreros.

loans.name: Silsa

texts.es:
Silsa tiene 61 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, sin carga familiar vive con su familia en el dustrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, este distrito es catalogado como uno de los más pobres de la Provincia de Chiclayo, sin embargo podemos encontrar mucha gente trabajadora y empeñosa, que trabaja de sol a sol para salir adelante.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de plátanos de seda, plátanos de freír y papayas; en forma ambulatoria desde hace más de 10 años. Sus compras las realiza a los grandes comerciantes del mercado de Moshoqueque. Silsa tiene como objetivo hacer crecer su negocio y con el tiempo comprar un puesto comercial.  Y en busca de cumplir su objetivo, ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Silsa is 61 years old and she is single. She doesn't have dependents and she lives with her family in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz.  This district is known as one of the poorest in the province of Chiclayo, although here we can find many hard working and earnest people that work from sun up to sun down in order to make a living.

Her business is the sale of bananas, plantains and papayas. She has been traveling to make her sales for more than 10 years. She makes her purchases from the large businesses of the Moshoqueque market. Sisal’s objective is to make her business grow and with time to set up a sales-stand. And in order to meet her objective she has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase bananas and papayas.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo. Vive junto a su familia en el  Distrito de Tambogrande ubicado en el departamento de Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino. Él los cría dándoles alimento balanceado, y cuando alcanzan un desarrollo adecuado los vende, obteniendo ingresos para el apoyo de su familia.  Reynaldo se dedica desde hace 4 años a esta actividad, por lo que cuenta con una clientela fidelizada, que lo apoyan y respaldan.
 
Reynaldo ha trabajado mucho para ayudar a su familia.  Él quiere colocar calamina a su casa (techo) y para ello ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 27 years old, married, and he is the father of 1 child. He lives together with his family in the district of Tambogrande, located in the department of Piura. It is situated 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque.

He raises cattle and pigs. He raises them with balanced feed and when they have reached an adequate level of development he sells them to obtain an income to support his family. Reynaldo has had this business for 4 years and he has a loyal clientele that support him and back him.

Reynaldo has worked a great deal to help his family. He wants to install roofing for his house and for this reason he has requested a loan in the amount of 2000 soles.

loans.use: to install a roof on his house.

loans.name: Jesus Joaquina

texts.es:
C. tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su familia, la cual está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino, los cuales una vez alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los vende y/o sacrifica para venderlo por kilos. En el caso de las vacas, entrega leche a la Municipalidad de Tambogrande para el programa de Vaso de Leche, programa benéfico para ayuda social.

C. desea adquirir alimento balanceado para la crianza de su ganado, por lo que ha creído conveniente adquirir un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
C. is 44 years old, married common-law and she has 3 children. She lives in her own house with her family and it is located in the district of Tambogrande, in the department of Piura. It is situated 4 hours from Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque. 

She raises cattle, sheep, and pigs. When they have reached an ideal size and weight she sells them or she butchers them to sell by the kilo. In the case of the dairy cows, she sells the milk in the municipality of Tambogrande to the program called "Glass of Milk", a program aimed at social welfare.

C. wishes to acquire balanced feed to raise her cattle. For this reason she has requested a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y reside con su pareja e hija en el distrito de Reque, una zona bastante comercial que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica al comercio de bebidas refrescantes en el Mercado de su localidad desde hace 5 años.  Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda en sus gastos personales y los de su familia.  Ella en su afán de mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia quiere hacer mejoras en su vivienda, por lo que ha creido conveniente adquirir un préstamo de 1000 soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 37 years old, married common-law, and she lives together with partner and daughter in the district of Reque. It is a highly commercial region belonging to the department of Lambayeque. 

She has been selling refreshing drinks in her neighborhood market for the past 5 years. With the income that she earns from this business she is able to provide for her personal expenses and those of her family. Her goal is to improve her family's quality of life and she wants to make some improvements to their house. For this reason she has requested a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles form Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín tiene 46  años de edad, es casdo y reside con su familia en Motupe, distrito de la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales desde hace varios, siendo esta actividad la que aprendió su padre.  Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Agustín desea adquirir alimento balanceado para engordar a su ganado, para posteriormente venderlo y obtener ingresos y poder apoyar a su familia.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Agustin is 46 years old, married, and he lives with his family in Motupe, a district in the province of Lambayeque. He is situated an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has been raising and selling livestock for many years, an occupation he learned from his father. He has an established client base in the region. 

Agustin wishes to acquire balanced feed to fatten his herd, to later resell and to obtain an income to support his family. For this reason he has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from   Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 23 años de edad, y vive con su familia en un caserío del distrito de Tambogrande ubicado en el departamento de Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Maribel  se dedica a la venta de comida y elaboración de chicha de jora a base de harina de maíz. Tiene una antigüedad de más de 5 años en su negocio ubicado en su casa, y por el trato tan amable que brinda cuenta a la fecha con una clientela fidelizada.  Ella quiere mejorar los ambientes donde ella vende la comida y la chicha, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maribel is 23 years old and she lives with her family in a community in the district of Tambogrande, located in the department of Piura. It is 4 hours from Chiclayo, capital city of the department of Lambayeque. 

Maribel sells prepared foods and she makes the traditional drink called chicha de jora, made from corn flour. She has had 5 years in the business and her business is located in her house.  And for the excellent customer service she has a loyal client base. She wants to improve the space where she sells her foods and chicha drinks. For this reason she has requested a loan of 1000 from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to improve the space where she sells her foods and drinks.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 34 años, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Él es empleado dependiente del fundo Santa Rosa, donde hace todo tipo de actividades para sus empleadores.  Él trabaja  todos los días, y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a la mejora de calidad de vida de su familia.   Él quiere darle a su familia mejor calidad de vida, por lo que quiere hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Walter is 34 years old, single, and he lives together with his family in the district of Olmos, located 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the department of Lambayeque. 

He is a full-time employee of the Santa Rosa Company where he provides all types of services to his clients. He works during the days and with the income that he earns he contributes towards the quality of life of his family.
