He wants to provide his family with a better quality of life, reason why he wants to carry out improvements to his house. For this reason he has requested a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase engine lubricants for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Teresa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 54 años de edad y vive junto a dos de sus hijos en una de las zonas marginales de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial y con mucho movimiento de transporte. Es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace más de once años a la venta de raspadillas y comida en un puesto ambulante situado en una de las principales calles de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella vende raspadillas durante la temporada de verano y comida en la época de invierno, esta actividad constituye una de las principales fuentes de ingreso para la economía de su familia y por ello trata de mantenerse en el negocio de la mejor manera posible.

Rosa desea arreglar la carreta en la trabaja ya que está demasiado deteriorada, asimismo desea adquirir un nuevo toldo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.  Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and she lives together with two of her children in a suburban region of the city of Chiclayo. It is a highly commercial region involved in a great deal of transportation. It is the capital city the region of Lambayeque. 

For more than eleven years she has been selling flavored ice and prepared foods from a cart traveling one of the principal streets of the city of Chiclayo. She sells flavored ice in the summer season and prepared foods during the winter season. This business has been a primary source of income for her family and it is the reason why she tries to keep it in the best shape possible. 

Rosa wishes to repair the cart with which she works because it is in poor shape. She also wants to purchase a new awning. For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa for a first time loan in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. She is a calm and responsible person. Those people that know her appreciate her very much.

loans.use: to repair the cart with which she works.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y vive con su familia en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

 Ella es empleada dependiente del fundo Santa Rosa, donde hace todo tipo de actividades para sus empleadores.  Él trabaja  todos los días, y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a la mejora de calidad de vida de su familia. Ella necesita comprar los útiles escolares para sus hijos, los que irán al colegio.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Carmen is 50 years old, married, and she lives with her family in the district of Olmos, located 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the department of Lambayeque.


She is a full-time employee of Santa Rosa Company, where she provides all types of services to her employers. She works every day and with the income that she earns she is able to contribute to her family's quality of life. She needs to purchase school supplies for her children, those that will go to school. For this reason she has requested a loan in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Jose Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia de material rústico. Cliente vive en el Caserío Capilla Santa Rosa, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque. 

La actividad que realiza el cliente es la crianza y comercialización de animales, labor muy común en la zona rural de Lambayeque.
Leoncio también cuenta con una pequeña bodega donde vende jora (materia prima necesaria para elaborar chicha) y azúcar. Adicionalmente cliente trabaja en la agricultura y el jornal.


Leoncio quiere invertir en compra de alimento para animales y en compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega, es por ello que ha creído conveniente adquirir un préstamo de 1300 soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 56 years old, married, and he doesn't have children who are still dependent. He in his own house made of rustic materials. He lives in the community of Capilla Santa Rosa, located 10 minutes from the city of Lambayeque. 

He raises and sells livestock, a very common occupation in the rural region of Lambayeque. 

Leoncio also has a small convenience store from where he sells jora (an ingredient necessary to make chicha) and sugar. Additionally he also works in agriculture and is a laborer.

Leoncio wants to invest in the purchase of feed for his livestock and to purchase groceries to supply his store. For this reason he has requested a loan of 1300 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Leidy Soledad

texts.es:
Leidy tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos dependiente.  Vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Tambogrande, ubicado en el departamento de Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza en 2 modalidades, una la venta como minorista a un precio mayor y el otro como un distribuidor a un precio menor hace mas de 3 años.  Esta actividad la realiza dentro de su domicilio.

Leidy quiere ampliar más su negocio, comprando más mercadería para después venderla y así obtener mayores ingresos y poder apoyar a su familia.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Leidy is 21 years old, single, and she doesn't have children or dependents.  She lives with her parents in the district of Tambogrande, located in the department of Piura. It is 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the department of Lambayeque. 

She has been selling beer in two capacities: as a retailer at a higher price, and as a wholesaler at a lower price.  She carries out her business from her house. 

Leidy wants to further expand her business with the purchase of more products to resell. She will obtain a greater income and she will be able to support her family. For this reason she has requested a loan of 1200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase beer for resale.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Román tiene 62 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores, teniendo como experiencia 5 años en esta actividad.  El los engorda y cuando llegan a un nivel de desarrollo adecuado los vende, y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a su familia con los gastos de su hogar. En la actualidad desea obtener más alimento balanceado para su ganado, para después venderlo. Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Roman is 62 years old, single, and he lives with his parents in the district of Olmos, located 2  hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the department of Lambayeque. 

He raises and sells small livestock, having 5 years' experience in the business. He fattens them and when they have reached an adequate level of development he sells them. With the income that he earns he is able to help his family with the household expenses. He wishes to acquire more balanced feed for his herd for later resale. For this reason he has requested a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Luzmila Esther

texts.es:
Luzmila es soltera y tiene 52 años de edad. Vive en la zona urbana en el distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la Región La Libertad, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.
 
Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la producción y venta de pan y salchipollo. Es muy conocida en la zona. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara su comida. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para ampliar su producción de sus alimentos y aumentar sus ventas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luzmila is single and she is 52 years of age. She lives in an urban region, the district of Chepen, belonging to the region of La Libertad. It is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of the region of Lambayeque. 

For more than four years she has been producing and selling breads and salchipollo (traditional food consisting of fried chicken, sausages, and potatoes). She is well known in the region. Her business enjoys a great deal of business in part because of the excellent recipe she uses to prepare her foods. She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of ingredients to increase food production and to increase her sales. For this reason she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare foods to sell.

loans.name: Joel Neptaly

texts.es:
Joel tiene 24 años de edad, es casado y tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 años. Viven en su casa propia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como ganado ovino, caprino, aves de corral y chanchos. Compra y engorda los animales para luego venderlos en el mercado local al público general. Adicionalmente, trabaja como peón agrícola en la chacra de su abuelo el cual cuenta con plantaciones de limón. Estas actividades lo ayudan solventar sus gastos familiares. Desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales. Por ello, solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y alimento balanceado.
texts.en:
Joel is 24 years old, married, and he has a 2-year old son. They live in a house of their own in the district of Olmos, an agricultural region that is highly commercial. It is located in the Province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past three years he has been raising and selling small livestock such as sheep, goats, foul, and pigs. He buys and fattens the animals for later resale in the local market to the general public. He also works as an agricultural laborer in his grandfather's plantation where they cultivate lemons. These businesses help him provide for his family's expenses. He wishes to expand his livestock business. For this reason he requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. He will purchase more livestock and balanced feed.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and balanced feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition fees and to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Segundo Saturnino

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 35 años de edad. Vive con su esposa e hijo en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos como agua o luz.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves, ovinos y pavos. Realiza esta actividad en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando los animales han alcanzado un tamaño y peso ideal, los vende en el mercado local al público general. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para invertirlo en alimento balanceado para sus animales. Con esta inversión, puede engordar los animales en menos tiempo y venderlos para mejor precio en el mercado. Con este aumento en sus ingresos, podrá solventar sus gastos familiares y seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and son in Tambogrande, an agricultural region that is located in the province of Piura. It is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the region of Lambayeque. He doesn’t have basic services such as water and hydro.

For more than 5 years he has been raising and selling foul, sheep, and turkeys. He has his business is the posterior part of his property. When the livestock have reached an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the neighborhood market to the general public. He has an established client base. He requests a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in the purchase of balanced feed for his livestock. With this investment he will be able to fatten his livestock in less time and he will be able to sell them at a better price in the market. With this increase in income he will be able to provide for his family’s expenses and he will be able to keep providing for his family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 pequeños hijos. Viven juntos en la parte urbana del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gana su vida brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros en sus dos mototaxis, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. También se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como ganado ovino, caprino, aves de corral y chanchos. Compra y engorda los animales para luego venderlos en los mercados locales de su comunidad. Cuenta con una experiencia de tres años en esta actividad. Con sus ingresos, puede solventar sus gastos familiares.

Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de sus mototaxis. Necesita mantener sus motos en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir sacando adelante a su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 36 years old, married, and has 2 small children.  They live together in the urban part of Olmos district, an agricultural zone with considerable commercial activity, located in Lambayeque province, M. 1 ½ hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Guillermo earns his living transporting passengers in his two 'mototaxis,' a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle and a cabin to carry passengers in its interior.  In addition, he raises and sells farm animals such as sheep, goats, pigs and chickens.  He buys and fattens the animals to sell them later in his community's markets.  He has 3 years experience in this activity.  With his income, he can cover his family's expenses.

Guillermo wants to use the loan to maintain and repair his 'mototaxis.'  He needs to keep his motorcycles in good condition to continue offering good service to his customers.  With the help of a loan, he hopes to augment his income and continue advancing his family.  That's why he thought it convenient to solicit a loan of 2,000 new sols through Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: TO REPAIR HIS MOTORCYLE-TAXIS

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 58 años de edad y es casado con mayores hijos ya independientes. Vive con su esposa en casa propia, la cual ha ido construyendo poco a poco, en el distrito de Jose Leonardo Ortiz en Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de 15 años, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su moto. Necesita mantenerla en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo que solicita de los prestamistas de Kiva, espera aumentar sus ingresos. Junto con los ingresos de su esposa que trabaja como comerciante, pueden solventar sus gastos familiares y seguir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 58 years old and married with adult children who are already independent.  He lives with his wife in his own house, which he has been constructing little by little, in the Jose Leonardo Ortiz district of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

For more than 15 years he has been transporting passengers on his 'mototaxi,' a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle and a cabin to carry people in its interior.  Gilberto plans to use the loan to maintain and repair his motorcycle.  He needs to keep it in good condition so he can continue offering good service to his customers.  With the help of the loan he is requesting from Kiva lenders, he hopes to increase his income.  Combined with the income of his wife, who works as a merchant, this will cover family costs and he can continue constructing his house.

loans.use: TO REPAIR HIS MOTORCYLE-TAXI

loans.name: Teresa Amparo

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 52 años, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Vive con su familia en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la venta de bodoques y gelatinas en su domicilio. Tiene un espacio en el cual ha colocado su refrigeradora y su congeladora para guardar sus productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar más insumos para preparar sus alimentos y también para hacer unos arreglos en la parte de su hogar donde dirige su negocio. El préstamo se le brindará mayores ingresos para poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
52-year old Teresa is single and has two children. The family lives in Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in the province of Piura, more than four hours from the town of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For four years now Teresa has earned her living selling bodoques (frozen treats served in plastic bags) and gelatinas (jello) from her home. She’s put in a fridge/freezer to keep the products in good condition and is now seeking a loan to buy more ingredients to make the food. She also wants to make some improvements to the part of her home from which she runs her business. 

The loan will enable her to earn more money to invest in her business and improve her standard of living. For that reason Teresa has approached Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of S/.600.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients

loans.name: Ruperto Enrique

texts.es:
Ruperto tiene 70 años, es casado y tiene hijos independientes y un hijo a su cargo. Vive con su familia en el distrito de La Victoria, a zona urbana unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Las actividades principales en dicho caserío son la agricultura, crianza de animales de engorde y comercio.

Se dedica a la venta de CDs en puestos de mercado por las mañanas. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como patos y pavos. Cría los animales y cuando han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende en los mercados locales. Cuenta con más de 18 años de experiencia en estos rubros y por eso, tiene una clientela ya establecida en la región.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar un DVD visor de imágenes para las presentaciones de sus películas, con la finalidad de llamar un poco más la atención de nuevos clientes. Tiene como meta la aumentación de sus ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares y seguir cuidando su familia.
texts.en:
Ruperto is 70 years old. He is married and has three children who are now independent as well as one more in his charge. He lives with his family in the district of La Victoria, an urban area 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. The main activities in the village are agriculture, livestock and commerce.

In the morning he sells CDs on market stalls. Additinally, he raises and sells small livestock such as ducks and turkeys. He breeds the animals and when they reach a good size and weight he sells them in local markets. He has over 18 years of experience in these areas and as a result has an established clientele in the region.

He is applying for a loan to buy a DVDs reader to present his films, so as to draw some more attention from new customers. His goal is to increase his income so as to meet his household expenses and continue to care for his family.

loans.use: Buy a DVD reader to show his merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene hijos mayores que ya son independientes. Vive con su esposa en el distrito de Chochope en el departamento de Lambayeque.
 
Gana su vida brindando servicios de transporte público en su mototaxi propia, un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Compró su mototaxi al contado usando sus ingresos de una cosecha de maíz que obtuvo de su terreno propio de agrícola. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de nuevas llantas y otros accesorios faltantes. También desea realizar algunos arreglos en su moto que se ha deteriorado debido al uso. Con las reparaciones, Juan puede mantener en mejor estado su mototaxi lo que lo permitirá ofrecer una mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos. 

Juan es muy trabajador y sigue incrementando su negocio. Ya que ha ahorrado su dinero y ahora piensa en comprarse otro vehículo para alquilarlo a otro conductor y conseguir mayores sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, 51, is married and has children who are already adult and independent; he lives with his wife in Chochope District in Lambayeque Department.

He earns his livelihood providing public transportation services in his own mototaxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to transport people inside it.  He paid cash for his mototaxi using income from corn crops he farmed in his own fields.  He’d like to use the loan to buy new tires and other needed accessories.  He also wants to do some repair work on his motorcycle because it’s having some problems due to heavy usage.  With these repairs, Juan will be able to maintain his motorcycle in better condition that will allow him to provide better customer service and increase his income.

Juan is very hard working and continues to increase his business.  Now that he’s saved some money he plans to buy a second vehicle to lease out to another driver thus increasing his income.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi and buy tires.

loans.name: Santos Elias

texts.es:
Santos tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos de edad escolar. Vive en casa propia en una comunidad rural cerca del distrito de Monsefú, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Cuenta con agua potable pero no energía electricidad. Monsefú es una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. Las principales actividades que se realizan en este caserío son la producción de flores, la artesanía y la crianza de ganado vacuno. La zona está llena de vegetación y la comunidad es muy pequeña. 

Desde hace 6 años, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Santos solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para mantener su vehículo y comprar algunos accesorios. También, piensa en realizar algunos arreglos en la sala de su casa. Estas mejoras lo ayudarán a brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros, realizar más correos a zonas establecidas y así obtener un mayor nivel de ingresos. Santos es muy conocido en la zona y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos, 37, is married and has three school age children.  He lives in his own house in a rural community near Monsefú District twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.  He has potable water but not electricity.  Monsefú is an area renowned for its tourist and religious festivals.  The main activities in this settlement are flower growing, crafts and raising cattle.  The zone is full of vegetation and the community is very small. For the last six years he has been providing passenger transportation services in his mototaxi, a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to transport people in its interior.  

Santos is requesting a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa to repair his vehicle and to buy some accessories.  He also plans to do some home repairs.  These improvements will help him provide better customer service, to undertake more trips to established areas and thus attain higher income levels.  Santos is very well known in the area and has good personal and work references in his community.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi.

loans.name: Luis Ricardo

texts.es: Luis tiene 32 años de edad y vive en el distrito de Chochope con su esposa y dos hijos de 1 y 2 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años, gana su vida brindando servicios de transporte público en su mototaxi propia, un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de nuevas llantas y otros accesorios faltantes. También desea realizar algunos arreglos en su moto que se ha deteriorado debido al uso. Con las reparaciones, Luis puede mantener en mejor estado su mototaxi lo que lo permitirá ofrecer una mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Luis es muy trabajador y su negocio se ha visto incrementado ya que ha ahorrado su dinero. Su mayor anhelo es seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y tener ingresos para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis, 32, lives in Chochope District with his wife and two children who are 1 and 2 years of age.  For the last three years he has been earning his livelihood providing public transportation services in his own mototaxi, a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to transport passengers in its interior. 

He wants to use his loan to buy new tires and other needed accessories.  He also wants to repair his motorcycle which is showing some wear and tear due to use.  With these repairs Luis will be able to keep his motorcycle in better condition which will allow him to provide better customer service thus increasing his income to meet family expenses.

He has, therefore, deemed it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  Luis is very hard working and his business has grown and he’s been able to save some money.  His greatest wish is to continue improving his quality of life and to have income for his children’s future.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi and buy new tires.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis Enrique tiene 27 años de edad. Vive en casa con su madre y dos hermanos. Desde hace 2 años, se dedica al servicio de mecánica. También, cuenta con una mototaxi en la cual brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su caserío. Es muy conocido en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con estas actividades, gana ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares y personales. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para realizar algunos arreglos en su hogar. Con estas reparaciones, Luis Enrique podrá mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia. Es muy responsable y cuenta con buenas referencias en su trabajo y en su comunidad. Ha tenido otros préstamos y ha cumplido con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique, 27, lives at home with his mother and two siblings.  For the last two years he’s been a Mechanic.  He also has a mototaxi that he uses to provide passenger transportation services in his hamlet.  He is very well known in the area and has an established base of regular customers. He earns income with these activities to meet family and personal expenses.

He has requested a 1000 new sol loan to do some home repairs.  With these repairs, Luis Enrique will improve his and his family’s quality of life.  He’s very responsible and has good personal and work references in his community.  He has had other loans and has always met his commitments punctually.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make repairs to his house

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosa 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group "Mujeres Poderosas 1 & 2" ("Powerful Women 1 & 2"). She makes her home in a simple structure together with her family and her son. She says that her most difficult challenge is to establish her home by herself. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy spending time with her only son.

Ana plans to use this loan to invest in her jewelry business, by buying rings, bracelets, chains and other accessories. She will also buy clothes. She will use the profits to invest in her business and she dreams of improving it and being able to build her house and buy some furniture. She has had five loans and she is excited to have this new loan and give one step forward to her business improvement.

Ana's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy clothes and jewelry

loans.name: La Caridad 4 Group

texts.en:
Roseline is one of the group members from La Caridad 4 (The Charity). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenges are to work hard and have an improved business in her village, where she enjoys attending to the Church.

Roseline is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she sells miscellaneous products. She will buy clothes and accessories. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She is planning to have a stable life. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy being at her home and taking care of everything. She is excited to have this loan because she wants to invest more, get a low interest and save money for the future.

Roseline's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories

loans.name: Paz Y Fe 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ana is one of the members of her group Paz y Fe 1, 3 & 4 (peace and faith.) Her story is representative of both the members of her group and Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients. 

Her group is based in the Samana peninsula in the east of the Dominican Republic, where running water and electricity are unavailable. Here she makes her home with her husband and three children in a simple structure comprised of wooden walls and a tin roof.

Ana originally came to Esperanza over six loans ago for the purpose of improving her business and she has proved herself very successful as an associate of Esperanza, repaying on time every time. She will use this new loan to invest in her coconut sales by buying some coconut trees (This is the best deal for the people selling coconuts. They buy the tree ready to harvest.) She plans to use the profits to purchase as many things as she can supply for her family and to continue to improve her home. Additionally, in the long term, she would like to save money for a vehicle to move her products and to continue to increase her savings. She would like to thank you all for your support.

There are two photos because we want to show as many faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy coconuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the general store and to make it much bigger

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some tools for his shop and make his work easier

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase modern equipment for his clinic

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and other improtant things for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more wood to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business and buy more materials for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase good quality seed for his land and increase his products.

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en:
Duaa is a young woman from Nablus. She finished high school and took a few courses such as computer literacy and English language.
Duaa took a loan from FATEN to pay for a Business Administration course that will help her find a job easier. Duaa has been applying for jobs since she finished her previous jobs and didn't succeed.

Duaa is photographed in the picture here in FATEN's branch office in Nablus.

loans.use: To pay for courses to improve her skills

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 38-year-old husband from Hebron city. He has been married for a long time and trying to have a baby. Since all remedies didn't work, Ismael wanted to try fertilization clinics.

Ismael took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the treatment that he hopes will give him a child soon. Ismael appears in the picture above in FATEN's branch in Hebron.

loans.use: to cover fertilization clinic expenses

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 46-year-old father of one daughter and seven sons. His daughter is a college student while the rest are school students.

Jalal owns a house that needs a lot of improvements and walls painted. Jalal took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the painting and other improvements.

Jalal was photographed in FATEN's office in Hebron.

loans.use: to improve the house and paint the walls.

loans.name: Andryi

texts.en:
Andryi is married with an 11-year-old daughter. His family lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. He works as a taxi driver and offers transportation services in the Ukraine. He has been in this business for nine years, and his current monthly income is about 5,000 UAH. 

Andryi is a very determined and hard-working man – he sometimes works 24 hours a day. He is trying to invest all his energy in his venture in order to keep it profitable and sustainable. He is hoping to receive a loan of 12,000 UAH to repair his car engine. A more reliable car will help him to reduce his operating costs, as well as enable him to serve more clients, handle tough competition, and expand his business. Profits generated will not only promote continued growth of his business but also provide a good income for his family.

loans.use: to repair his car engine

loans.name: Rosa Elva

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, tiene 66 años de edad, hace varios años tuvo una relación y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, su hija menor vive en su casa con su pequeño nieto de seis años.

Tiene un salón de belleza  pero también se dedica al comercio, vende productos  de belleza por catálogos de Oriflame  cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas, ropa interior de Leoniza y joyas brasileñas de la marca Belesa.   Trabaja todos los días  en su local, vende   al por menor y mayor entregando  las joyas a otras personas para que ellas vendan, sus ventas son a  crédito a 15 días  o a un mes. Lo que es joyas compra en Guayaquil y la otra mercadería la recibe en su local de varios proveedores. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar: perfumes, bisutería, prendas íntimas, joyas brasileras entre  otros productos para abastecer su gabineta y bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio del  mismo  y le gusta por el apoyo que le han brindado. Su sueño es tener una gran joyería.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the large amount of tamarind fruit which once could be found here, the members of the Mujeres Con Esperanza ("Hopeful Women") Communal Bank meet every two weeks.

Here we find Rosa, who is 66 years old. Several years ago she was in a relationship and now has five adult children. Her youngest daughter lives in Rosa's house with Rosa's little six-year-old grandson.

She has a beauty salon where she has a lot of business, but she also makes sales. She sells products by catalog from Oriflame (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for ladies), and lingerie from Leonisa, but what she sells most is Belesa brand Brazilian jewelry. Rosa works everyday, making sales in her shop. She sells both retail and wholesale because she delivers the jewelry to other people so they can sell it. Rosa extends credit to these people on either a two-week or monthly basis. She buys the jewelry in Guayaquil, and the other merchandise is delivered to her shop. The Brazilian jewelry is what she sells most.

Rosa will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, lingerie and Brazilian jewelry among other items. She has been in the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because of the support it has offered her. Her dream is to have a large jewelry store.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, costume jewelry, and lingerie for her business

loans.name: Cinthia Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Cinthia, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, vive con su pareja y una  hija de él con quien se encuentra en la fotografía, nos comenta que aun no tiene  hijos  propios  ya que primero espera terminar sus estudios para poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia. El marido trabaja en una cerrajería.

Se dedica a sus estudios en la carrera de  Ing. Industrial, es para esto que solicito su crédito ya que espera que este le pueda ayudar para los gastos que representa el semestre de estudio, nos cuenta que ya está en octavo semestre y que le faltan solo dos para culminar sus carrera, además de esto ella también le ayuda a su esposo a comprar algunas herramientas que requiere en su trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar libros, hojas, y otros gastos para sus estudios. Está  en el Banco Comunal ya por tres años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the "Mujeres con Esperanza" (Women with Hope) community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo which has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees' owing to the large quantity of tamarind fruit that used to exist there. 

Here we meet Cinthia.  She is 21 years old and lives with her partner and his daughter, who appears in the photo.  The couple don't have any children of their own yet since first she hopes to finish her studies so that she can provide her family with a better future.  Her partner works in the locksmiths trade.

Cinthia is studying industrial engineering.  She is requesting a loan because she hopes that it will help her to cover the expenses that this semester brings.  She tells us that she is in her eighth semester already and that she only has two left until she finishes her course.  In addition to this, she would also like to help her partner by purchasing some tools that he needs in his work.

This loan will be used to buy books, paper and to cover other expenses related to Cinthia's studies.  She has been a member of her community bank for three years and she likes being a member because the payments are easy to make.  Her dreams are to finish her studies and get a good job.

loans.use: to buy books and paper, and to cover other expenses related to her studies

loans.name: Geoconda Jacinta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Geoconda, tiene 40 años de edad, hace varios años tuvo una relación y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 17, 16 y 13 años de edad, el mayor de ellos está en Universidad y los tres restantes están en colegio, todos viven en su casa.

Ella trabaja en las mañanas en una cevicheria pero en las noches de los días sábados, domingos y días  de feria atiende su propio negocio, tiene una carreta en la que vende hot dog y hamburguesas. Nos cuenta que esta es una forma honesta de ganarse la vida y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace tres años y que le ha servido para poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pan, carne, salchichas y otros ingredientes para su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años y gracias al primer crédito puso su negocio. Su sueño es tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres con Esperanza” (Hopeful Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed here back then.

We found Geoconda, 40, here.  She was in a relationship several years ago that produced four children who are 19, 17, 16 and 13 years of age.  The oldest of them is in the university and the last three are in high school; they all live at home.

During the morning she works at a "cevichería" (seafood cocktail shop) but on Saturday and Sunday evenings she tends to her own business: she has a hotdog and hamburger stand.  She tells us that this is an honest way to earn a living that she’s been doing for the last three years and that has made it possible for her to support her family.

She will use this loan to buy bread, meat, sausages and other ingredients for her business.  She’s been in the communal bank for the last three years and thanks to the initial loan she was able to open her business.  Her dream is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy bread, sausages and other ingredients.

loans.name: Carmen Emerita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, ella tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijas aun viven con ella, una está casada y vive con su esposo. Su esposo trabaja en Santa Elena.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa interior por catalogo de la marca Leonisa. Además de productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince,  lo que más vende es la ropa interior de mujer que son muy solicitadas por las damas. Lleva cinco años trabajando en ventas y le ha ido bien. Entre sus planes esta poner una heladería en el centro de la ciudad.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva 7 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha podido financiar en momentos difíciles. Sus sueños son tener su heladería y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres con Esperanza” (Hopeful Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed here back then.

We found Carmen, 60, here.  She’s married and has five children, all adults.  Two of her daughters still live with her; one of them is married and lives with her husband.  Carmen’s husband works in Santa Elena.

She is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income, sells Leonisa brand underwear via catalogue.  She also sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week.  She sells on credit and collects weekly or biweekly.  What she sells the most is women’s underwear; it’s very sought after by the ladies.  She’s been working in sales for five years and has done well.  Her plan is to open in ice cream shop downtown.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear.  She’s been in the communal bank 7 years and likes it because she’s been able to get loans in difficult times.  Her dream is to open her ice cream shop and continue working.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Margoin Yackeline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Margoin, ella tiene  39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad, uno de 14  y otro de 8 años, uno de los mayores es policía y los dos siguientes estudian en colegio, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por tres años y le gusta cómo se trabaja en el Banco.

Ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de productos lácteos, mientras el sale a entregar en su carro ella atiende el negocio en su casa, los productos que venden son: yogurt, quesos y mantequilla, también en su negocio venden bidones de agua, trabajan todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 18h00. Los productos los compran en Portoviejo a comerciantes que entregan al por mayor, llevan seis años que se dedican a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar queso, yogurt, mantequilla, entre otras cosas. Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres con Esperanza” (Hopeful Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed here back then.

We found Margoin, 39, here.  She’s married and has four children; two adults and one who is 14 and another who is 8.  One of the older ones is a police officer and the next two are in high school.  They all still live with her.   Her husband’s a merchant.  She’s been in the communal bank for three years and likes the way the bank operates.

She and her husband sell dairy products.  While he goes out to make deliveries in his car she stays home to tend to the business.  The products they sell are:  yoghurt, cheeses and butter.  She also has bottles of water for sale in her business.  They are open every day from 7am until 6pm.  They buy the products in Portoviejo from wholesalers.  They’ve been in business six years.

This loan is to buy cheese, yoghurt and butter, among other things.  Her dream is to have locale downtown.

loans.use: to buy cheese, yoghurt, butter, etc.

loans.name: Gema Tatiana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gema, ella tiene  24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de dos años de edad. Su esposo es Ing. En Administración Turística. Ella también tiene su titulo en Administración en Empresas Hoteleras.

Ella trabaja en una empresa de acabados de construcción en el área de ventas pero junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de operadora turística, ellos se encargan de organizar viajes para otras personas a cualquier parte de país en la cual incluyen transporte, estadía, guías turísticos entre otras cosas esta empresas se llama Travesía Tour. Nos cuenta que su esposo lleva como tres años en ese campo y que antes trabajaba en sociedad con otras personas pero que hace un año se independizo y esto lo hizo con ayuda de uno de sus créditos que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en crear una página web y en publicidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 4 años y le agrada el fácil acceso a los créditos. Su sueño es que su empresa cope el mercado local y  nacional.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres con Esperanza” (Hopeful Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed here back then.

We found Gema, 24, here.  She’s married and has a two-year-old child.  She is a Travel Agent and also has a degree in Hotel Administration.

She’s employed in a construction firm in the sales department but together with her husband she has a travel agency.  They organize trips for other people to any part of the country that include transportation, lodging and tour guides, among other things.  Their agency is called “Travesía Tour.”   She tells us that her husband has been in this line of work for about three years.  He used to be in partnership with others but a year ago he became independent thanks to one of the loans he got from the institution.

She will use this loan to create a web page and to pay for publicity.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes the ease of access to loans.  Her dream is that their agency secures the local and national markets.

loans.use: To create a web page and to pay for publicity.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marcelina is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marcelina is 57 years old and has one child in school.

Marcelina has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more rice grains to sell.

For 11 years, Marcelina has been in this business. In the future, Marcelina would like to expand her business and send her children to school.

The accompanying photo shows Marcelina posing with her current inventory of rice stocks. She buys her stocks from small farmers, who usually store rice using recycled feed sacks to minimize costs.

loans.use: to purchase more rice grains to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khun P. (in the photo with her loom) is a silk weaver. Her husband is a wooden house builder. The couple is elderly, but they are still strong enough to work. They live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Khun asked for a Kiva loan once before, she is now asking for another loan of $300 in order to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: to build a restroom for family use

loans.name: Ouk's Group

texts.en:
Five people make up a group loan. Mr. Ouk is the group leader and he was selected as the group leader by the other members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the money to help support their different purposes. 

Mr. Ouk was born in 1979 and he is a married man.  He is a flower and banana seller who is only able to earn a small income to support his family,and he also helps his wife with farming. In order to increase their income and improve the family’s standard of living, Mr. Ouk would like to ask for a loan to buy more flowers and bananas to sell. His wife, Mrs. Noun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses for growing different vegetables. This couple has two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: to buy more flowers and bananas to sell

loans.name: Chak's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty-four members who hope that they can use their portions to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Chak, born in 1964, was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Chak is a farmer who owns a 1.20-hectare plot of land which she uses to grow rice for a living. She would like to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to support her crop growing. Her husband is a vice village chief who is able to earn a small salary to support their family, and he also helps his wife with farming. The couple has four children: one works for a mobile company and the other three are students who also assist with farming.

loans.use: To buy a water machine to support her crop growing

loans.name: You's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen members who hope that their portions will help increase their income to improve their families' standard of living. Mr. You, born in 1943, was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mr. You and his wife are farmers who own a 1.30-hectare plot of land which they use to grow rice. In order to support this activity, Mr. You would like to ask for a loan to buy more seeds for cultivating rice. Aside from farming, they also earn a living by making and selling Chinese noodles and Mr. You would use the rest of the loan to buy more rice to increase production. He is also a village chief who is able to earn a small amount of income to help support his family. The couple has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy seeds for cultivating rice

loans.name: Marie Fe

texts.en: Marie Fe is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and a fishing/fish vending businesses. Her husband Jonathan, who is 30 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 2 and 5 years old. Marie Fe joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marie Fe has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000 to buy additional stock for the store to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and business improvement. Marie Fe is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn S. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling snack foods , candies and biscuits in her community. She is a 35-year-old married woman from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. Roselyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Roselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and beverages. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is a married woman who lives in Sta. Fe, in the island of Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  buying and selling coconut, hog fattening and also works as a real-estate agent.  Her husband Victor, who is 45 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are between 6 and 21 years old. 

Rose Marie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rose Marie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she could sustain her business activities: buy more coconut to resell and buy feed for the pigs. Rose Marie is working hard so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Rose Marie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more coconut to resell and buy feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old and married. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling daily use products such as canned goods, snack foods and beverages in her community. Elizabeth has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Bellarina

texts.en:
Bellarina P. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old and married. To make a living, Bellarina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, snack foods, and beverages in the local community. Bellarina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Bellarina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bellarina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack food. This loan will be Bellarina's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improv and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is a 44-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a hog-raising business. She lives in Narra, Palawan. Gemma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000 to buy additional piglets to raise so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Gemma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Siep's Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up this village bank loan. Each member will use their portion of the loan to support different purposes. Mrs. Siep, born in 1959, was selected as the village bank president by its members. 

Mrs. Siep and her husband, Mr. Hay, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate different vegetables to make a living. They also earn income by selling morning glory. With their occupations, they still do not earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Siep would like to ask for a loan to buy rice for food intake. The couple has two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice for sustenance

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is married to H. M. who works in the fields and grows different seasonal crops. He is a very hardworking person and works full-time to get good crops from his land. He then harvests the crops and sells to different shops and people to earn profits for his family. Surriya doesn’t have any child. She spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also helps her husband with his work. 

Surriya lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan, famous for its agriculture. She's been living in a two-room brick house with her family in the Shanti Nagar area for the past many years. 

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for his field to get good crops. Surriya has a lot of confidence that her husband will be able to earn good profits after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In her previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting. In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for an agriculture business.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a local eatery. Her husband Prudencio, who is 66 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 29 and 44 years old. Felicitas joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Felicitas has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy utensils and use as additional capital for her local eatery business so that she can continue to save up for future house repair. Felicitas is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase utensils

loans.name: Min's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen members who will use their portions to support different purposes. Mrs. Min, born in 1962, was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Min and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice for a living. With their farming, they still do not earn enough income to support their family. In order to improve their family’s condition, Mrs. Min would like to ask for a loan to buy chickens for breeding. The couple has seven children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and the other five are students who also help their parents with farming.

loans.use: To buy chickens for breeding

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is a resident of Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 15 years in the area of Shanti nagar. She is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very active lady and performs her duties very well. Her husband’s name is H. and he is a daily wage laborer. 
Robina is the mother of two sons and four daughters. Her elder son has a business selling animals. He buys young animals, raises them and sells them to butchers and other people. Robina also helps her son handle his business. She takes care of his cattle and gives them timely food and water. Her remaining five children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Robina is very concerned about their education. She wants them to complete their education and become successful in their lives. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy animals like goats and sheep to sell for profit. He has been operating this business for the past five years and is confident that a loan investment will help him to increase his profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats for animal-selling business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta is a married woman who lives in Madredijos, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store and buying and selling dried fish. Her common-law husband Vergelio, who is 49 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  She has three children who are between 23 and 32 years old. Marieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marieta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Marieta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy B. is from the village of Arwas Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Juvy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Juvy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juvy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman who lives in Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Nelson, who is 59 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 35 and 40 years old. 

Norma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nelida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, to purchase more stock so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion and family needs. Norma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela lives in Khanewal, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Shanti nagar for the past six years. She is married to K.. K. is an electrician by profession and offers electrical repair services to his clients. He is an expert in his field and satisfies his clients with his work. He has been operating this business for the past five years. 
Jameela has three children. All of them are below 10 years old and do not attend school because Jameela can’t afford their school fee. She is very active and supportive in nature. She operates a business selling animals. She buys young animals from the animal market, raises them and sells them to butchers and other people. She operates her business from her home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the latest repair tools to provide better quality services to his clients and to earn better profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will bring good profits to her husband.  Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Jameela”.

loans.use: to buy the latest repair tools

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling vegetables. She lives in Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,600. Corazon is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell.  This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Corazon aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres A. is from the village of Rang-Ayan, Mallig, Isabela. He is 58 years old. Andres is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Andres owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Andres has been engaged in his business for over 38 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Andres joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andres has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Andres is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to renovate an existing shelter for his pigs. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Andres from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate a shelter for his pigs

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en: Tumenbayar, 26, is married and lives with his wife and a son in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His wife is taking care of their son by taking a break from her college studies. He has been operating a photography and printing studio for the last four years. He rents a studio located near a main road, which is an advantage for him to operate a successful business. He has initiative and is a hardworking person who says, "I want to expand my business and buy an apartment where we can have a comfortable life in the future". He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a printing machine for his business.

loans.use: to buy a printer

loans.name: Phim's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen members who will use their portions to support different purposes. Mrs. Phim, born in 1971, was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Phim is a farmer who owns a pL. of land on which she grows rice for a living. Her husband is a well digger who is able to earn a small amount of income to help support their family. In order to support her husband's activity, Mrs. Phim would like to ask for a loan to buy raw materials for digging. The couple has four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other three are students who also help with their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her husband's well digging

loans.name: Hort's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven people who will all will use their money to support their different purposes. The members selected Mrs. Hort as village bank president.

Hort and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice and corn to support their family. They do not have enough money to sustain their farming. Therefore, Hort would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to grow rice and corn. This couple has five children: one is employed and four are students who also help their parents with the farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives in Sahiwal, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a four-room brick house for the past 40 years. She is a widow and lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her but she never lost hope. She worked very hard and raised her children with great effort. 

Now her sons have grown and they do work to financially support the family. Her eldest son works in a factory while the younger one works in the field and grows different seasonal crops. Two of her other three children are enrolled in school and are getting their education. Her youngest son, whose name is Waseem, stays at home. 

Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s agriculture business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers, seeds etc to grow better crops and earn more profits. He has been operating this business for the past four years and Shamim is hopeful that a loan investment will bring more profits to him. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

Note: "In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim".

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & seeds

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez has been living in Sahiwal for the past 15 years with her family in a single-room brick house. Sahiwal is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture and cattle farming. She is 42 years of age and has given birth to two sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school getting their education. Her husband’s name is A. H. and he is a blacksmith by profession. He makes iron boxes (used to keep clothes, quilts and blankets and usually used in houses) and sells through his shop.
