He is an expert and has a good name in this industry in his area. Kaneez herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very supportive lady and tries her best to provide relief to her family with her work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. He will use the loan money to purchase iron and other required materials in larger quantities to make a larger number of iron boxes. This will help him fulfill orders on time and make more profit. Kaneez is confident that an investment in her husband’s business will be a good step towards its growth and her family will be able to have a better standard of life as a result. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kaneez”.

loans.use: To buy iron and other required materials

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. is a 27-year-old man who has been living in the province of Siem Reap. To earn a living, he is a boat deliver for villagers and other passengers who wish to cross the river. He has been operating this business since 2005, earning around $5 in profit per day. He has other income from his wife who sells items in a wooden kiosk next to the house. The products which his wife regularly sells are soft drinks, candy, shampoo, cooking ingredients and other necessary items. His wife’s business is progressing well step by step, and she wants to increase her business capital in order to buy more essential items to sell. Touch S. will use his loan to support his wife's business.

loans.use: to assist his wife's business by purchasing more essential items to sell.

loans.name: Urantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Urantsetseg is 40 years old.  She lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two daughters attend a secondary school. Mrs. Urantsetseg is an optician. Since 1999, she has been selling glasses.  A few years ago she bought optical instruments and started running as a private optician. She fits optical lenses and also sells different fashion and sunglasses to customers. She has been in this business for many years and has lots of trusted customers. She is planning to extend her business by opening one more service point in the future. 

Mrs. Urantsetseg’s family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar city. She is building a house for her family at the moment and she is planning to complete it before the autumn of 2011. She is asking for the loan to complete the building project and to use in her business to buy more lenses and frames for glasses.

loans.use: to complete a building project and to buy more lenses and frames for glasses

loans.name: Thuong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuong, born in 1968, and her husband are farmers. They own a plot of land and grow corn and rice to make a living. They do not have enough money for their farm. Thus, Thuong would like to ask for a loan to buy gasoline and fertilizers for growing crops. Aside from farming, they also earn a living by making coffee to sell. This couple has four children: one is a teacher, one is a farmer, one is attending a local school, and the youngest one is 4 years old.

This village bank consists of nine members. Mrs. Thuong is the village bank president selected by the other members. Each member of this village bank will use their money for different purposes.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and fertilizers for growing crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida hopes that her loan application through Asasah will benefit her husband to a great extent in his transport business. 

Her husband owns a rickshaw. Through it he provides transport services to passengers and to schoolchildren. His rickshaw has grown old and it needs repair. With the loan, he will buy a new body for the rickshaw and also repair its engine. This will help him provide better transport services to the passengers and earn better profits.

Sajida is 44 years of age.  She is a housewife who was married many years ago.  Since then, she has lived in Sahiwal in a 2 room brick house with her family. Sahiwal is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.   Sajida has given birth to 5 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Sajida.

loans.use: to change the body and repair the engine of a rickshaw

loans.name: Nhem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of nine members. Mrs. Nhem, a married woman, was born in 1981; she is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this group will use their money to achieve their different goals. 

Nhem and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow corn and rice. In order to support this farming, Nhem would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing crops. Aside from being a farmer, her husband is also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. This couple has two children: one is attending a local school and the younger one is only four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing crops.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch P. is a thirty-nine-year-old married woman who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Touch P. and her husband are rice farmers. They manage to earn a small income by growing different kinds of crops on their farmland, such as cabbages and morning glories, which they sell to their regular customers every two or three months when the plants mature. 

This couple has four single children, and most of them are studying in local schools. In the past, Touch P. has been working at rebuilding her broken fence, but it is still not complete because of lack of money. In order to finish building the fence, Touch P. would like to request some funds from Kiva to add to her personal savings to complete her fence. She hopes to use the rest of the money to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: To complete her fence and buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Heam's Group

texts.en:
Ten people make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Heam, a married woman, was born in 1983 and is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. The members of this loan group will use their money to support their different purposes. 

Heam and her husband are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land which they use to cultivate rice and corn to sell to support the family. They presently do not have enough money to grow their crops. Thus, Heam would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing crops. Aside from being a farmer, her husband also earns their living by making mouse-traps for sale. This couple has a child who is 4 years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing crops.

loans.name: Sar's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine members. Mrs. Sar, a married woman, was born in 1976 and is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this loan group will use their money to support their different purposes. 

Sar and her husband are farmers who own a 1.80-hectare plot of land which they use to cultivate rice and corn. In order to support this farming activity, Sar would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing crops. Aside from being farmers, they are also fishermen who are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has three children: one is seamstress in a garment factory and the other two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing crops.

loans.name: Ruqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqiya resides in a small city called Sahiwal.  It is located in Punjab, Pakistan in an area known for its agricultural industry.  She has been living there with her family in a 2 room brick house for past 20 years. 

She is 45 years of age, a housewife who stays at home and does her household work.  She has great administrative skills and manages her household expenses very well.  Her husband’s name is M. A. and he is involved in agriculture and works in the fields.  He grows different seasonal crops and sells them to the various customers.
   
Ruqiya is the mother of 7 children.  Her eldest son works in a leather factory, younger son works with his father in his fields and also operates a welding business in the market.  Her other children are enrolled in a local school to get their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s agriculture business.  With the loan, he will buy fertilizers, seeds etc to get better results from his land and make more profits. Ruqiya is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow further by investing loan money into it which will result in better living standards for her family. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ruqiya”.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for the family farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has a mixed farm in Nkubu town in eastern Kenya that produces bananas, milk, coffee, tomatoes and passion fruits that are all sold locally.  He has been in the farming business for eight years now. 

He has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry farm. This loan will enable him to buy chickens, chicken feed and also construct a poultry unit.  The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children.  His primary challenges in this business have been a lack of proper markets for his products, animal diseases and the high cost of animal feeds.

David is 33 years old and married with 2 children ages 2 and 9.

loans.use: To start a poultry farm.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida has been living in Sahiwal for past 15 years with her family in a 2 room brick house.  Sahiwal is a small city of Pakistan that is known for its agriculture and cattle farming.  She is 41 years of age and has given birth to 6 children.  All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education except the youngest daughter who is only 1 year old and a son who is 5 years old. 

Her husband’s name is M. S. and he is a farmer by profession.  He owns a little piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops.  He then cultivates them and sells to different shops and people for profit.  His land is very fertile and he gets good crops from it every year. 

Abida is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  She is a very active lady and is raising her children with great care. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business.  By utilizing the loan money he will buy fertilizers and seeds to grow even better crops and make more profits. 

She is very hopeful that her husband will be able to get maximum results from his agriculture business after making a loan investment into it. 
She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  She is hopeful that it will result in improving the financial condition for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for the family farm.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, 38, is married with four school-aged children who all attend school. She is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya where she has been practicing mixed farming for eighteen years. Her farm produces bananas, maize, potatoes, beans and milk which are all sold locally.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to upgrade her banana farm. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children and also improve her family's livelihood. She plans to acquire another piece of land and also start a retail shop in the next five years. Her biggest challenges have been the lack of enough water and diseases which affect her production.

loans.use: to upgrade her banana farm.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie P. is from the village of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is 47 years old. Elvie is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing business, catching fish for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishing net to be be used for expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Mareza

texts.en:
Mareza P. is from the village of Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Mareza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she provides motorcycle transportation to the  local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $60 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mareza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

Mareza is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle  and purchase other accessories needed such as raincoat to provide better service. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle and purchase other accessories needed such as raincoat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P. is from the village of Casusan Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Norma is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma raises pigs to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over nineteen years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets and feeds. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by rice retailing. Her husband Ricardo, who is 48 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 8 and 24 years old. Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers so that she can continue to save up for future improvement and expansion of her business. Grace is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more rice

loans.name: Azizaan

texts.en:
Azizaan is 51 years old and has given birth to four sons. Her eldest son sells used clothes and sweaters while the second one operates a power loom business. Her remaining two sons are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband’s name is M. R. and he is also involved in a power loom business. Through it, he makes thread and supplies it to different textile firms and factories on order. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her elder son who wants to further expand his business. With the loan, he will buy more sweaters and used clothes to sell through his shop.  He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Azizaan is hopeful that an investment will further improve it. 

Azizaan is a caring lady and completes her responsibilities of a housewife very well and makes the utmost effort to provide ease to her family by fulfilling their needs. She lives in Kasur, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, and famous for its leather industry. She has been living there in a two-room house in the area of Bhatta Sohan Din for the past sixteen years.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en:
Arkadi T. is 26 years old. He lives in Vanadzor with his parents and his grandparents. Ten years ago Arkadi and his brother started their own business. Arkadi’s brother made men’s shoes and Arkadi sold them from a rented stall. Now Arkadi runs his business independently. He buys shoes from Yerevan twice a month, and also buys from Vanadzor city’s shoe production departments and resells them.
    
Arkadi is seeking an 800,000 AMD loan to buy spring shoes to resell. This is Arkadi’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy spring shoes to resell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman who lives in Madredijos, Bantayan Cebu. She has a stall in the market where she cooks and sells barbecued food: chicken, port, etc. She also buys and sells dried squid to augment her income. Her husband Jerson, who is 36 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are between 3 and 13 years old. 

Emma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to purchase ingredients for her food business as well as buy more stocks of dried squid to resell. Emma is working hard so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Emma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food production business and buy more dried squid

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a dairy unit and purchase a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Sabran

texts.en:
Sabran lives in a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur. Kasur is famous for its tanneries industry. She has been living there in a single-room brick house with her family for the past three years. She is 33 years old, married to M. A., and has five children. Only two of them are able to get an education due to the financial constraints of Sabran and her husband. 

Both Sabran and her husband make and sell sweaters. They prepare them through thread machines and sell to different shops. Sabran also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She takes care of her children with great responsibility. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who wants to buy thread in bulk to make sweaters in larger quantities. This will help him in completing the larger orders on time and make more profit. Sabran is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: to buy thread in bulk for making sweaters.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a Ready to Wear (RTW) clothing business and a general store.  She lives in Lapu-Lapu, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Ready to Wear (RTW) and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Gina is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Choup

texts.en: Choup S., 51, is a modest villager living in Phnom Penh City, the capital of Cambodia. She currently lives with her niece who is employed as a sewing worker. She was married, but she divorced her husband many years ago and has no children. Since 2008, Choup S. runs a business selling different kinds of Khmer cake. She is able to earn an income of on average $2 each day. Choup S. is applying for this loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Jennery

texts.en:
Jennery is a 25-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a tailoring business and a snack vending business.  She lives in the island of Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her tailoring and selling of snacks businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Jennery is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase materials and equipment for her tailoring business.   

This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jennery aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment for tailoring

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik M. is an economist, and she lives in Ijevan with two sons, a daughter-in-law and a grandchild. Her older son graduated from the Ijevan College and now helps Hasmik in her business. The younger one studies at the Yerevan Police Academy.
 
Hasmik has her own business which she runs in her private shop where she sells food, flour and animal feed. With the income from her business Hasmik keeps her family and pays for her younger son’s education. 

This is Hasmik’s third loan from Nor Horizon and second loan from Kiva. Now Hasmik needs a loan of 1.000.000 AMD to buy flour and fodder to sell.

loans.use: To buy flour and fodder to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store, a food production sales business and a trisikad transport business.  She lives in Lapu-Lapu, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, food production sales and trisikad transport businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,400. Lorna is borrowing PHP 18,000 to purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lorna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than K., 49, is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector since 1979. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland. They also harvest and sell their mature produce around three months after they began planting. From this business, they can generate an income of around $3.50 USD per day. 

This humble couple has four children; three are single and one is married. Two of their daughters have been working in a garment factory and have a formal salary. Than K. is taking out her loan to buy a used motorbike, which will enable her daughters to ride to their workplace.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her daughters to ride to work.

loans.name: Roqueta

texts.en: Roqueta is a 49-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Lapu-lapu, Cebu. Roqueta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Roqueta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy soft drinks, rice, canned goods etc for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Roqueta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, canned goods, etc for her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran, 44 years old and married to S. A., is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is 19 years old and has a business operating a power loom, while her second son sells used clothes (sweaters) along with his parents. They reside in a small city called Kasur, located in Punjab, Pakistan and famous for its leather industry.

S. A. takes orders from various shops, supplying them with sweaters in the required quantity. His business is going well and earns good profits. Sughran helps her husband by sorting the sweaters so he can more efficiently supply his customers. She also ably discharges her responsibilities as a housewife.

Sughan has applied for her first loan in order to help her husband expand his business, as he will use it to buy used clothes (sweaters) in bulk. She is hopeful that the loan will help to more firmly establish the enterprise and result in increased income.

loans.use: to buy used clothes (sweaters)to sell

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture above, Khorn R. is a 30-year-old farmer residing in a rural area of Kompong Tom Province. She raises some pigs in a pigpen behind her house. Eventually, she sells her pigs to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. Beside this work, she has also been planting rice crops; that is her annual business. Her husband is a fisherman as well as a firewood seller.

 Khorn R. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy a cow to plow their farmland and transport firewood to sell in the marketplace. Khorn R. has five single children of whom three are attending school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow the farmland and transport firewood to sell in the marketplace.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 53-year-old widow who supports her family by selling religious articles and making candles. She lives in Bogo, Cebu. Aida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 to buy candles, talo, and plastic so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Aida is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase new religious articles to sell

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en: Cyrus is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya, where he has been farming for twenty years. Cyrus is 55 years old and married with three children between the ages of 12 and 27. Two of his children are currently attending school. Cyrus employs two farmhands and sells his coffee and bananas to the local market. He solely depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank. He says that this water tank will help him save enough water for farming, especially during the dry seasons, and this will improve his production. He would like to irrigate his farm in future and also increase his production of bananas and french beans. Drought has been his biggest challenge in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Conielyn

texts.en: Conielyn is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a tricycle transport. Her husband Teodoro, who is 40 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 8 months and 10 years old. Conielyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Conielyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 4,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy tires and spare parts so that she could continue to save up for future education of her children. Conielyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Azran

texts.en:
Azran lives in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan called Kasur. Kasur is famous for its tannery industry. She has been living there in a three room brick house with her family for past seven years. Azran is 51 years old, married to S. A. and has four sons. Her three eldest sons have a power loom business while the youngest stays at home. Azran is unable to provide them with an education due to financial constraints. 

Azran and her husband are involved in a used clothing (sweaters) selling business. S. A. has good business contacts in the market and he sells a good number of sweaters every month for handsome profits. Azran is also a very good housewife and fulfills her responsibilities as a mother and wife very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy used clothes (sweaters) in larger quantity to sell and to increase their profits. Azran is hopeful that this loan will help her husband further improve the business. She is a new loan user.

loans.use: to buy sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a furniture making business. Her husband Rene, who is 59 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 18 and 25 years old. Josefina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josefina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy wood, plywood nails, etc. so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Josefina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase wood, plywood nails, etc. for making furniture

loans.name: Zisa Belen

texts.en:
Zisa Belen B. is from the village of Proper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is 27 years old. Zisa Belen is married and has an infant. To make a living, Zisa Belen owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty products in the local community. Zisa Belen has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2011, Zisa Belen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zisa Belen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase hair pins, combs, celphone accessories, bracelets and other products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Zisa Belen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase hair pins, combs, celphone accessories, bracelets and other products for sale

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by selling food products. Her husband Alexander, who is 47 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 11 and 24 years old. Marilou joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilou has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 3,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy rice, sugar, plastic and soft drinks so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Marilou is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, plastic and soft drinks

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice M. is from the village of Makawa Aloran, Mis. Occ.. She is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Janice owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Janice has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Janice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janice is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Janice from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He's been farming for four years. He is involved in the business of producing milk, which he sells to a local dairy collection center. He is 33 years old and married with two children, aged 5 and 7 years, both of whom attend school.

He has requested a loan of 78,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle, which he will use to supply milk to the local market. He says that his major challenge has been poor road network in the area which increases the cost of maintaining a motorcycle. He says that if capital will be available in the future, he would like to venture into milk processing business e.g yogurt, cheese and butter.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Bolorchuluun

texts.en: Bolorchuluun D. is 47 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school.  They live in Arhangai province in Mongolia on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past eight years. They have a decent standard of living. Bolorchuluun began operating a clothing trading business in 2005. She has been operating her business so successfully that she could increase her working capital from 1,000,000 MNT to 8,000,000 MNT. She has gained a lot of experience with many regular customers and was able to open a food store. She is a hardworking and honest person who says, " I want to expand my business more and increase my profit." She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam H., age 43, earns a living by selling fish. She sells fish that she buys from other fishermen at a reasonable price. She currently earns an average of US$2.80 a day, and she has been running her business for over ten years. Her husband is 59 years old and he is highly skilled at building wooden houses. Nam H. is the mother of eight children, four of whom are single. The other four are married and live in their own houses. Three of her children are working at various occupations, and they contribute some of their income to help the family meet its daily expenses. Nam H. would like to ask for a loan to buy the carpenter’s plane machine for her husband to provide his business activity.

loans.use: To buy a planning machine for her husband to provide his business activity.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en: Monina is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Eldefonso, who is 48 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  They have two children who are 20 and 22 years old. Monina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Monina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Monina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Almarie

texts.en:
Almarie D. is from the village of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is 37 years old.  Almarie is married and has 3 school-aged children.  Almarie owns & operates a fishing business, catching & selling wild-caught fish.  Almarie has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Almarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Almarie is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Almarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Joseph, who is 48 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 7 and 26 years old. Myrna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myrna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy additional items to resell to customers so that she can continue to save up for the future education of children and improvement of her business. Myrna is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn S. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Merlyn is married and has 4 school-aged children.  Merlyn owns & operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Oyunsuren

texts.en: Oyunsuren, 37, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia,. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband works as a salesperson for a company where he gets paid 500,000 monthly. Her three older children attend a local secondary school while the younger two go to kindergarten. Oyunsuren holds a degree as an engineer and economist. She worked for a company from 2005 to 2009 and began her own business in 2010. She rents a stall at a trading center where she sells curtains and curtain accessories. She pays 300,000 MNT for the monthly rent of the stall. Her current total working capital is 2,000,000 MNT and daily net income is 100,000 MNT. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, "I  am trying to expand my business and enlarge my stall". She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy more curtains for her business.

loans.use: To buy more curtains

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Jocelyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a general store. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase goods like rice and corn grits, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk and coffee . This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase goods like rice and corn grits, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk and coffee

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem C. is a 49-year-old widowed mother caring for four single children. All of her children are still living in the family home and are employed at different jobs. Her husband died of senility years ago. She is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector since her children were very young. 

Currently, she owns a piece of land, on which she cultivates different kinds of crops to earn a living. Usually, Sem C. generates around $1 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. Sem C. says that she and her family cannot live in comfort in their house because some lattices are getting old and broken. In order to solve the problem, Sem C. would like to buy some lattices used for flooring her broken-down house. Sem C. and her young child are show in the photo.

loans.use: To buy some lattice flooring for her broken-down house.
